116001.name: Black & Bruised
116001.description:
Black & Bruised is a boxing-based fighting video game. but to the fighters in Black & Bruised, boxing is no game; it's a matter of survival. Nineteen outrageous characters fight their way through grueling slugfests to win the pot or settle a score. You'll play through their intertwining stories as they battle each other in 21 different arenas. During each match, you can earn power-ups such as Armor, AutoSlip, Vamp, or Fire Damage to give your fighter a competitive advantage over your opponent.

Source: Wikipedia, "Black & Bruised", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116003.name: Coin Table
116003.description:
Abstract:
A strategy game for two players in which each attempts to control the most space on the hexagonal table by placing and flipping coins.

Overview:

Board: A hexagonal board divided up into a number of hexagons, resembing a honeycomb. Standard board size has 61 hexagon spaces measuring 1.25 inch across arranged in a hexagon shape, with each side of the board the length of five hexagon spaces and the middle of the board being nine hexagon spaces wide if measured between any two opposite corners. Non standard boards may be used, as long as the shape is a true hexagon.

Pieces: 100 coins with distinctive heads and tails markings. Standard coins are the same size and weight as US pennies, with each face painted a distinctive color.
Coins may also be used in place of standard game coins.

Objective: to control the most spaces on the hexagonal board.

Rules:
1. For two players. Players alternate turns. Each player chooses a color or coin face On a player's turn, he may do one of the following:

A: place a coin on any space on the hexagon spaces on the board, with his own color or his own face up.

B: touch a coin that is already on the board. see "touching a coin"

C: Flip a coin of his opponents over to his own color(or face). see "flipping a coin"

D: make a castle. see "making a castle".

2. The last coin that has been put on the board, flipped, or touched cannot be flipped. It is "safe" until another coin has been put on the board, touched or flipped.

3. The game ends when all spaces on the board are filled. Count up the number of spaces each player controls. The player who controls the most spaces wins.

TOUCHING A COIN
On your turn, if you choose, you may touch a coin with your finger. That coin cannot be flipped until another coin has been touched, flipped, or put on the board. Use this to defend a coin for one turn.

FLIPPING A COIN
A coin of an opponents color may be flipped to your color if These criteria are met:
A: You have two coins of your color/face on hexagonal spaces adjoining the coin you want to flip
B: The coin is not "safe"(has been put on the board, flipped, or touched on the opponent's most recent turn.
C: The coin is not part of a castle.

MAKING A CASTLE:
If there are three coins of your color on adjoining spaces arranged in a triangle, you can place a coin on top of those three to make a castle*. Now these coins cannot be flipped for the entire game. A coin can be part of more than one castle, as long as the coin making the castle is placed on top of three coins on the board.

Note that only one coin may be flipped or placed per turn. A castle will take a minimum of 4 turns to build.

116004.name: Bleach: Blade Battlers
116004.description:
Bleach: Blade Battlers (ＢＬＥＡＣＨ　～ブレイド・バトラーズ～) is a fighting game released only in Japan on the manga and anime Bleach by Tite Kubo. The games became best-seller in Japan.

The player takes control of one of many characters from the source material. As with most other fighting games, the idea is to fight the opposing character, or characters in the free-for-all mode, until their health is fully depleted. Players can use their characters' special abilities taken from the series, such as Ichigo Kurosaki's ability to unlock his bankai state or Rukia Kuchiki's control over ice with her zanpakutō. Some of these abilities may alter the arena, such as Rukia's zanpakutō causing the battlefield to become covered in ice and making other players slide around.

The game features extensive battle modes, where you unlock characters after beating all of the challenges. Some missions have you perform under certain circumstances, like a time limit. In both games there is a bonus section where you can view character models and extras.

The game features 23 playable characters.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bleach: Blade Battlers", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116005.name: Bleach: Blade Battlers 2
116005.description:
Bleach: Blade Battlers 2 (ＢＬＥＡＣＨ　～ブレイド・バトラーズ～) is a fighting game released only in Japan and based on the manga and anime Bleach by Tite Kubo.

In Blade Battlers 2, specials attacks have been changed into special forms, resulting in the altering of area obstacles such as random attacks from summonings, shifting the area, etc.

As with the first game, there are many battle modes, where you unlock characters after beating all of the challenges. Some missions have you perform under certain circumstances, like a time limit. In both games there is a bonus section where you can view character models and extras.

Blade Battlers 2nd features 36 playable characters.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bleach: Blade Battlers", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116006.name: CHIP-A-TAK
116006.description:
Chip-A-Tak is an abstract, checkers-like game that allows both capture and recapture of an opponent's pieces. Unlike checkers, Chip-A-Tak employs a dice roll to determine the number of spaces that a player may move his chips as he attempts to reach the other side of the board.

Originally intended as a gambling game, Chip-A-Tak includes rules for wagering and for repurchasing captured chips using either actual currency or the imitation money included with the game.

Chip-A-Tak is played on an 8x10 checkers-style board, with each player having a rear row of 8 spaces filled with chips and an adjacent row with the center four spaces filled.

116008.name: Jambo! Safari: Animal Rescue
116008.description:
Become a Safari Park Ranger in a wild action packed African adventure!

Embark on an exotic, action packed journey across your African Safari Park and complete missions to become a fully qualified ranger.

Take on challenges in a variety of Land Rover vehicles to rescue wild animals with your lasso and bring them back to The Ranch. Nurse your animals back to full health in the enclosure before releasing them back to the wild. Packed with realistic environments to explore, exciting challenges, customisation, photography and collectables, Jambo! Safari is a wild new adventure on Nintendo DS and Wii.

Key features:

• Take on the role of an African Safari Park Ranger. Venture out in your vehicle to rescue wild animals with your lasso.

• Interactive animal enclosure to name, care for and track your animal after it has been released.

• Take on missions including animal rescues, photography and tourist sight seeing tours.

• Extensive level of customisation including characters, costumes, items and vehicle upgrades as you progress through the game.

• Explore over three exotic locations across many levels.

• Monitor released animals via real time map positions and check health statistics.

Source: The Publisher Website.

116009.name: Safari dans les Pays de la Loire
116009.description:
Cultural and historical quizz about a french district.
Players must reach the finish (Nantes) by rolling dice and answering questions.
For each error a player set back one space (city) and must answer an other question (we go back 3 spaces maximum).
For a good answer, the player stay in the city and the next player take its turn.

116010.name: La bonne réponse
116010.description:
"Try and guess" game : 52 cards having a question and a letter.
Each player try to answer a question with a word beginning with one of its letter.
This will give the next question.

The first player who play its last card wins the game

116011.name: Blood+: One Night Kiss
116011.description:
Blood+: One Night Kiss is based on the Blood+ (pronounced as "Blood Plus"), an anime series produced by Production I.G and Aniplex and directed by Junichi Fujisaku. This game and its sequel is currently only available in Japan and has not been licensed for release in any other countries.

The game features cel-shaded graphics in the same style as Killer7 and is set in the fictional town of Shikishi. Players spend most of the game playing as Saya, occasionally switching to Aoyama, an original character created for the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Blood : One Night Kiss", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116013.name: Darkest December: Battle of the Bulge
116013.description:
(NOTE: This is an ASL expansion. A game of similar title is published for the ATS system by the same publisher).

From the publisher:
"Darkest December is a detailed ASL comp variant module that tells the story of the Battle of the Bulge from the perspective of the 3rd US armored division, facing down the vaunted 116 Panzer Division. Hitler's Wacht Am Rhein offensive was under way, and the yanks of the 3rd Armored, along with engineers from the 23rd and 51st engineer battalions faced the 'Greyhound' Panzer Division and the 560th Volksgrenadier Division - and were soon cordoned off form friendly lines...."

The module includes three historical maps, two counter sheets and 20 scenarios.

116014.name: Scene It? Bright Lights! Big Screen!
116014.description:
Scene It? Bright Lights! Big Screen! is a trivia video game developed by Artifical Mind and Movement and published by Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment (WBIE), and part of the Scene It? series of games. It was released for Xbox 360, PlayStation 3 and Wii on November 17, 2009 in North America, and in December 2009 in Europe and Australia. The game features puzzles from high-grossing films at the time and from films considered the best.

Source: Wikipedia, "Scene It? Bright Lights! Big Screen!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116015.name: Game News (Issue 1 - Mar 1985)
116015.description:
On the cover: a cross-section of typical adult games highlights our premiere issue. Design by Sharon Hart and Rick McClury. Photography by Rick McClury.

GAME NEWS is devoted exclusively to adult games and game-related products. GAME NEWS reviews current releases of role-games, war games, general adult games, and surveys new gaming miniatures. GAME NEWS also features cartoons, modules and scenarios, supplements, play-aids, "how-to" tips, and other information to make playing games more fun.

-from the contents page

116016.name: FREE-O Card Game
116016.description: This card game is based on the FREE THE BOX board game (now available for purchase!). It is a very easy game to learn and also very addictive for younger players who it is designed for. The idea is that you are hiding in your neighborhood and another team is trying to find and capture you. Deal cards to all players and, in turn, play a “Seek and Match” card (house, mailbox, fence, etc.) to try and capture your opponents. They have to match the same card or play a “Capture” card or a “Wild” card to escape capture. Each round ends when one player finishes their hand and all other players add points for any left-over cards. The game ends when one player reaches 60 points but the lowest score wins the game.

116017.name: Indian Shoot
116017.description:
Shooting target game. The target is unusual, as it stands on a tripod and spins freely. When the Red Indian target is hit, the targets spins around.

Most hits, wins

116018.name: Snoopy And The Red Baron
116018.description:
Back of the Box

The war rages on. SNOOPY - our fearless World War I flying ace - and his trusty Sopwith Camel challenge the notorious Red Baron in an aerial duel of sweet revenge. SNOOPY'S mission? To bring the Baron down and recover the allies' stolen treats!

116019.name: That's Life!
116019.description:
That's Life! was a magazine-style television series on BBC1 which aired from 1973 to 1994, presented by Esther Rantzen (1940 - ) throughout the entire run. Esther features on the box for this game. The show concerned itself with consumer problems and complaints and this theme is addressed in this game.

The object of the game is to be the first player to acquire a Bath, a TV Set, a Cooker, a Car and a Footballing Dog for their home. (That is right, I did say a Footballing Dog - the show often featured viewer's pets that were rather unusual).

Players move around the board in order to try to obtain the items. There are the usual squares, such as trade squares (players can trade amongst themselves if they wish).

Watch out! If you sell a leaky bath or a broken-down car,you could be put in the hot seat by Esther. Esther can Be called in to expose the rogue traders.

Contents
1 Game Board.
4 Playing Pieces.
4 Sets of Pieces(Bath,TV Set,Cooker,Dog and Car).
1 Pack of Service Cards.
1 TV Camera Piece
1 Die
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Base.

116020.name: Christmas Gone Bad

rpg.16770: RPG Geek: The Solitary Role Playing Game

116020.description:
user summary

Olive and Cthanta have almost completely been forgotten as the local hero it's time to set things write.

Go on the second adventure for RPG Geek: The Solitary Role Playing Game. Made as an entry for the 2011 Holiday adventure contest.

116021.name: Rockband Tycoon
116021.description:
User Summary

Manage your own rockband and storm the hitlists. Always wanted to show the so called though rockstars who's the boss? This is your chance! With this simulation game for PC you can put the Rock and Roll scene to your hand!

Manage your artist and go for the top! In Rockband Tycoon you get a dreamjob, you become the manager and get in a world with high stakes, rocklegends and cloak and daggers.

116022.name: WK Voetbal Avontuur 98
116022.description:
User Summary

In this game you are the national coach of the Dutch soccer team and you are leading them at the World Championships of 1998. You need to keep your staff calm and avoid arguments in the team. Get through all the obstacles and you still need to play all the matches and become world champion.

116023.name: Het EK '96 Voetbalspel
116023.description:
User Summary

Play with the Dutch National Soccer team the European Championships of 1996. YOu can try out against the retired players of the team or against other clubs. And then the real matches begin.

116024.name: Competitie Manager 97/98
116024.description:
User Summary

Play the complete season of the 1997 - 1998 soccer championship in the elite division of Dutch Soccer. Handle your own team and buy out of 620 domestic players or buy one of the worlds top players to join your team.

116025.name: Competitie Manager 98/99
116025.description:
User Summary

Get your soccer team through the dutch first division championships in the Netherlands. You manage your team and buy players, arrange matches and rebuild your stadium.

116026.name: Competitie Manager 2000
116026.description:
User Summary

Create and lead your own soccer team out of the Dutch Prime Division into the club championships. As the manager you are in charge off putting the team together, how the games are played and the succes of the team. All this with the players in the competition of the year 2000.

116027.name: Knight Rider: The Game
116027.description:
User Summary

In Knight Rider: the Game you are KITT, the legendary car of the television series. You will meet all important tv show characters and go on special missions. The game has 10 story based missions.

116028.name: Knight Rider 2: The Game
116028.description:
User Summary

Sequel to Knight Rider: The Game. Again you take on the role as KITT the car from the 80's television show and have to do different missions.

116029.name: Miami Vice (2004)
116029.description:
User Summary

Get to play in one of your favorite 80's tv shows. Crockett & Tubbs are back, play them in a third person shooter. As a player you will have to fight, shoot, puzzle, gain evidence and a lot more to get through this game.

116030.name: Amsterdam Taxi Madness
116030.description:
User Summary

Amsterdam Taxi Madness is a computer game in which you become a taxi driver in the Dutch city of Amsterdam. Drive through the city to pick up many passengers and put them off at famous locations. You can also pick up famous Dutch persons that need your services to get somewhere on time.

116031.name: Blood of Angels
116031.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Idolized and adored, but also regarded with jealousy and envy, the aasimars of Golarion count among their ancestors the greatest forces of good throughout the Great Beyond. They are the descendants of majestic angels, beatific celestials, and mysterious but kindly outsiders who have long sought to guide and protect the mortal realm. Yet merely having the blood of angels in your veins does not guarantee security in life, nor does it ensure a kindly soul—few villains are more despised than those who have wandered so far from grace as the fallen aasimar.

This book, a companion volume to Blood of Fiends, explores all that it is to be an aasimar, including an extensive discussion of aasimar culture and society, but also presenting numerous variations on the standard aasimar character. Rules for aasimars of specific celestial heritiages (angels, archons, agathions, azatas, garudas, and peris), new feats and magic, variant aasimar abilities and features, new options for bards, clerics, inquisitors, oracles, sorcerers, summoners, and more await revelation in this Pathfinder Player Companion!

116032.name: 112 Reddingshelikopter
116032.description:
User Summary

You are a pilot in this action packed game. You need to perform rescue missions in Amsterdam and Berlin. You can choose between two helicopters and fullfill 20 missions.

116033.name: Invasion Deutschland
116033.description:
User Summary

Invasion Deutschland is a Pc game by Davilex. It's a follow up on their game Amsterdoom in which aliens invaded Amsterdam and you need to take them out. Now the game is set in Germany and you need to defend the city there. The game is full off well known buildings that are being attacked by aliens.

116034.name: Buff Deck
116034.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Track your hero's bonuses and important status effects with the GameMastery Buff Deck! This beautifully designed accessory speeds up play and cuts down on rulebook consultation during battles by laying out your character's relevant bonuses in an easy-to-add format. From spells like bless, haste, and prayer to class features like a bard's inspire courage, the Buff Deck puts all the details at your fingertips, leaving you to concentrate on smiting your enemies!

116035.name: Rise of the Runelords
116035.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Give life to your NPCs with the Rise of the Runelords Adventure Path Face Cards! More than 50 key monsters and characters put their best face forward in this gorgeously illustrated deck designed for use with the smash-hit Rise of the Runelords Adventure Path, but suitable for use in any fantasy roleplaying game! With space on the back to record key information and the work of Paizo’s finest illustrators on the front, these Face Cards bring the friends and foes of the original Adventure Path campaign to your tabletop, aiding immersion in the game and letting your players look directly into the face of the enemy!

116036.name: Mega Mindy
116036.description:
User Summary

When Mieke returns home from a couple of days of vacation there are all kind of strange things happening in town. And Toby has dissapeared. Could this be the work of the evil Miss Volta?

116037.name: The Ottifants
116037.description:
User Summary
This game was only released in the PAL region. It is based on characters invented in 1975 by the famous German comedian Otto Walkes.

From the Back of the Box:
Bruno, the baby Ottifant, is in a fix. Father kidnapped by Aliens! Or so he thinks as he sets off along a trail of sweets that fell from dad's briefcase on the way to the office. Before his mission of mercy is over, he must brave a mutant army of toys...

116038.name: Sooty's Game
116038.description:
"Race Around the House With Sooty and Friends"

The object of the game is to be the first player,to race around each of the rooms in Sooty's home. You must avoid being caught for the 'Mischief Doings', and arrive at the finish with an exact throw. Instructions on squares must be obeyed (miss a turn, etc.).

When a player lands on a Mischief Square it is read out. The player who holds that Mischief Card is deemed to have caused the mischief and must miss the set number of turns.

There are two routes to take in the bedroom - If you cannot get over the bed in one throw, you will miss extra turns (so, you cannot 'bounce' on the bed!!)

Contents
1 3D Game Board.
3 Card Sections.
15 Mischief Cards.
4 Playing Pieces With Stands.
1 Die.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box

116039.name: Rise of the Runelords Pawn Collection
116039.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Key monsters and NPCs from the Rise of the Runelords Adventure Path come alive on your tabletop with this collection of more than 100 creature pawns for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or any tabletop fantasy RPG! Printed on sturdy cardstock, each pawn contains a beautiful full-color image of a monster or NPC from the Rise of the Runelords campaign, including goblins, dragons, giants, ogres and dozens of unique NPCs that are also suitable to represent player characters. Each cardstock pawn slots into a size-appropriate plastic base from the Pathfinder RPG Bestiary Box, making them easy to mix with traditional metal or plastic miniatures. With multiple pawns for commonly encountered creatures and tons of distinct creature images, the Rise of the Runelords Adventure Path Pawn Collection brings the friends and foes of Pathfinder’s original campaign alive like never before!

116040.name: Mega Mindy - De Bananenbende
116040.description:
User Summary

There is panic in the streets of the peacefull village because criminals are on the loose. They use trained monkeys to steal. Can you get the thievs behind the bars? You are Mega Mindy. There are 13 missions in the game.

116041.name: Mega Mindy Springspel
116041.description:
User Summary

Mega Mindy Springspel is a browser game in which you play the superhero Mega Mindy, from the belgian tv show. You have to jump your way over criminals and fires and need to get as far as possible. This game is a browser game played online.

116042.name: Mega Mindy Laserball
116042.description:
User Summary

In this webbrowser game you take on the roll off Mega Mindy, a famous belgian childrens superhero as she rids the sky off criminals.

The criminals are in the sky, you need to position yourself under them and shoot them out of the sky. When you hit them they divide into two smaller criminals. You need to destroy all of them and don't get hit.

116043.name: Bonetongue, Steward of Dead Dreams

rpgissuearticle.71304: Faces of the Tarnished Souk: Bonetongue, Steward of Dead Dreams

116043.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In a chaotic realm where violence elevates the strong to godhood and the lives and dreams of others are cheap and readily spent, there needs to be a quiet voice of reason urging that you slow down... if only in death. Bonetongue is an old soul tasked with picking up the pieces when heroes are shattered and battles yield bodies, and even if the crowds turned on them before the end, the grim grinning of the undertaker is always there to pay one last kindness.

This product provides Game Masters with details on a uncommon undertaker found amongst the Faces of the Tarnished Souk, ready for immediate use in any campaign - but especially for use within the Coliseum Morpheuon. Each entry features ingenious stat-blocks from multiple OGL sources, history, motivation, secrets, and insight into the NPC's most carefully guarded dreams, along with complete game statistics for low, middle, and high levels of play.

Within you will find:
Bonetongue, a gravedigging goblin with a rictus grin.


CR 16 Male eternal ogrekin goblin white necromancer 15
CR 11 Male eternal ogrekin goblin white necromancer 10
CR 6 Male eternal ogrekin goblin white necromancer 4
Eternal and Ogrekin creature templates, plus three additional templates from Rite Publishing
New magical items - coins for dead eyes, rings for casters, and a rod to lead a veritable zombie parade!

116044.name: Dreams of the Deep
116044.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dreams of the Deep is designed to be a starting Episode for a full Season of play for Dark Aeons: The Atlantean Chronicles, or it can be a standalone Episode. The Dark Aeons core book is all that is required to use this Episode; however it should be noted that the upcoming Arkham: City of Secrets setting book will expand on the Arkham setting in much greater detail than is presented here. As such, we have provided a set of pre-made Persona Sheets for this Episode in order for a Director to simply pick this Episode up and run it straight from the presented material.

Dreams of the Deep is a modern day retelling of the Classic Lovecraft tale, "Shadow Over Innsmouth", as seen through the lens of the Dark Aeons Universe and game system.

This Episode made its first showing through Cthulhu International at Origins Games Fair 2009.

116045.name: Fire from the Sky
116045.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Fire from the Sky is designed to be a starting Episode for a full Season of play for Dark Aeons: The Atlantean Chronicles, or it can be used as a stand alone Episode. The Dark Aeons core book is all that is required to use this Episode; however it should be noted that the upcoming Arkham: City of Secrets setting book will expand on the Arkham setting in much greater detail than is presented here. As such, we have provided a set of pre-made Persona Sheets for this Episode in order for a Director to simply pick this Episode up and run it straight from the presented material.

Fire from the Sky is the first in a series of Episodes dealing with the semi-secret paranormal organization known as the Obsidian Group. The Cast in this Episode are members of one of its investigative Beta Teams...BlueFive. This Episode made its first appearance through Cthulhu International at the Origins Games Fair in 2009 and 2010.

116046.name: 18NY
116046.description:
18NY is a railroad game set in New York State and surrounding areas. The game is a stock, train, and track building game that uses the 18xx system. Two to six players compete to have the largest net worth in cash and stock at game end.

Game play is divided into Stock Rounds and Operating Rounds. During Stock Rounds, players and share companies may buy or sell stock in minor and share companies, open new companies, or take over existing ones. During Operating Rounds, each minor and share company conducts business (laying track, placing stations, and buying trains). At first, stock and operating rounds alternate, but as the game progresses, the number of intervening operating rounds increases.

116047.name: The Nephilim
116047.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is the fourth in a series of Persona Templates that Stardust Publications is releasing in order to give horror gamers a taste of the Dark Aeons: The Atlantean Chronicles Role-Playing Game. The Nephilim are ancient super soldiers from the time of the First Atlantean Empire; immortal, they have walked through the centuries since the fall of the empire trying to find their place in the world.

116048.name: The Lich
116048.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is the fifth in a series of Persona Templates that Stardust Publications is releasing in order to give horror gamers a taste of the Dark Aeons: The Atlantean Chronicles Role-Playing Game. Liches are individuals that have become immortal through the use of Sorcery, either by themselves are or a gift or punishment by another Sorcerer. The oldest of the Liches come from the prehistoric world that gave birth to Atlantis and Lemuria.

116049.name: The Dhampir
116049.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is the sixth in a series of Persona Templates that Stardust Publications is releasing in order to give horror gamers a taste of the Dark Aeons: The Atlantean Chronicles Role-Playing Game. Dhampir are the mortal children of Revenants and human or Atlanteans. They have most of the physical benefits of their Revenant fathers while also facing the negative aspects of both their parents. These poor souls are torn between the world of the living and that of the damned.

116050.name: The Deader
116050.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is the seventh in a series of Persona Templates that Stardust Publications is releasing in order to give horror gamers a taste of the Dark Aeons: The Atlantean Chronicles Role-Playing Game. The Deader is the spirit of a dead man or woman that has fought their way back from the Mirror World and taken over the body of a living human or Atlantean. These spirits walk the world seeking to live out the lives that they were denied by deaths cruel embrace through the bodies of the living.

116051.name: The Atlanteans
116051.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is the eighth in a series of Persona Templates that Stardust Publications is releasing in order to give horror gamers a taste of the Dark Aeons: The Atlantean Chronicles Role-Playing Game. The Atlanteans are the secret hidden masters of the world, the Imperial and Renegade Houses guide the world in an epic game of chess, quietly maneuvering their pawns into position and removing anyone and anything that would endanger their ages long Empire and Houses.

116052.name: The Psychic
116052.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is the ninth in a series of Persona Templates that Stardust Publications is releasing in order to give horror gamers a taste of the Dark Aeons: The Atlantean Chronicles Role-Playing Game. The Psychics are the gifted ones that through no fault of their own have been given a Psychic Talent. Some have the ability to see into the future or past; while others have the ability to burn or freeze their enemies with the terrifying powers of their mind. There are others still that the ability to listen to the thoughts of their peers or to control them. And those are not all of the Psychic Talents, there are more.

116053.name: Dark Aeons: Conflict Resolution Deck
116053.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Dark Aeons Conflict Resolution Deck has been created in order to make it easier for Directors and Actors to play Dark Aeons: The Atlantean Chronicles games. In order to use this deck, you will need 5 sheets of Card Stock Paper in order to print out the Cards.

116054.name: A GM's Guide to Mor Aldenn
116054.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mor Aldenn is a young city of magic and mages. It's located at the heart of an ancient forest named Ossindrillon, a realm that was once ruled by elves and a strange enclave of human wizards calling themselves the Trelmyrean Archwizards, but those days are long gone. Now the forest is a true wilderness and the mages from Mor Aldenn finds that it holds incredible secrets of the arcane. Magical beasts, strange poisonous rivers, giants and amazing ruins from a long forgotten era are just some of the wonders that this realm offers the adventurer!

Make Mor Aldenn your home!

A GM's Guide to Mor Aldenn is the second book in (hopefully) a long series of products based in and around Mor Aldenn, the City of Mages! This pdf focuses on the GM perspective, obviously.

116055.name: A Player's Guide to Mor Aldenn
116055.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mor Aldenn is a young city of magic and mages. It's located at the heart of an ancient forest named Ossindrillon, a realm that was once ruled by elves and a strange enclave of human wizards calling themselves the Trelmyrean Archwizards, but those days are long gone. Now the forest is a true wilderness and the mages from Mor Aldenn finds that it holds incredible secrets of the arcane. Magical beasts, strange poisonous rivers, giants and amazing ruins from a long forgotten era are just some of the wonders that this realm offers the adventurer!

Make Mor Aldenn your home!

A Player's Guide is the very first book in (hopefully) a long series of products based in and around Mor Aldenn, the City of Mages! This pdf focuses on the player perspective, obviously. This setting is not based on any system, yet, but it will be in future products.

116056.name: The House of Blades Cartography
116056.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What you get...

A single full-color map of the House of Blades in its full size! Created by the amazing cartographer, Rene Walk!

What is the House of Blades?

It is a three-storey building housing the local Fighters' Guild!

Basically, it is a very famous location in Mor Aldenn, the City of Mages, but you can use it any way you want in your own campaign of course!

116057.name: Moon's Folly Cartography
116057.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What you get...

A black/white map of Moon's Folly in its full size!

A full-color map of Moon's Folly in its full size!

Created by the amazing cartographer, Rene Walk!

What is Moon's Folly?

A small town of lycanthropes, loggers and moon goddesses!

Basically, it is a very famous town in the Mor Aldenn, the City of Mages setting, but you can use it any way you want in your own campaign of course!

116058.name: Mor Aldenn Cartography
116058.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What you get...

A full-color map of Mor Aldenn in its full size

A full-color map of Mor Aldenn in its full size (with shades)

The original black and white map from William McAusland!

116059.name: The Barrowdelve Map Pack
116059.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Within these pages, you'll find;


4 colour maps by cartographer, Rene Walk!
4 greyscale maps by cartographer, Rene Walk!


Remember, this is NOT a complete walkthrough of all the rooms and encounters of the Barrowdelve! This is just a map pack!

116060.name: The Forgotten Tower Cartography
116060.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You've bought the adventure - A Trail of Poison - and want larger maps with colour? Battlemaps?

Well, you've definitely come to the right place then!

What you get...


A large map of the Forgotten Tower by the Shadow Lake (in colour!)
Battlemaps of all the levels (with grid)
Battlemaps of all the levels (without grid)

116061.name: The Ugly Harpy Cartography
116061.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You've bought the Ugly Harpy but wants larger maps? battlemaps?
Well, you've come to the right place then!

What you get...


A large map of the Ugly Harpy!
A battlemap of the Ugly Harpy, easily printable!

116062.name: Tower of Magic Cartography
116062.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What you get...

A single full-color map of the first level of the Tower of Magic in its full size! Created by the amazing cartographer, Rene Walk!
Note that this is ONLY the first level of the Tower!

What is the Tower of Magic?

It is a tower of mages, housing the local mage guild!
Basically, it is a very famous location in Mor Aldenn, the City of Mages, but you can use it any way you want in your own campaign of course!

116063.name: Wizard's Staff Cartography
116063.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What you get...

A single full-color map of the Wizard's Staff in its full size! Created by the amazing cartographer, Rene Walk!

What is the Wizard's Staff?

It is a big inn run by mages... exclusively for mages!
Basically, it is a very famous location in Mor Aldenn, the City of Mages, but you can use it any way you want in your own campaign of course!

116064.name: The Mor Aldenn Glossary
116064.description:
Publisher's blurb:

WELCOME TO THE MOR ALDENN GLOSSARY!

It's time to collect all the persons, locations, titles and terms in one short pdf. This is that very pdf, the Mor Aldenn Glossary! I hope to update the glossary on a regular basis.

This Glossary is mostly intended for GMs, so if you are a player in the Mor Aldenn setting, be careful what you read!

116065.name: Wizard's Path Chapter One: Sticks and Stones
116065.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is chapter one of the Mor Aldenn online serial.... the illustrated and expanded pdf version. You can, of course, always just head on over to cityofmages.wordpress.com and read the first chapter, completely free of charge, or you can buy this pdf and get the following;


A full-page illustration by Gary Dupuis
Statistics of the four main characters
A new spell called "Umbrella"
A new monster called the Puppet Imp

116066.name: Wizard's Path Chapter Two: Broken Bones
116066.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is chapter two of the Mor Aldenn online serial.... the illustrated and expanded pdf version. You can, of course, always just head on over to cityofmages.wordpress.com and read the second chapter, completely free of charge, or you can buy this pdf and get the following;


A full-page illustration by Gary Dupuis
Statistics of the four main characters
Statistics on Zalla Leafblade (a Mor Aldenn NPC)
A new magical item called "Secure Message Tube"

116067.name: 15 Specific Weapons Volume I
116067.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Magical weapons are a necessity of most roleplaying games, yet the core rulebook presents so few of them. Magical weapons are loved by players and game masters alike, yet there is almost none to choose from. There is nothing like a memorable magical weapon to help define a character throughout a campaign, just think about your favorite fictional heroes of fantasy and the weapons that they carry!

It is certainly possible to purchase a magical warhammer such as the dwarven thrower or a magical longsword like the nine lives stealer, but most weapons are not represented at all. For example, where are the magical falchions, flails, kukris, morningstars, spears, hand crossbows and whips? Sure, a creative player can take a look at the special abilities and come up with a concept of his own, but it will be a very limited concept, limited to the twenty-nine special abilities of the core rulebook. The Advanced Player's Guide makes this selection slightly bigger, yet, most weapons are still not represented among the specific magical weapons selection.

This series of short pdfs hope to bring new weapons and concepts to your game!
These are the 15 specific weapons from Volume 1...


Axe of the North (greataxe)
Blood Reaver (falchion)
Drunkard's Bane (greatclub)
Eternal Darkness (hand crossbow)
Face Destroyer (spiked light shield)
Gauntlet of Growth (gauntlet)
Laughing Spear (shortspear)
Magefriend (club)
Passage Disk (chakram)
Poison Fang (punching dagger)
Slaver Blowgun (blowgun)
Soulcleaver (falchion)
Summerfire (elven curve blade)
Thunderstroke Falchion (falchion)
Viper Blade (kukri)

116068.name: 15 Specific Weapons Volume II
116068.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Magical weapons are a necessity of most roleplaying games, yet the core rulebook presents so few of them. Magical weapons are loved by players and game masters alike, yet there is almost none to choose from. There is nothing like a memorable magical weapon to help define a character throughout a campaign, just think about your favorite fictional heroes of fantasy and the weapons that they carry!

It is certainly possible to purchase a magical warhammer such as the dwarven thrower or a magical longsword like the nine lives stealer, but most weapons are not represented at all. For example, where are the magical falchions, flails, kukris, morningstars, spears, hand crossbows and whips? Sure, a creative player can take a look at the special abilities and come up with a concept of his own, but it will be a very limited concept, limited to the twenty-nine special abilities of the core rulebook. The Advanced Player's Guide makes this selection slightly bigger, yet, most weapons are still not represented among the specific magical weapons selection.

This series of short pdfs hope to bring new weapons and concepts to your game!
These are the 15 specific weapons from Volume 2...


Balanced Starknife (starknife)
Bastard's Inheritance (bastard sword)
Double Sword of Unyielding Balance (two-bladed sword)
Dragonbone Flail (heavy flail)
Dwarven Mace (light mace/mug)
Giant's Fork (ranseur)
Livingwood Quarterstaff (quarterstaff)
Minotaur Cestus (cestus)
Morningstar of Alarm (morningstar)
Orcslayer (falcata)
Pharaoh's Companion (khopesh)
Sap of the Thief (sap)
Scythe of the Seasons (scythe)
Sickle of Thanoptic Armaments (sickle)
Whip of Imprisonment (whip)

116069.name: A Player's Guide to Mor Aldenn Expanded
116069.description:
Publisher's blurb:

- Expanded and (slightly) revised edition, created especially with the Print on Demand option in mind.

So what is new to this edition?

Well, inside you'll find a shortstory in three parts written by Sean Holland, an overview of the city, its locations and inhabitants and a new playable race (the centaur) and a new rogue archetype (the street magician).

You'll also find a couple of (almost) blank pages by the end, useable for campaign notes.

116071.name: Eldritch Secrets, Volume 1
116071.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Spells, spells, and more... spells!

Eldritch Secrets presents you with a treasure trove of new arcane and divine options and is your chance to boost your caster with new and exciting spells, feats and magic items!

Looking for a spell that animates a ship to fly through the clouds instead of the waves? Or what about a spell that reconstructs a ruined citadel... or one that summons one of the strange Manifest Children of the Ether?

Now is your chance to find some new and exciting options for wizard, cleric or witch! Oh, and Eldritch Secrets isn't just for the players... there is something for the GMs as well! How about the stories behind the spells and information about their creators?

Eldritch Secrets includes:


More than 280 spells for all classes, including those from the Advanced Player's Guide!
3 new monsters: Death Bird, Puppet Imp and the Manifest Child of the Ether!
New feats and magic items!
2 new deities!
Lots of awesome stories about the spells and their creators!

116072.name: Gaiants Discovered
116072.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A race supplement for the Mor Aldenn setting, or for any other setting...

So, you might be asking yourself... what is a gaiant? Well...

Gaiants are reclusive forest dwellers, tree-like in appearance, at once both fey-like and giant-like in demeanor, with eyes that sparkle like gems, deep with faceted wisdom. Throughout Ossindrillon, the nomadic gaiants are friends to those who live within the forested wilderness, and enemy to those who seek to disrupt the natural order.

Gaiants Discovered brings you a whole new playable race of big fey-giants! Within these pages you'll also find the following;


5 new gaiant-inspired spells
4 alternate racial traits
6 new magic items
9 new gaiant racial feats


And there is something for the GM as well...


3 named gaiant NPCs!
2 generic gaiants!

116073.name: Gods of Mor Aldenn: Ehlora
116073.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mor Aldenn is the City of Mages, but ever since its founding more than 300 years ago, the moraldenns have worshiped a variety of gods and goddesses. Afterall, isn't divine magic as much a part of the world as the arcane? Clerics of all faiths travel through the city, a few even stay for a while, but you'll only find one temple in Mor Aldenn.

This temple is called the Temple of the Three and houses followers of three deities important to the moraldenns. These are Ehlora the Scholar, Calmorrun the Leader and Vhorann the Protector. This pdf details one of the Three, the goddess of ancestry, death and knowledge, Ehlora. Within these pages you'll find information about the goddess herself and her followers. You'll also find a new feat, a few NPCs and even a small selection of new spells.

116074.name: Moon's Folly
116074.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A City Supplement for the Mor Aldenn Campaign Setting!

Moon's Folly is a small forest town a day's walk south of Mor Aldenn, the City of Mages. Packed with adventure, this town contains a prehistoric monument, a cult of the Moon Goddess, feuding lumber magnates, a trio of dryad-tended oak trees, and an eccentric ghost.

Humans, half-elves, and halflings live among good-natured fey and peaceable lycanthropes. Beneath the surface, this town of herbalists and loggers guards tragic and dire secrets sufficient to fuel an entire mini-campaign.

Discover the history, locations, personalities, and secrets of Moon's Folly, along with new feats, traits, equipment, and rules for playing lycanthropic PCs.

116075.name: Mor Aldenn Creature Compendium
116075.description:
Publisher's blurb:

These are the monsters that prowl the dark forests, mountains, marshes and caves of the Mor Aldenn campaign setting. Some are the creations of the dreaded Night Hag and some are the result of the experimentation of the mages!

Yes, these were created for Mor Aldenn, City of Mages, but could be used for any campaign setting, especially yours!

Within these pages you'll find the following monsters;


Arachnus (monstrous humanoid, CR 11)
Black Glass Undead (template, Black Glass Wight CR 6)
Blacktalon Lizardfolk (humanoid, CR 4)
Dragon, Marsh (dragon, CR 8, 12 and 17)
Gaiant (humanoid, CR 2)
Giant, Bog (humanoid, CR 5)
Gold Cap (plant, CR 4)
Hag Spider (magical beast, CR 11)
Leyspinner (fey, CR 11)
Mahr (fey, CR 5)
Manifest Child of the Ether (outsider, CR 10)
Marshling (plant, CR 1)
Mirejack (fey, CR 6)
Mythraven (magical beast, CR 7)
Plaguecrawler (vermin, CR 10)
Portune (fey, CR 2)
Puppet Imp (construct, CR 1/3)
Spell Pike (magical beast, CR 4)
Stiltskin (fey, CR 8)
Tuskbeast (animal, CR 3)
Veraxar (magical beast, CR 6)

116076.name: Spel! (Jaargang 15, nr 1 - sep 2011)
116076.description:
Spel!
Jaargang 15, nr 1, september 2011
(Year 15, Issue 1, September 2011)

This issue includes a sheet of stickers to adorn Carcassonne playing pieces, courtesy of 999 Games.

Contents:

Algemeen (General)

Voorwoord
Op bezoek bij... Rutger van Marissing
Van de redactie
Ducosimpagina
'Wie entsteht ein Spiel?'
Verkiezing Nederlandse Spellenprijs 2011
Bevriende Winkels/Colofon




Bordspellen (Board games)

K2
Alhambra Nederland - het Kaartspel
Masters of Venice
Khan
Porto Carthago
Cherokee
Sun, Sea & Sand
Jadmaxx
Pantheon
Sporen op Tafel 21: Cleopatra's Caboose
Rozenoorlog
Airlines Europe
De Kathedraal: Het Kaartspel
Koekie Loeren
Lino
Felinia
Junta: Viva el Presidente!




Bordwargames (Board wargames)

Niet Stuk te Krijgen: Wooden Ships & Iron Men
The invasion of Togoland 1914
Micro Modern - World War 2
Jena 20
De geschiedenis van Victory Point Games
Gettysburg: The Wheatfield




Miniaturenwargames (Miniatures wargames)

Lion of the North
Rules of Engagement
Het 'Tinnen' Soldaatje
Op pad met je Warhammer-'elftal'
Warmachine: Wrath




Rollenspellen (Role-playing games)

Operation: Fallen Reich
De Anatomische Les/Den Vaderland Getrouwe
Van Kerkers & Draken - deel 9
Een harmonieuze groep




Verzamelspellen (Collectable games)

MagicMania
World of Warcraft




Note: the page count of the magazine includes the front cover (which is page 1). Articles start at page 2.

116077.name: Mor Aldenn Setting Guide
116077.description:
Publisher's blurb:

- A PFRPG Campaign Setting

Located at the heart of an ancient realm, Mor Aldenn is a wondrous place where magic is part of everyday life. It has been home to the mages for more than three centuries and their magic has had a great impact on the city itself. Their towers rise above even the great trees of Ossindrillon, overlooking the vast realm that surrounds the city.

People of the City of Mages accept magic and try to use it to their advantage. They understand fully that, used correctly, magic can be one of life's many luxuries. It is a rare thing to find a person with Mor Aldenn who fears magic and the mages.

CITY OVERVIEW

Mor Aldenn, City of Mages, the Tower City, sits on an island at the juncture of two rivers. The city began as a small human and elven settlement but soon grew to the size it is today. A literal crossroads where merchant ships bound for the Great Ocean embark, and highways lead to the Old Kingdoms, the upstart principality of Calathia, and the shining city of the elves, Ossindil.

Visitors must enter the city from one of the docks or from across the single bridge leading to the mainland on the island's northeast side. This arrangement has served the city well, making it difficult for the Night Hag's minions to assault the city without plenty of warning.

A new visitor probably remarks on the prevalence of magic in the city. Lamp posts with continual flame spells line several main streets, and shops and homes also often bear such lights at their doorways, making the city relatively well-lit at night. It is not uncommon to see a wizard or sorcerer borne along through the air on a carpet of flying or traveling the streets atop a palanquin balanced on the shoulders of a demon servant. If asked, citizens can direct the visitor to one of the two locations where the city rulers have installed decanters of endless water to ensure a supply of fresh water for the populace. Shops which deal in magic items, spellcasting, alchemy and other arcane services are much more common in Mor Aldenn than in other similar-sized settlements. Then, of course, there are the wondrous towers of magic, for which Mor Aldenn is most famous.

This Setting Guide also includes a short introductory adventure by none other than the amazing Ron Lundeen!

116078.name: The Clockworker
116078.description:
Publisher's blurb:

- A New PFRPG Base Class

The art ofclockwork has been around for a long time, artisans creating complex timepieces and locks with elegant machinery. So too has the mystic work of golemcraft been done by wizards for untold ages.

Though a recent development, the clockworker is an innovator that fuses the mechanical science with magic, to create a complex and capable clockwork servant and many more mechanical wonders.

Clockworkers explore the science of golemcraft as they adventure, using their mechanical companion in dangerous situations not only to overcome these obstacles but to observe the machine's performance and know how to improve it. While not as powerful a spellcaster as a wizard, the clockworker and companion are a team that can accomplish much together.

116079.name: The Haunting of Soldragon Academy
116079.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Not all residents of the City of Mages aspire to wizardry. The Soldragon Academy of Martial Training has provided a well-rounded warrior's education to the children of Mor Aldenn's elite for more than a generation. Recently, the boarding school has been experiencing strange and sinister events. The headmaster, Mertius Soldragon, needs help in protecting the children in his care and unraveling the mystery.

The Haunting of Soldragon Academy is a Pathfinder Roleplaying game adventure designed for four to five 5th to 6th-level characters. The adventure takes place in the Soldragon Academy of Mor Aldenn and the surrounding countryside. This adventure may be set in any wilderness city large enough to boast an elite boarding school.

116080.name: The Ugly Harpy
116080.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the Ugly Harpy, the largest inn found in Mor Aldenn, the City of Mages!

This inn is home to thieves, kobolds, fighters, whores and even wizards. Travellers have often heard of this inn and wants to see it with their own eyes, but they may quickly change their mind after a night at the Ugly Harpy!

116081.name: Wreck of the Keening Crone
116081.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The acidic waters of the Spindleflow River ooze past the city of Mor Aldenn. Magical wards purify the waters and deter aggressive predators near thecity, but outside this zone, foul beasts lurk in the toxic river. When a treasure-laden riverboat sinks a few miles north of town, the race is on to delve the contaminated depths!

Wreck of the Keening Crone is a Pathfinder Roleplaying Game adventure designed for four or five 5th-level or 6th-level characters. The adventure contains new equipment, a variety of environments, and an easy, innovative mechanic to track how fast the characters reach the wreck.

Wreck of the Keening Crone takes place in Mor Aldenn and in the acidic Spindleflow River, but can be adapted to any city located on a wide river.

116082.name: BlowOut
116082.description:
BlowOut is a side-scrolling action video game, a run-and-gun shoot-em-up in the tradition of games such as Contra and Metal Slug and a power-up-based exploration structure akin to Metroid. In the game, the player takes the role of John "Dutch" Cane, a space marine sent to check up on researchers on the space platform "Honour Guard" only to discover that they have been horribly mutated.

On January 26, 2009, the game was re-released on the Xbox Live Marketplace as part of the Xbox Originals program.

Source: Wikipedia, "BlowOut", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116083.name: Bode Miller Alpine Skiing
116083.description:
Bode Miller Alpine Skiing is a PlayStation 2 and Windows video game, named after the American alpine skier Bode Miller. It is the first console sim game to concentrate solely on the sport of skiing (not including skiing and snowboarding hybrid games). The four disciplines of skiing included are Downhill, Slalom, Giant Slalom, and Super-G.

The game also includes a multi-season career mode, allowing the player to compete in a year long World Cup starting out as a junior skier, and the chance to qualify for the amateur and professional circuits while training, competing, and gaining sponsors.

Courses
Aare, Sweden
Beaver Creek, Colorado, United States of America
Bormio, Italy
Kitzbühel, Austria
Schladming, Austria
Sölden, Austria
Lake Louise, Alberta, Canada
Chamonix, France
Garmisch, Germany
Alta Badia, Italy
Madonna di Campiglio, Italy
Val d'Isère, France
Val Gardena, Italy
Adelboden, Switzerland
Wengen, Switzerland
Kranjska Gora, Slovenia
Yongpyong, Korea
Shiga Kogen, Japan

Source: Wikipedia, "Bode Miller Alpine Skiing", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116084.name: Bomberman Hardball
116084.description:
Bomberman Hardball (Bomberman Battles in Japan) is a video game for the PlayStation 2 which takes a departure from the previous games in the Bomberman series, and throws in sports games along with the traditional battle mode.

Bomberman Hardball is divided into four games. Battle mode (the standard Bomberman game), is joined by tennis, golf and baseball games. At the center of all this is the Living mode, a character building feature in which the player can design a Bomberman for use in any of the battle modes.

Battle Mode is the centerpiece of this and all other Bomberman games. This mode is essentially the standard Bomberman formula; in the game, players navigate grid-based mazes, planting bombs in an attempt to hit other players (while avoided being hit by a bomb themselves). There are several different variations of Battle Mode, although they all center around the standard Bomberman gameplay.

Classic Battle: A standard deathmatch-type game.
Star Battle: Collect the most stars.
Crown Battle: Find the crown in the level to win the game.
Point Battle: Earn the most points by killing opponents
Replay: Watched game sessions saved to memory card.

Baseball has two modes: a single-match mode (exhibition) and a pennant race in which the player takes part in a league match of thirty games against five CPU teams. Aiming is automatic, causing most of the gameplay to revolve around well-timed button presses (baserunning is also automatic; fielding can even be set to be automatic).

Golf can either be played in exhibition mode or in a tournament mode, with a total of eighteen holes available. Like Mario Golf, shots are handled with a timer bar at the bottom of the screen. A vertical bar moves along the horozontal one; a button press stops the bar, determining the power of the shot. The bar then moves in the opposite direction, eventually passing a stationary bar. A second button press stops the moving bar again; the closer it is to the stationary bar, the more accurate (ie straight) the shot will be.

Tennis has doubles and singles modes on clay, hard and grass courts. You can play through an exhibition match, selecting the number of sets and games, or you can try out the tournament where you play against a series of opponents.

In living mode, the player can raise a white Bomberman, who lives in his own house. Within the house are several interactive objects, including a television. To get to these interactive objects, you open the remote. The remote options are as follows:

Channel 1: Watch a battle. Channel 2: Watch some baseball. Channel 3: Watch some tennis. Channel 4: Watch some golf. Channel 5: Edit your Bomberman character. Channel 6: Go to the options menu. Channel 7: Display calendar. Channel 8: Name your Bomberman character Channel 9: Buy things from the gumball machine.

The TV can be used to watch demos of matches (computer-only matches) from the game's different modes. There is also a gumball machine, which allows the player to spend 100 coins on things such as outfits for the player's Bomberman (coins are earned by playing the main game modes, and items are chosen at random). The player's customized Bomberman can be used in any battle mode.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bomberman Hardball", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116085.name: Bomberman Land 2
116085.description:
One day, Bombermen were invited to the newly opened Bomberman Land theme park by the park manager. Player's goal is to collect 125 BOMPAD pieces obtained through the adventures inside the park.

In addition to mini-games within the main story, there are other mini-games:

Survival Bomberman - An action RPG
Bomberman Kart - A subset of Bomberman Kart video game
Bomberman Battle - The multiplayer blasting action featured in most Bomberman titles. New game modes include Star battle mode, point battle mode
SameGame - Bomberman-themed SameGame
Panic Bomber - A variant of Super Bomberman Panic Bomber World. Up to 4 people can be player at the same time

When connecting Game Boy Advance to the GameCube version of the game, 10 mini-games can be downloaded and played in Game Boy Advance.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bomberman Land 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116086.name: Bratz: Forever Diamondz
116086.description:
Bratz: Forever Diamondz is the third video game based on the popular fashion doll line, Bratz. It is the second published by THQ. It was released on September 18, 2006 at GameStop, then September 21, 2006 nationwide. This video game is based on the direct-to-DVD movie, Bratz Passion 4 Fashion Diamondz and the doll line, Bratz Forever Diamondz.

The gameplay of the Bratz Forever Diamondz is mostly the same as its predecessor, Bratz Rock Angelz. There are four playable characters: Yasmin, Cloe, Sasha and Jade. During the game, all of a sudden blue coins appear, called Blingz, which are money for the Bratz girls. There's a mobile phone menu, where you can read messages, and see the objective, what the player currently has to do.

It has explorable roam, similar to Grand Theft Auto series. When the player is not in an objective, he/she can take a character to collect character coins (which are can be used to buy movie clips. There are 25 for each Bratz girl), Blingz tokens, take pictures, and play mini-games for extra money.The new features in the video game, that there are timed objectives, which means that you have to do the objective in the amount of time. There's an ice rink, where the girls can perform ice-skating skills. The biggest new feature is that the player can adopt a pet (cat or dog), and take him/her to pet shows, accessorize it, etc. The pet helps in certain objectives, however, after that the player should give a treat for it. You can also take part in modeling contests to win Blingz. The mini-games can be activated to go into a place, or talk to a person.

Posing game: a rhythm game, where the player has to press the combination of buttons in time.
Smoothie-A-Go-Go: a timed mini-game, where the player has to deliver smoothies to people in time.
Skate Race Challenge: a timed mini-game, where the player has to collect flags on roller-skates in time.

Unlike its predecessor, this game has a multiplayer mode, which is can only be activated when two controllers are plugged into the console. There are three multiplayer games:

Pairz - a match game against the opponent to see who can get more matches.
Change outfits
Top Trumps - a game very similar to the card game War. The player gets a card each turn with number totals on it. The player has to guess which number on the card is higher than the opponent's card. If he's/she's correct, he/she wins the card. He/she goes on playing until all 26 cards are in one players possession. This game appears in the PC version of the Bratz: Rock Angelz.
Roller skating - you can chanqe into a pair of roller skate's , helpinq you two move ten times faster than walking.

The Nintendo DS version of the game includes a rabbit, a cat and a dog as pets that can be owned.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bratz: Forever Diamondz (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116087.name: Counter-Strike: Global Offensive

videogamehonor.38817: 2016 Golden Joystick Best Competitive Game of the Year Nominee

116087.description:
Like previous games in the series, Global Offensive is an objective based multiplayer first person shooter. Each player joins either the Terrorist or Counter-Terrorist team and attempts to complete objectives or eliminate the enemy team.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Counter-Strike:_Global_Offensive," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116088.name: Bratz: Rock Angelz (GC/PS2)
116088.description:
Bratz: Rock Angelz is a 2005 video game based on the popular Bratz fashion doll line. This is the first Bratz game published by THQ. It is based on the direct-to-DVD movie and the collection with the same name.

These PlayStation 2 and GameCube games are an open world sandbox adventure, similar to the Grand Theft Auto series (it even shares the same RenderWare engine with the GTA series, most especially the Grand Theft Auto III-era games). The player controls one of the four Bratz girls - Yasmin, Cloe, Sasha and Jade - who are attempting to launch their own fashion magazine.

Jade had taken a job as an intern for her favorite fashion magazine. A problem, caused by twins Kirstee and Kaycee, results in Jade being fired from Your Thing magazine. Her friends decide to cheer her up by suggesting they start their own magazine. After redecorating an old office the four girls launch Bratz Magazine. Later the girls launch their own line of fashion and form a rock band.

The player can explore three locations; Stylesville (also known as Bratz Town), London and Paris. The objectives of the game are triggered when the player takes the correct Bratz girl to a speech bubble. During the game blue coins called blingz appear, which are money for the Bratz girls. Each girl carries a mobile phone, used to send messages between characters, check the amount of blingz owned and the location of the next objective. The phone's cover and ringtone can be changed. The player character can also collect character coins, used to buy movie clips from the 25 available for each Bratz girl, take pictures, and play mini-games for extra money. The girls' make-up can be applied as the player wishes, the Bratz characters can be guided to shops, to buy the latest trends with their collected blingz.

Mini-games are activated by going to certain locations or talking to non-player characters. They include:

Posing game - The player must do the button combinations before the time runs out. In certain objectives, this mini-game will be featured.
Blown Away! - The player has to pick up pieces of paper that a person has dropped, and return them.
Model Behavior! - The player has to take pictures in a photo booth.
Rockin' Racerz - The player has to put on the Bratz girl's roller skates, and grab the flags as fast as she can.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bratz: Rock Angelz (video game", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116089.name: Brian Lara International Cricket 2005

videogameversion.144369: Australian/New Zealand Ricky Ponting Cricket  PS2 edition

116089.description:
Brian Lara International Cricket 2005 (BLIC) (also known as Ricky Ponting Cricket in Australia and New Zealand) is a cricket video game from Codemasters, available on Xbox, PlayStation 2 and Windows PC platforms. released on 21 July 2005, which was the first day of the 2005 Ashes series. The game is followed by Brian Lara International Cricket 2007 (Ricky Ponting International Cricket 2007 in Australia and New Zealand and Yuvraj Singh International Cricket in India).

This game is the follow-up to Brian Lara Cricket '99 (also known as Shane Warne Cricket '99 in Australia and New Zealand). It contains the 2003 Cricket World Cup in Africa and the 2004 ICC Champions Trophy. These two competitions are licensed by the International Cricket Council (ICC) and contain official player names, faces, kits, badges and sponsors. All other modes are unofficial as the rights for these belong to EA Sports and therefore some players and kits are made up; for example Graham Thorpe becomes "G Thrip" and Shane Warne becomes "S Worde". The only correct names in these modes are Brian Lara himself, (shown as "B Lara"), and Australian Captain Ricky Ponting (similarly shown as R Ponting). The game is also first to include licensed bats such as the Kookaburra Diablo and the GM Purist. The game takes the perspective of the normal cricket TV coverage, other views and displays in the game also try to emulate TV coverage of cricket, for example Hawk-Eye, an electronic system used to track cricket balls as they are bowled is featured in the game.

There are a few types of cricket that can be played in the game. Test match, Test series, One Day match, World Cup, ICC Champion's Trophy and practice mode. Along with the types of cricket there are several difficulty settings. Slog mode, village, county and test. With each difficulty bowling and batting decreases in ease. The game also offers the player to construct their own team from cricketers already in the game, and to construct their own "Career Players" who gain experience with each match. There is also a "Classic XI" mode, which has famous cricketers of the past such as W.G. Grace, Imran Khan and Jim Laker.

There are also a challenge mode in the game, where the player can take on cricketing challenges based on notable cricket matches from the past. The player can either recreate or rewrite history, depending on the team they choose to play as. These include such matches as The birth of The Ashes, the 1933 Bodyline test match, Garfield Sobers' six sixes, and the 2003 ICC Cricket World Cup final. There are 10 challenges in total.

Source: Wikipedia, "Brian Lara International Cricket 2005", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116090.name: Spel! (Jaargang 15, nr 2 - dec 2011)
116090.description:
Spel!
Jaargang 15, nr 2, december 2011
(Year 15, Issue 2, December 2011)

Note: the front cover has an error, it says "Jaargang 15, nr 1, september 2011".
The large photo on the cover is an edited version of the winning entry of the Essen 2011 Photo Contest by Henk Rolleman.

This issue includes Spel!enkaart #0007: Dino-Duell.

Contents:

Algemeen (General)

Voorwoord
Op bezoek bij... Cobrain
Column Spelauteurs Nederland
Van de redactie
Ducosimpagina's
Bevriende Winkels/Colofon




Special Najaarsbeurzen (Autumn conventions special)

Crisis
GenCon
SPIEL 1 - Inleiding
SPIEL 2 - De beste spellen
SPIEL 3 - De Nederlandse inbreng in Essen
SPIEL 4 - Overige bijdragen
SPIEL - Fotopagina




Bordspellen (Board games)

Niet Stuk te Krijgen: Arkham Horror
Arrezzo
Thema's en Trends: Coöperatieve spellen
Dominant Species
Draco
Sporen op Tafel: Paperclip Railways
Grand National
Let's Take a Hike
Strasbourg
Fortuna
7 Wonders: Leaders




Bordwargames (Board wargames)

Down in Flames: WWII Aces High/WWII Guns Blazing
Frank van den Bergh 1957-2011
De `Musket & Pike'-series van GMT
Les Victoires du Maréchal de Saxe
Fighting Formations
St. George's Valor




Miniaturenwargames (Miniatures wargames)

Dystopian Wars
Het Tinnen Soldaatje
Monty's Desert Battles
Restricties in Warhammer
Old West Shootout




Rollenspellen (Role-playing games)

De Anatomische Les - deel 7
Den Vaderland Getrouwe - deel 7
Van Kerkers & Draken - deel 10
Fiasco




Verzamelspellen (Collectable games)

MagicMania: Innistrad
Chaotic




Note: the page count of the magazine includes the front cover (which is page 1). Articles start at page 2.

116091.name: Bujingai: The Forsaken City
116091.description:
Bujingai (武刃街), also known as Bujingai: The Forsaken City and Bujingai: Swordmaster, is stylistically inspired by Wuxia films. Its main character, Lau Wong, is based on Gackt, who assisted in the development by providing the voice of Lau, motion capture, and fleshing out the setting and story. The female lead, Yohfa, is voiced by Maaya Sakamoto. The antagonist, Lei, is voiced by Kōichi Yamadera. Extras include subtitled interviews with all three voice actors, an alternate costume, character gallery, video gallery, and multiple levels of difficulty.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bujingai: The Forsaken City", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

For the player, the game is all about duelling swordplay. The player can use walls to jump towards an opponent, use a flying attack, perform a jumping sword thrust, spin on beams and poles, as well as use magic. As the player advances through opponents, new martial styles, magical spells and powers, weapons, and health/strength skills are acquired. With improved powers come improved graphics from multi-colored sword swings to full cinematic combinations.

Source: The Publisher Website.

116092.name: Fief: Les Reliques
116092.description:
Essen 2011 promotional mini expansion for the game Fief.
Include 5 holy relics (reliques) and each holy relic has a special power that its possessor may use if they wish.
Available in the Plato Magazine issue #41

116093.name: The Black Monastery (Pathfinder)
116093.description:
From the back of the book:

The Black Monastery is a classic style adventure module for parties of five to seven characters of seventh to tenth level, with the average player character being ninth level. The adventure includes maps and descriptions for the monastery's main level, two towers, and three dungeon levels. There are two separate dungeons, one of which has two levels. There are enough things to do, choices to make, and monsters to fight to occupy a gaming group for a dozen gaming sessions or more.

The module is written in the "sandbox" style that allows players to choose which way to go and which challenges to face. There are no railroad situations and it is better for the party if they avoid some of the things they find or creatures they meet. There is no climactic battle, but a party of very foolish adventurers might not survive long depending on their choices.

They might not even survive the first encounter.

116094.name: Eine Reise durch Thüringen
116094.description:
Objective: be the first to travel to arrival point
learn more about folks and country
- simple 'Roll and Move' game, moving by turn -

rolling the die each player moves forward:
you can't kick opponents - ending on a marked space
follow instructions ==> see rule sheet

116095.name: Es weihnachtet sehr
116095.description:
Objective: be the first ending on field 24
- acting by turn -
all stars -coloured on 1 side - are flipped, tools (e.g. crib) are assembled
starting on field 1
each player draws a 'star' (instead of using a die);
if the star shows a colour of one of the next three spaces ==>
move forward to that space - otherwise don't move
if that space is marked follow instructions printed on cover inside
if all stars are discarded ==> shuffle and draw again
remarks:
cute meeples

116096.name: Lifeline (2004)
116096.description:
From the back of the box

Lifeline
Voice Action Adventure

Your voice is her command.

Christmas eve, 2029. Grand opening of the Japan Space Station Hotel. Bizarre creatures invade and begin slaughtering guests. You're trapped inside a security monitoring room. Your only contact- a hotel employee named Rio. She's armed, beautiful, and she'll do anything you tell her. With your voice, you are her navigator. With her courage, she is your enforcer. Your alliance is the lone hope for survival. And possibly your only lifeline.

The first entirely voice-activated game on PlayStation 2.

Your voice commands the action!
Thousands of words and phrases recognized.
Compatible with USB headsets (for PlayStation 2)

Headset microphone required.

116097.name: The Shape Game
116097.description:
A game in the vein of Pictionary, played in teams where one team member draws a picture and the other team members try to guess what is being drawn.

One difference to Pictionary is that the game consists of 40 laminated cards, wipeclean pen and cloth, where each card already has a squiggle drawn on it that should be included in what you want to draw. Another difference is that the drawer chooses themselves what to draw, and has 30 seconds to draw as many pictures as they can, with the card being wiped clean as soon as someone guesses correctly.

116098.name: Casino Vegas
116098.description: A roll and move styled game, where the object is to accumulate the most money by playing Black Jack, Poker, Roulette, Craps and slot machines. You play each casino styled game for one round when you land on the gambling spot for it. Player's play against the "house" with another player performing the house position for the turn. The other players may perform side bets on the outcome while the gambling game progresses. The rules for each gambling game are abbreviated somewhat, but there is an entire Roulette layout with a spinner for the wheel along with the other layouts on the board. One space is a bank space where more money may be obtained.

116099.name: Build your own Business
116099.description:
This unique board game can be played by yourself or with friends.
You will start with $2000 dollars and try to build 40 successful businesses while earning hundreds of thousands of dollars, or you may go bankrupt trying.

Each player will have 20 spaces on a round board to place white chips. These chips cost different amounts according to the zone in which they are placed.These chips will also determine the amount of sales collected.there is one icon on the board his is the customer icon. The customer icon will travel around the board starting at the Alpha/Omega spot. As the customer travels around the board the players collect the sales if it lands on spaces they have chips on each players goal will be to earn enough money to buy 10 white chips for all 20 spaces they own. The player with the most money wins.

From the Website:
Thanks for investing in Build Your Own Business (BYOB), the game that lets the Player fulfill the American dream of owning and operating businesses. More than a decade of research and development led to the creation of this best new game in America and the World. One, two, or four Players play BYOB.

Playing BYOB presents the Player with the ups and downs of the typical startup business and gives motivated Players a chance to try their hand at “reaching the top.” Players select to invest from the specific business types in the Business Title Cards included in BYOB or create custom businesses with the blank Business Title Cards provided.

No matter the type(s) of business chosen, the goal in each of BYOB’s Five Phases, beginning with Phase 1, is to make the right management decisions to maximize the initial investment in each one. A business investment is “maximized” when it becomes a Preferred Asset on a Raw Land Parcel owned by the Player. Phase 1 is a game in itself. At the end of Phase 1, Players may move on to the subsequent Phases, suspend play to a future time, or quit the Game.

116100.name: James Bond 007: Quantum of Solace
116100.description:
Bond is back. Blending first person shooting and third person action, Quantum of Solace puts you in control of Bond's greatest weapon…HIS MIND. Based on both the Quantum of Solace and Casino Royale films, Quantum of Solace: The Game puts you in the ruthless world of international espionage.

Source: The Developer Website.

116101.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 2 No 1 - January 2049)
116101.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, AADA NEWS, ARENA WATCH, AUTODUEL ARTWORK, AUTODUELING FICTION, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, WADA NEWS, & WEB SITE WATCH.

116102.name: Training
116102.description:
Football-related game.

The 'board' consists of a tinplate area from the kicking spot to the goal at the other end. One player is the penalty taker, the other is the goalkeeper. The kicker must try to 'kick' the ball into the goal. This is harder than it looks.

After equal turns as being the goalkeeper, the player who scores the most goals, wins.

The board surround has adverts for Ford, Shell, Maxwell House Coffee, and Cinzano.

116103.name: Europa Cup
116103.description:
Action football game. The pitch and players are tinplate. The football players have their own indent, into which the ball will naturally settle. When it does, you can slide the player back, to get the football to come round to the fron of the player. Now you can use the player to kick the ball with the intention of either passing the ball to another player or to have a shot at the opposition goal.

The most goals scored, wins the game

116104.name: Minigolf
116104.description:
Tinplate golf game.

The board consists of six golf holes, not the normal kind but the holes you will expect on a Crazy Golf course.

In turn, each player must use the golfer to whack the ball up the course. This is done, by twisting him away from the ball and then move him back quickly to send the ball up the 'course'. After the six holes are finished, the player who took the least number of shots, wins.

116105.name: Miracle Tivoli
116105.description:
A curious mix of a shooting target game and bagatelle.

The tinplate board features a gun at one end and four supports at the other. On these supports are, the balls are placed. In your turn, you fire the gun, hoping to knock a ball off its support. If you are successful, the ball will fall on to the board and roll down into the scoring area. Into which indent the ball finally rests, determines the score you get for that ball.

After equal turns, the won with the most points, wins.

116106.name: Tootsietoy Speedway
116106.description:
The only board game I have ever found that was published by Tootsietoy, they were much better known as a toy company.

This game is a simple 'spin' a number and move around the track. All squares with instructions must be obeyed. Although the game comes with eight cars, only a maximum of four people can play (the track is only four lanes and each car uses its own lane). First to the finish line, wins.

The cars in the set are;
No.1 Stutz Bearcat, white
No.2 Duesenberg Special, gold
o.3 Marmon, yellow
No.4 Packard, red
No.5 Blitzen Benz, green
No.6 Studebaker Champion, silver
No.7 Peugeot Special, orange
No.8 National, lilac

116107.name: The Trapper Greyhound Racing Game
116107.description:
