Each player has a board that attaches to a centre base, where the hare is sat. A string is attached to the end of each board and at the word "Go", players must frantically wind in their string, which will send their greyhound towards the centre. The first greyhound to reach it, wins that race
Box dimensions: 14 x 7"

116108.name: Grandstand
116108.description:
A standard quiz game, a board and a book of 1,000 questions about the sports;
Boxing
Swimming
Sailing
Show Jumping
Gymnastics
Football

Correct answers advance you up the track on the board. First to reach the final space, wins.

At the time this was published, Grandstand was the most popular sports programme on BBC television. It aired on Saturday afternoons and covered a variety of sports but always ended with the football results (so listeners could check their Football Pools entry).

116109.name: Skill Shot
116109.description:
Action game for two players, related to Basketball or Netball. Each play at opposite ends of the board. In front of you there is a row of buttons. The board has a number of indentations, into which the ball will settle. When it does, if you press the right button, it will be ejected upward and forward. Of course, your opponent is trying to do the same thing, so speed is essential. There Are 10 Different Pitch Positions to Shoot From and the score is kept by a sliding mechanism on each side of the board.

Most 'baskets', wins

116110.description: The First Edition Commission Card pack contains all 34 Commission Cards for the original Pastiche First Edition. These cards have been edited and re-formatted for the Pastiche International edition and can be substituted for the original first edition cards.
116110.name: Pastiche: First Edition Commission Cards

116111.description: Expansion Pack 1 is for those who own the Pastiche International Edition. It includes 14 new commission cards by Cezanne, Rembrandt, Ter Borch, DaVinci, Bazille, Degas, Monet and Van Gogh.
116111.name: Pastiche: Expansion Pack #1

116112.description:
Expansion Pack 2 is for those who own the original Pastiche First Edition. It includes 14 new commission cards by Seurat, Cassatt, Vermeer, Homer, Renoir, Toulouse-Lautrec, Monet and Van Gogh.

These cards substitute some cards in the original First edition cards to make the cards the same as the ones in the International edition.
116112.name: Pastiche: Expansion Pack #2

116113.name: Black Hole
116113.description:
Abstract strategy game. Each player has a Simulator (in effect, a private board for each player). On this secret board a player may place his Black Holes (land on an enemy Black Hole and your spaceship is out of the game). Then players set out their spaceships.

Movement is plotted on your private screens and there is no combat system that requires a die roll. In that regard it would be like playing Chess with invisible pieces.

The object is to get across the main board, to the safety zone at the opposite side. On the way, enemy ships can take your ships, especially if you do not have defensive shields.

Contents
1 Playing Board.
2 Simulators.
44 Playing Pieces in Two Colours.
8 Black Hole Pieces.
2 Sets of Instructions.

116114.name: Round Up
116114.description:
Each player has a Marker and a Ranch. Place the steer discs on the board as per instructions. Spin the arrow to move. When landing on a square bearing your own brand - Take 1 steer from the pool and place it in your corral. Players can lose steers by landing on certain squares.
A Stampede can be an unpleasant place to land. It means you must spin for every steer in your corral - You must spin a 6 to keep them!

The objective is to be the first player to round up 6 steers and get them safely corralled.

Contents
1 Game Board.
1 Spinner.
4 Playing Pieces.
24 Steer Discs.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Base.

116116.name: Brain Gain
116116.description:
A series of 6 memory, Maths and word ability games played in a sequence with players keeping score of each game.

The players decide which of the six games they will play. They keep score of each gamer separately and after playing all the chosen games the winner is the one with the highest aggregate score.

The games:
Word Recall -- You try to remember as many words from the deck as possible. Then your opponent turns over all of the cards, snuffles removes some cards. And replaces them with others. The players must now name the five missing words.

Word sequence -- 10 words cards are dealt out. The player memorise the words on the cards and the order that they are laid out in. They are then turned over and the players must recite them ini the order they are laid out, if he makes a mistake thier turn is over.

Matching pairs -- The cards are split the matching pairs cards Into 2 sets - both need to contain one of each symbol Shuffle one set and arrange them, face up, in a grid formation,. One set is retained by the player.
The player then monitors the location of each card on the table, and the opponent turns them face down. The player must now match them with the ones In your hand When you find a match, remove the cards from your hand and the table and place the pair where your opponent can see it.

What's missing -- Ten of the shape cards are removed from the deck and placed, face up, on the table The player memorises the cards (you don't need to remember their locations). The opposing player to turns them over and shuffle them on (he also removes one of die cards). The cards are turned back over and the players must guess which of the cards is missing.

Number locate -- The ten number cards (0-9) are removed from the deck and place them, in a random order, in 2 rows of 5. The player now tries to remember where each number is. the other player turns them over, and then takes a number locate card and reads out each of the simple maths Questions in order. You must know the answer to the question and the location of the relevant number or numbers

Shape locate -- The shape cards are shuffled and laid out. face up. in a grid formation. You now have to memorise the location of each of the cards, before your opposing player turns them face down. Your opponent then takes one of the shape locate cards and reads out the shape that you need to find. After each sentence, you must try and find the specified shape and/or colour (e.g. find the red circle) by turning over one of the cards.

116119.name: Big Mountain 2000
116119.description:
Big Mountain 2000 puts the player in control of a racer using either snowboard or skis. There are three different modes to choose from: time attack, multi-player (two players maximum) and championship. The player can design custom gear, including equipment, and clothing.

Source: Wikipedia, "Big Mountain 2000", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116120.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 2 No 2 - February 2049)
116120.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, AADA NEWS, AADA ROAD ATLAS AND SURVIVAL GUIDE, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, DEATH RACING ASSOCIATION OF WASHINGTON STATE (DRAW) NEWS, THE FIRING RANGE, FIFTY YEARS AGO TODAY, FORMULA DE NEWS, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, HEAVY METAL, HIGH VELOCITY DUELING (HVD) NEWS, JOURNAL WATCH, THE NANS TICKER, VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW, WADA EVENTS, WADA NEWS, & WEB SITE WATCH.

116121.name: AeroGauge
116121.description:
User Summary
A futuristic racer in the mold of Wipeout or F-Zero that features ten machines that can be raced in Grandprix, single, multiplayer or time attack modes across the six different tracks.

116122.name: Chameleon Twist
116122.description:
This 3D platform game stars Davy, a blue chameleon, as he travels across six themed worlds. The chameleon's elongated tongue can be used as a weapon, a means to traverse gaps, or as a way to leap onto platforms. Once the tongue is unrolled, it can be guided in any direction using the analog stick.In addition to the single-player game, Chameleon Twist offers a battle option, allowing two to four players the chance to take part in either a Battle Royal or Time Trial event

Source: Wikipedia, "Chameleon Twist", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116123.name: Chameleon Twist 2
116123.description:
A Sequal to Chameleon Twist. The game changed certain aspects of the original, such as the character designs and the switched colors of the main characters. New moves were added such as a parachute that could be deployed to make a slow descent and that could be used in conjunction with the tongue. Moreover, vertical pole swings were added, rather than having only horizontal.The worlds are much longer than those of the first. However, there is no longer a multiplayer mode.

Source: Wikipedia, "Chameleon Twist 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116124.name: Lokus
116124.description: This is a card game about going to the loo. Players try to send one of their eleven people (cards) to an outhouse, but there are only two of these available. Whoever doesn't get a seat has to go to the forest - resulting in a negative score.

116126.name: Dark Rift
116126.description:
Dark Rift (Space Dynamites in Japan) is a 3D fighting game for the N64, notable for being the first N64 game to use 60frame/s, as well as being N64's first native fighting game. It is also unusual among fighting games in that fights go for a default three-out-of-five rounds, as opposed to the more conventional two-out-of-three.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dark Rift", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116128.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 2 No 3 - March 2049)
116128.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, AADA NEWS, AADA ROAD ATLAS AND SURVIVAL GUIDE, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, FIFTY YEARS AGO TODAY, FORMULA DE NEWS, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, HEAVY METAL, HIGH VELOCITY DUELING (HVD) NEWS, NANS TICKER, VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW, WADA EVENTS, WADA NEWS, & WEB SITE WATCH.

116129.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 2 No 4 - April 2049)
116129.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, AADA NEWS, ARENA MANAGER'S OFFICE, ARENA WATCH, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, FIFTY YEARS AGO TODAY, FORMULA DE NEWS, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, HEAVY METAL, NANS TICKER, VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW, WADA EVENTS, & WEB SITE WATCH.

116130.name: Bugs Bunny Shooting Game
116130.description:
Shooting game linked to characters in the Warner Brothers' cartoons.

Players take turns shooting at the target. If they can make one of the plastic rabbits spin round, it counts as a success and will score 5, 10, 15 or 20 points.

After an agreed number of turns, the player with the most points, wins.

It might be compulsory to call out "Hunt the Wabbit" as you play.

116131.name: Doctor Who: Evacuation Earth
116131.description:
The story features both the Daleks and Silurians. The Doctor has to help humans as they attempt to evacuate the Earth, while the Daleks intervene and attempt to force the Doctor to help them instead.

Source: Wikipedia, "Doctor Who: Evacuation Earth", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116132.name: Club Golf
116132.description:
The number and nature of the cards have been calculated to present a game of skill, as near to the true game of golf as possible (says the publisher).

Each player's ability is affected by the handicap drawn, both in the distance the ball is struck and the number of hazards encountered. The types of club used are represented by club cards. Hazards commonly encountered in the game are represented by hazard cards. The limitations imposed on a player by their handicap, are further controlled by the hazard handicap detail tables. Penalty cards have to be drawn as indicated by some hazard cards.

There are course score cards for three levels of play - Short, Long and Championship. There is also a Pro Golf Game to play.

The game says "As played by John Richardson" , but I have no idea who he is. At least a professional golfer I hope.

Contents
2 Packs of Hazard Cards(75 Per Pack).
2 Packs of Club Cards(29 Per Pack).
1 Pack of Handicap Cards.
4 Penalty Cards.
22 Score Cards(3 Types).
Money in Two Denominations.
1 Set of Rules.
2 Sets of Rules For Pro Golf.

116133.name: Spinimax
116133.description:
Spinimax is a three-player game for the Shibumi set.

The board starts empty. Players take turns adding a piece of their colour to an empty board cell.

Whenever a 2x2 platform is formed, at any level, then a piece is placed on top, its colour being the minority colour in the 2x2 platform (if any) otherwise the majority colour.

The winner is the owner of the piece placed at the apex of the pyramid on the final move.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

116135.name: Freddy Hardest
116135.description:
User Summary:
Freddy Hardest is a platform game with a space theme. Freddy is hunky spacehero that has crashed his spaceship on a planet, and need to steal one from the aliens on the planet. First level is a scrolling landscape. Second level, that you need the code from completing the first to play, is loaded separetly. In level two he need to find a ship, fuel and a codeword for take-off.

videogame.70389: Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games

116136.name: Mario & Sonic at the London 2012 Olympic Games

videogameseries.4877: Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games

116136.description:
The game is a collection of various events based on the Olympic Games. Players assume the role of a Nintendo or Sega character while competing against the others in these events.

Several Olympic events on the Wii, including soccer, badminton, and equestrian debut alongside improved versions of previously existing events such as athletics, aquatics, and table tennis. The Wii game introduces new "Dream Events", which are alternate versions of Olympic events taking place in locations from older games of the Mario and Sonic series. The Wii version also introduces new cooperative mechanics and a Party mode.

The 3DS version will have over fifty Olympic-based events in single-player and multiplayer.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mario & Sonic at the London 2012 Olympic Games", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116137.name: Freddy Hardest in South Manhattan
116137.description:
User Summary:
Freddy Hardest in South Manhattan is a beat 'em up with the character from the first Freddy Hardest game. This time it's not a space theme, but located in New York City. The game was released in English and Spanish (Freddie Hardest en Manhattan sur). Re-released by Codemasters as The Guardian Angel.

116138.name: Captain Dynamo
116138.description:
Captain Dynamo is a platform game that was released for the Commodore Amiga and other platforms in 1993, developed by Codemasters. It was later ported for play on mobile phones.

Source: Wikipedia, "Captain Dynamo (video game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116139.name: Dual Heroes
116139.description:
Back of box
The N64's first 3D fighting action game. Heroes battle it out using combo attacks in 3D space. Train your robot and have it fight in the Auto-Battle. 8 Virtual Gamers challenge you.

116140.name: Fighters Destiny
116140.description:
In Fighters Destiny, the player controls a polygon-based character in a three dimensional battle arena. The game features typical hand to hand combat fighting: using a variety of punches, kicks, locks, and throws, players attempt to pummel their opponents into submission.In most versus fighting games, the objective is to deplete the opponent's health gauge. Fighters Destiny follows the same concept but also relies on a customizable point scoring system to determine the winner.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fighters Destiny", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116141.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 2 No 5 - May 2049)
116141.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, AADA NEWS, ARENA MANAGER'S OFFICE, ARENA WATCH, AUTODUEL FICTION, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, FIFTY YEARS AGO TODAY, FORMULA DE NEWS, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, HEAVY METAL, NANS TICKER, VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW, WADA EVENTS, VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW, WADA EVENTS, & WEB SITE WATCH.

116142.name: Pyramid Shambo
116142.description:
Pyramid Shambo is tournament-style Rock Paper Scissors (aka Roshambo), with pyramids used as scoring chips. Pyramid Shambo is to RPS what a Texas Hold ‘em Tournament is to a single hand of classic poker.

Each player in turn challenges another to a round of Roshambo, with the loser paying the winner a small pyramid, making change as necessary based on pip counts. Every time there's a tie, the payout escalates and the players continue to throw until there's a winner. A player gets a bonus for eliminating another, and the eliminated player's pyramids are removed from the game. The last player standing wins.

This was made available on the Looney Labs web site late in 2011 as the company's holiday gift to fans.

Also included in Pyramid Arcade.

116143.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 2 No 6 - June 2049)
116143.description:
User Summary

In this article: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, ARENA WATCH, CONSTRUCTION ZONE, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, FIFTY YEARS AGO TODAY, FORMULA DE NEWS, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, HEAVY METAL, THE NANS TICKER, VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW, WADA NEWS, & WEB SITE WATCH.

116144.name: Scribblenauts Remix
116144.description:
Scribblenauts Remix is an emergent action puzzle game developed by 5th Cell and Iron Galaxy Studios and published by Warner Bros. Interactive on October 12, 2011. The game provides forty levels from both Scribblenauts and its sequel, Super Scribblenauts along with ten new levels for iOS. The mechanics of the game are based on Super Scribblenauts, allowing for the use of adjectives in addition to nouns.

Source: Wikipedia, "Scribblenauts Remix", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116145.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 2 No 7 -  July 2049)
116145.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, AADA NEWS, ARENA MANAGER'S OFFICE, CONSTRUCTION ZONE, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, FIFTY YEARS AGO TODAY, FORMULA DE NEWS, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, HEAVY METAL, HIGHWAY ONE, THE NANS TICKER, VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW, WADA NEWS, & WEB WATCH.

116146.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 2 No 8 - August 2049)
116146.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, 50 YEARS AGO TODAY, THE FIRING RANGE, NANS TICKER, VADR, WADA NEWS, & WEB WATCH.

116147.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 2 No 9 - September 2049)
116147.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, CONSTRUCTION ZONE, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, 50 YEARS AGO TODAY, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, HEAVY METAL, NANS TICKER, VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW, WADA NEWS, & WEB WATCH.

116148.name: Big Game
116148.description:
The target is set up and placed inside the box. The rifle is then loaded with two corks. Players stand about five feet in front of the target and are allowed a round of six shots. When a target is hit, the target falls backwards and the score revealed.

The player who scores the most points after an agreed number of rounds is the winner.

Contents
1 Target With Six Animal Targets and Stand.
1 Double Shot Rifle.
4 Corks.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Lid.

116149.name: Disneyland Pop-Up Race Game
116149.description:
Colourful game with Donald, Pluto, Goofy and Mickey character pieces.

Three-dimensional race game. A simple roll and move game but with the added feature, the track takes you upwards as well as along the flat part of the board.

116150.name: The Lair of Xar
116150.description:
TLOX is an action role playing game with randomly generated content. Your task is to slay an evil minotaur named Xar who has ravaged the villages near his lair. To challenge Xar you must first make your way to the final floor where he resides. Along the way you will find items and power-ups to help you accomplish this task. Are you ready to face the might of Xar?

Source: The Game Website.

116151.name: Markover
116151.description:
A shooting target game but much more realistic than usual.

It comprises of double sided cardboard game birds including pheasants, ducks and grouse.

It comes with two elastic band repeater guns, and all the components are housed in a fitted wooden case. The rules are pasted on to the inside of the box lid.

Both players fire away at the same time, the most successful hits is the winner.

116152.name: Prospector
116152.description:
"A roguelike in space"
In an unexplored sector of space humanity is trying to establish a permanent presence. Megacorporations employ freelance prospectors to find exploitable resources and map unknown planets for them. The player commands one of those scoutships, trying to become filthy rich as a prospector.

Source: The Game Website.

116154.name: Dodge the Daleks
116154.description:
The first Doctor Who board game published.

It is a simple roll and move game, where players advance their pawns and obey instructions encountered along the way. The track winds in and out until you reach the Secret City. The first to do so, wins.

If you encounter a Dalek, you are knocked out of the game

This game dates back to the series when William Hartnell was the Doctor.

116155.name: Noah's Ark Race Game
116155.description:
A simple roll and move game for youngsters.

The animal discs are placed face up on the board. Player's move by throws of the die and follow the path. If you land exactly on an animal disc, then you can place it in your ark. Watch out for the different coloured spaces, some help, some hinder. The first player to fill their ark, wins.

There is a game variant where points are awarded for the various animals. The most points earned, wins.

Contents
1 Playing Board.
4 Pawns.
1 Die.
4 Noah's Ark Cards.
21 Animal Counters.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Base

116156.name: Thelwell's Penelope and Kipper Race Game
116156.description:
Players each take one of the coloured Penelope and Kipper playing pieces.

A simple roll and move game. The objective is to reach the finish first. You must obey penalties for landing on a red square, But if you land on a pink square, you gain an advantage. There are additional penalties and advantages on some water Jumps.

Contents
1 Playing Board.
4 Horse Playing Pieces
4 Bases.
1 Die and Shaker.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Base.

116157.name: Flying Dragon (N64)
116157.description:
Flying Dragon is a fighting game with role-playing video game elements.Its most notable feature was the game's SD mode that featured a character progression system, in which characters advance in levels as they become more experienced, and in which it is possible to collect credits and treasure items to equip characters with.

Source: Wikipedia, "Flying Dragon", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116158.name: Deadly Arts
116158.description:
The story follows a series of 8 fighters that have each gotten a mysterious letter to come and compete in a legendary contest, and about a champion that has disappeared.There is a Versus mode as well as a create your own fighter option.While creating their own character, the player can choose which type of body, height and such, then practice with the new player in the training area to gain more moves. Unlike most 3D fighting games the player also receives points for how well they do, and the combination of moves they use.

Source: Wikipedia, "G.A.S.P!! Fighters' NEXTream", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116159.name: In Fisherman Bass Hunter 64
116159.description:
Bass Hunter 64 is mainly a fishing tournament game with an optional "Fish for Fun" mode. You begin with four lures, two line weights, reel, rod, and a boat, the remaining items in the game must be purchased by winning points in the tournament mode. Once each tournament is beaten another area will be unlocked for the player to use in either Tournament or Fun mode.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bass Hunter 64", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116160.name: Milo's Astro Lanes
116160.description:
The game takes place in a futuristic world where there are intergalactic bowling alleys. It makes use of the Rumble Pak and the Controller Pak.
6 playable characters
12 galactic lanes
6 types of bowling balls
Multiplayer modes including 4 player simultaneous mode

Source: Wikipedia, "Milo's Astro Lanes", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116161.name: Sinking
116161.description:
"Sinking" is a board game in which every player is the commander of a pirate ship that is sinking. To do so you have to give orders to your crew so that they can create opportunities to attack, defend and take water out of the ship.

This is achieved through blind-bidding. Each turn the players hide their boards using the provided shields and bid on the several actions and functions (attack and drain water out of the boat) so that they can gain more resources or affect the other players's bids. Then they all reveal the boards and compare their bids. Only one player solves each action so be sure to pay extra for the ones you want. At the end of the turn the ships sink according to the amount of water the players let into the boat.

116163.name: Das Wissensquiz Pferde
116163.description: Question game with three possible answers, the question is' diced, the issues are keeping, breeding, equestrian sports, races, riders, diseases, equipment, ponies and care. Depending on the version you have to collect a small plate of each color or get rid of the flakes to win the game.

116164.name: Wissens-Quiz
116164.description: At 240 cards, there are more than 4500 questions and answer choices from the fields of knowledge of history, geography, Politic & Science, Arts & Culture, Sports & Leisure, and geography. On each card there are 4 questions found with each of four possible answers. In his turn the player's neighbor asks a question. The color of the category is rolled with die. If the answer is correct he gets the card. The first player who has a card from each category wins the game.

116165.name: Gehirn-Jogging
116165.description:
The object of the game is to collect action cards solving the problems. The cards are stacked separately by type, there are colors, shapes, word and number cards. In his turn, the player rotate around the any top action card and try to solve the task. If the hourglass run out, the problem is called or the solution must be done. If the problem is solved correctly, you get the card. The solutions to the question cards can be found in the rule.
Player who first solve predetermined number of tasks (5,10 or 15) wins the game,

116167.name: Roman Invasion of Britain
116167.description:
A board game for 2-4 players about Roman expansion into British Isles circa 43-84 AD.
The map is Britannia divided into native Tribal regions with a resistance level.
It's a cooperative game, the Romans players against a Briton's Tribe deck. Be careful, Romans can be allies against Briton but the victory points are individuals (if a player needs help for a battle from another player, he must share the victory points with him).
The game ends when all regions have been captured.
To play you need 1D6, Capture and Victory Tokens, 2 decks of cards (Roman and Briton) and a map of course.

116168.description: The object of the game is to help little Polarbear and his friends to build a snowman. Players move on the game board on the other side and back rolling the dice and each time they arrived, one part of three-part snowman gets ready.
116168.name: Schneemann Spiel

116169.description:
"The bears and the Salmon" in English
The object of this card game is to capture the salmon of his opponents with his bears. But players must be careful to protect their own fish.

Players play cards simultaneously. Who has played bears my capture salmon of any opponent. If there are no bears who has captured player's salmon he may take it himself.

The player who has caught the most salmon at the end of the game is the winner.
116169.name: Des ours et des saumons

116170.description:
Players lay their cards, add up the values ​​and when there is enough wings, pigs can fly!

In his turn, player pick a card and plays against the pig of his choice.
Once a player manages to have enough wings to at least match the weight of the pig, he wins the card and the pig is replaced
Some cards are action cards. They will give bonuses to help you be faster than others, by replaying a wing card, doubling the value of one of them or by decreasing the weight of a pig.

If the Pig deck is exhausted the game ends and the player with the most pigs is the winner.
116170.name: Quand les cochons sauront voler

116171.name: Kinect Battle Stuff
116171.description:
User Summary

Battle Stuff is a boxing game between your household items. First the player has to scan two items using the Kinect sensor. The game creates a fighter profile to each of the scanned object.
All you have to do now is fight.
Every round a player chooses one of the three moves; Punch, Grab and Counter. The rest of the game goes like Rock Paper Scissors.

When a health bar is reduced to zero, the other object wins.

116172.name: Kinect Musical Feet
116172.description:
User Summary

Chhange your living room into a keyboard. Once the game does start you can choose one of eight instruments or record a voice to play on a virtual keyboard which is laid out across the floor.
Players can play up to four people and share their recordings with friends.

116173.name: Kinect Mutation Station
116173.description:
User Summary

In Mutation Station players can transform themselves. With a couple different filters, you can turn into a silly demented version of yourself and share the photos and/or video online.
The Kinect sensor morphs only the players and not the background.

116174.name: MRC: Multi Racing Championship
116174.description:
MRC features ten cars, which are divided into two groups: road cars and off-road vehicles. There are seven different areas for car customization: tires, brakes, suspension, steering, transmission, gear ratio, and aerodynamics. MRC includes three tracks.
In Championship mode, the player competes against nine computer-controlled racers. In Time Trial mode, players try to finish a course in as short a time as possible. Free Run mode lets the player drive freely without other opponents or time limit. The VS Race mode lets two players compete against each other. The unlockable Match Race option pits the player against a hidden computer opponent in a night-time race.

Source: Wikipedia, "Multi-Racing Championship", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116175.name: Kinect Air Band
116175.description:
User Summary

In Kinect Air Band one or two players perform in a band, while playing air instruments. Players can choose between, drums, guitar and keyboard. A neon instrument magically appears on screen and you begin to make music, switching instruments at any time by holding your arms by your side before beginning a different mime.
There are 5 different music styles :disco, rock, pop, latin and country.

116176.name: Kinect Build a Buddy
116176.description:
User Summary

With Kincet Build-a-buddy players can make thier stuff alive. A palyer scans an object. Once scanned the object is put into a machine. The player can make some choice to add character properties to the scanned object.
Then the machine will create a buddy. The players can play and talk with their new buddy, which can be recorded on video.

116177.name: Kinect Me
116177.description:
User Summary

In Kinect Me players can create their own avatar. A player stands in front of the Kinect sensor to make a scan of the players clothes, face and voice.
When the player is scanned the avatar can change clothes and backgrounds to pose for a photoshoot. Players can share their photo's with eachother.

116178.name: Kinect Bobble Head
116178.description:
User Summary

In kinect Bobble Head, a player can scan himself of an object. The Kinect scans the clothes, face and record the players voice.
It will create a Bobble head figure of the scanned player or object. The player can now shake the head.
Photos of the Bobble Head can be shared online.

116179.name: Rocket: Robot on Wheels
116179.description:
Back of the Box (PAL)
Disaster has struck the Extra Galactic amusment park Whoopie World.
Tomorrow is opening day and the second mascot Jo-Jo the Raccoon has pledged to destroy the park. Their only hope is that Rocket: Robot on Wheels can foil Jo-Jo's plans and save Whoopie World. As Rocket explore 6 spectactular lands filled with riddles and challenges. Ride the park's awesome vehicles and change the environments to reveal additional surprises.

116180.name: Rugrats Scavenger Hunt
116180.description:
Rugrats: Scavenger Hunt is an interactive board video game. The game features three game boards. Angelica's Temple of Gloom which has an Aztec setting, Pirate Treasure Hunt where the babies scuba dive under water to find hidden treasure near a sunken ship, and Reptar Rally which is the only stage that changes the babies into dinosaurs (resembling the form of Reptar). In each of the boards, Players control one of four babies including Tommy, Chuckie, Phil, and Lil. Angelica serves as the main antagonist, trying to snatch the items in question before the others.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rugrats: Scavenger Hunt", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116181.name: Avatar Kinect
116181.description:
User Summary

Players can make a scan of themselves to create an avatar. When a player has an avatar it comes alive with the movements of the player. A player can invite other players to hangout, form a rock band or act in a talk- or late night show.

116182.name: Starshot: Space Circus Fever
116182.description:
Back of box (US N64)

Take a ride through the cosmos with Starshot the star juggler of the Space Circus. Your courage and skill will be challenged as you battle to overcome Wolfgang Von Ravel, the evil boss of your crooked competitor - the Virtua Circus. Only you can save the Space Circus form extinction.
- Total freedom fo movement in a world of rich 3D graphics.
- Starshot can walk, run, talk, swim and fly while shooting stars he can control.
- Featuring more than 300 cosmical characters from a variety of planets

116183.name: Twisted Edge: Extreme Snowboarding
116183.description:
Back of box (US)

- Carve into it anywhere - Hidden trails, short cuts and bonuses when you go off the beaten path
- Not happy with your style? Study your moves with the full track multi camera angle instant replay! Then go back and try it again.
- Execute back to back maneuvers, awesome stunts and daredevil tricks.
- Loaded with riders, boards and secrets - each with their own unique qualities

116184.name: Cyber Doll
116184.description:
User Summary

Cyber Doll is an RPG where you fight randomly appearing enemies in turn-based combat. Each body part has independent hit points. There are a wide variety of weapons that can either target specific body parts or the entire body. Depleting the HP of a body part incapacitates the target in some way (ie. no leg HP prevents a character from moving).

116185.name: Old School Race
116185.description:
"Old School Race is an amazing game, perfect for spending time alone or a night with your friends; thanks to the multiplayer option and the extremely easy driving control you can play with three other friends on the same tablet. You don’t need particular skill to play. You drive with a finger like the old slot car racing when the cars shot along an electric track; for this reason it’s good for all ages even for youngsters who can challenge dad, mum, brothers and sisters. Instead for the most expert drivers there’s the possibility of comparing their race time with the best world racing times using the challenge option. Very well done graphics with different race setting Try playing it! Old School Race is available on tablets and works on three different Operating Systems: Apple, Android and Blackberry Playbook."

Source: The Developer Website.

116186.name: Power Delivery
116186.description:
User Summary

You are the best driver in the world and your job is to transport and deliver VIP packages trhough a host of enemies.

Can you live up to the task?

116187.name: Simply Ludo
116187.description:
"Ludo (from Latin ludo, "I play") is a simple board game for two to four players, in which the players race their four tokens from start to finish according to dice rolls."

Source: Wikipedia, "Ludo (board game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116188.name: Spaghetti
116188.description:
Spaghetti is a two player game that serves up spaghetti, sauce, and meatballs on a Shibumi plate.

One player takes the white spaghetti marbles; the other takes the red sauce marbles. The black meatball marbles are neutral and are used by either player as needed. Any small object, such as a napkin or black marble, is used as a tie-breaker token to indicate which player last played a black marble to the board.

To start, White plays a black meatball marble anywhere on an empty Shibumi board and takes the tie-breaker token.

Players then alternate placing one of their own marbles adjacent to the last placed marble. Here, adjacent means orthogonally or diagonally adjacent to and on the same level as the last placed marble or onto a 2x2 platform just completed by the last placed marble.

If a player is unable to place a marble in this way, she or he places a black meatball marble on any empty space or platform and takes the tie-breaker token.

The game ends when the only space left is the peak of the Shibumi pyramid. A black meatball marble is then placed on the top of the pyramid. This is a neutral move and the tie breaker token stays with its current owner.

The player who created the longest strand of touching spaghetti or sauce marbles (when the board is viewed from above) wins the game. If there is a tie, the player who last played a meatball marble loses.

A strand is a connected set of like-colored marbles such that each marble in the strand is connected to one or two other marbles in the strand as in a chain of links. There is no looping back where a single marble is passed through more than once and there is no branching.

So now the meal is served. Enjoy.

Buon Appetito!

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

116189.name: Police Party
116189.description:
Party game where players bet on the answers given by their opponents, knowing that the questions are: forensic science, investigative techniques, TV series, the cons-intelligence, unusual facts, amazing stories etc.

Players take the role of the police, all suspected of being dirty cops! Which will prove that he is not the one?

Each player gets question. Then they bet with their set of cards for opponents who is guilty or who gets points.
After that they answer the questions.
If the answer is incoorect he gets all the points wagered by the opponents. If the answer is correct the opponents get the points they give.

The goal is to have the fewest points at the end of five turns.

116190.name: The Slimy Lichmummy
116190.description:
TSL is an adventure game by Ulf Åström, similar in style to the classic "Rogue".
You play the role of an adventurer exploring a bleak and hostile world. Battle peculiar beasts and overcome sinister traps. Improve your character by replacing body parts with machinery. This is no ordinary "fantasy" setting. Everyone loses, everyone dies.
TSL has quick gameplay and high replay value. Each game is randomly generated and has different levels, item and monster placement. Turn-based gameplay gives you ample time to think about each move. There is more than one way to deal with each situation. There is no need to "grind" and "level up" - only player skill counts. You start each game with the accumulated knowledge of previous sessions.
TSL is not easy and forgiving - it is actively trying to kill you and requires great skill to outsmart. Death is permanent: when you die, there is no way to bring a character back. While this might sound discouraging at first, the appeal lies in the trial and error, discovery itself. Even death tries to be fair and educational: every time you die, you will know what killed you and learn not to do that again. Eventually you will master rules.

Source: The Game Website.

116192.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 2 No 10 - October 2049)
116192.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, 50 YEARS AGO TODAY, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, NANS TICKER, WADA NEWS, & WEB WATCH.

116193.name: Grand Rogue Auto
116193.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Grand Theft Auto.




Grand Rogue Auto is an attempt at writing a Grand Theft Auto themed graphical roguelike. The setting takes place in a procedurally generated modern city (populated with citizens, shops, buildings of several kind,…) and its neighborhood. The player will gain money by completing random missions, wreaking havoc, and working for different factions. This money can be used to buy ammo, weaponry, armors, items, locations and so on.

Source: The Game Website.

116194.name: Déclic!? Family
116194.description:
360 new challenges for this family version of Déclic! / Trigger!
with a simpler mechanism suitable for younger audience.

Integrates with:

Trigger!

116195.name: Ascii Sector
116195.description:
Ascii Sector is a free space combat/exploration/trading game for Windows, Mac OS X and Linux. You start with a simple spaceship and can then accept missions or trade goods to earn enough money to upgrade your ship or buy a new one.

You can engage in deadly fights both in space, on the ground and on board spaceships, and using the Ascii Sector scripting language, you can create your own quests for the game or have fun with other players' quests

Source: The Game Website.

116196.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 2 No 11 - November 2049)
116196.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, 50 YEARS AGO TODAY, THE FIRING RANGE, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, HEAVY METAL, NANS TICKER, VADR, WADA NEWS, & WEB WATCH.

116197.name: Confuzion
116197.description:
Confuzion is a puzzle game developed and published by Incentive Software for the ZX Spectrum, Commodore 64, BBC Micro, and Acorn Electron. The object is to guide a spark along a fuse wire. It is similar to the later and more widely known Pipe Mania.

Source: Wikipedia, "Confuzion," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116198.name: Tales of Maj'Eyal: Age of Ascendancy

videogamehonor.21142: 2011 Charles S. Roberts Best Science-Fiction or Fantasy Computer Wargame Nominee

116198.description:
Tales of Maj'Eyal (ToME) is an open-source, single-player, tactical role-playing roguelike and action game set in the world of Eyal.

This is the Age of Ascendancy, after over ten thousand years of strife, pain and chaos the known world is at last at relative peace. The Spellblaze last effects are now tamed, the land slowly heals itself and the civilisations rebuild themselves after the Age of Pyre.

You are an adventurer, looking for old powers, treasure and glory. You boldly go in lost and forgotten places, untamed forests and sealed ruins. What will you find in this age of supposed peace ?

Source: The Game Website.

User Summary

Tales of Maj'Eyal: Age of Ascendancy is the latest iteration of ToME, originally a variant of Angband, originally named PernAngband and subsequently as Tales of Middle Earth. It has been completely rewritten and re-themed from Angband's Tolkien-derived setting to the wholly original world of Eyal.

116199.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 2 No 12 - December 2049)
116199.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, BLASTS FROM THE PAST, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, DARKFUTURETECH FICTION, 50 YEARS AGO TODAY, THE FIRING RANGE, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, HEAVY METAL, NANS TICKER, WEB WATCH, & WADA NEWS.

116200.name: Millionaire
116200.description:
Millionaire is a management game originally written for the ZX Spectrum by John Hunt and ported to the Acorn Electron and BBC Micro. Millionaire is a text-based management game in which the player takes the role of a home-based games programmer who has written a program and must market it to the retailers. Starting with an investment of £500, you require this money to pay advertisers and tape duplication costs. Meanwhile you must constantly write new games promote your products and keep a tight lid on costs. Other aspects of the game is a character called Honest Harry who could offer you deals such as cheap cassettes, which will lessen the cost of your distribution costs, or programs. Sometimes, these deals are not so good as the programs could be bugged or stolen, ultimately costing you dearly.
Progress in the game is monitored by observing the sales figures at the end of each month. If the player made enough money the a screenshot of a bigger and better house/office was displayed. Chance played a part of the game, involving certain events which will affect your sales, such as a good review or someone digging up your past. The game itself is simplistic and will only offer limited appeal, as essentially its has too much randomness.

Source: Wikipedia, "Millionaire (video game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116201.name: Chute-2
116201.description:
The balls are placed in random order on both sides of the chute. The Pattern Cards are placed face down.

The first Pattern Card is turned over. Players then flip their balls into the chute, so that they pass through the tunnel trap gate, in the same colour sequence as the Pattern Card. As soon as the last ball is through, close the gate and trap your opponent. Points are scored and play continues with the next card. There are penalties for balls placed in the wrong order.

The winner is the player with the highest score at the end of the game.

"Flick,Roll and Race Through the Tunnel Traps in a Contest of Skill and Excitement."

Contents
1 Play Area.
1 Tunnel Trap Piece.
22 Balls.
10 Pattern Cards.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Lid.

116202.name: Dead Space (Mobile)

videogamehonor.32826: 2012 British Academy Game Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee

116202.description:
User Summary
The mobile version of Dead Space is a wholly new game set between the original Dead Space and Dead Space 2. It is a third-person action shooter much akin to its console/PC counterparts, but with controls designed for a touch screen device.

116204.name: NCAA March Madness 2003
116204.description:
User Summary

NCAA March Madness 2003 is a college basketball simulator from Electronic Arts. The game features commentary, team chants, rosters from the 2002-2003 season, and the standard game modes such as season, tournament, and exhibition. Teams from every division are featured in the game.

116205.name: Surgical Strike
116205.description:
User Summary

A full-motion video production, Surgical Strike is set in a future where a special force has been set up to deal with high-tech terrorists. As with most games, however, you as the player are responsible for doing everything while your team just talks a lot. Your job is to pilot an armed hovercraft and destroy all of the terrorists.

116206.name: HelperMonkey.Com/Santa
116206.description:
From the Introduction:

A message has come in over the HelperMonkey.com network:

Help, this is S. Claus. I need to deliver Christmas presents. Too many good children this year. I will wait for you at the North Pole.

Could it really be that Santa has gotten overwhelmed with presents and needs to call upon the help of highly-trained monkeys? What happened to his helper elves? Can you possibly help deliver all of the world’s presents on time? Most importantly, will you receive holiday pay for this?

HelperMonkey.com/Santa is an adventure for 2 – 6 primates, ideally suited for 3 or more. The monkeys will be tasked with a mission of the utmost importance: bringing presents and spreading Christmas joy to children the world over – without being seen by any of the little tykes (a monkey’s job is a thankless one).

116207.name: Pitman
116207.description:
Pitman is a 3D roguelike for iPhone, iPodTouch and iPad.

You are Krumb, a dwarven pitman with the quest for mighty artifacts. On your journey through mysterious mines, swamps and dungeons you will encounter many dangerous enemies, from the malicious cave goblins to the enormous trolls. Drink from health fountains, open treasure chests, collect a wide range of food, weapons and magical items and use them wisely - to eventually stand your ground against the perils that await you!

Source: The Game Website.

116208.name: Charad'Mania
116208.description:
Nearly 400 charades divided into seven themes: History, Geography, Politics, Art, Sport, Showbiz and Animals.
Each player receives a card with a card theme and mime. Each player in turn takes a card, reads the charade and made ​​the mime. The player who finds the correct answer first wins the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Contents:

400 cards
1 die
an hourglass
chips
pions

116209.name: Charad Mania! Junior
116209.description:
Charad'Mania version suitable also for younger audiance.
Play charades around the animals, crafts, nature and geography. Each player receives a card with a card theme and mime. Each player in turn takes a card, reads the charade and made ​​the mime. The player who finds the correct answer first wins the card. This game is easily adjustable to reduce the playing time or to facilitate the parties in sorting the cards. Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Contents:

200 cards (160 charades and mimes 40 mimes cards)

116210.name: Pony vs Pony: Battle is Magic
116210.description:
From the official Website

Rainbows, sunshine, cupcakes, puzzles and... PONIES all in one game! Join the herd with your very own NP(ony)C that you will be able to completely customize with tattoos, clothing, horns, wings, pets, and MORE! This epically-addictive casual puzzle game will have you racing to catch up to your friends! (And the sparkly, supersweet theme song will really spur you on!)

116211.name: HeroSmash
116211.description:
From the Game Website

Create a Hero or Super Villain and fight to help your side battle against the enemy. HeroSmash is a Free, massively multiplayer online role playing game (MMORPG) built in Flash that you can play in real-time on your web browser without a download! Battle evil (or become evil) as a hero wielding super powers! You can fully customize your hero to wear anything from ice-covered frozen armor, darkness armor with skulls, or even a mechanical robot armor!

116212.description:
Phantom League: Pilot Academy, the second expansion for Phantom League, includes two separate and major optional additions:


Battle rules, which change the battle system radically, and
Galactic Balance, which make missions have a larger effect than just Recognition, and Surface Missions, which is another way to gather Recognition (and affect Galactic Balance)


Phantom League: Pilot Academy is meant to make a player's immersion in the world of Phantom League even deeper, while offering more tactical choices during battles. Phantom League: Pilot Academy can be used without Mostly Harmless, the first expansion for PL, although it includes a separate rules booklet for those who do use Mostly Harmless.
116212.name: Phantom League: Pilot Academy

116213.name: Objectif Zéro
116213.description:
"Target Zero" in English

Players roll 5 x d20 dice and everyone try to find the best possible number closest to zero doing 4 mathematical operations.

In "Expert" variant each elementary operation is to be used once and only once.

116214.name: Tribal-Zone
116214.description:
Tribal-Zone consists is a small set of tiles with 3x3 grids of different symbols and background colors.
In his turn player draws a tile and place it to score points. Each newly formed alignment of at least three boxes with the same background color is worth 1 point. Each alignment of at least three identical symbols 3 points.
Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

116215.name: Castello
116215.description:
There are 30 game-pieces for each player and 11 castles. The gameboard is divided into three sections: homes and center section.

Object of the game is to capture four castles (among those of the central section and the other side) or 28 pawns of Your opponent.

In his turn player moves one of his pieces, horizontally, vertically or diagonally. In his first move, a pawn can move two squares after that only one square. Additionally a pawn can jump over another pawn as long as the square behind that pawn is free.
Multiple jumps are allowed and all enemy pawns are captured this way and removed from the deck. A pawn can capture a maximum of five enemy pieces, and his movement ends after the fifth piece is captured.

A castle is conquered when it is surrounded by three of Your pawns. This castle is then removed from the grid and is held near the box.

116217.name: Continental Circus
116217.description:
Continental Circus is an arcade racing game created and manufactured by Taito in 1987. It was then republished in 1989 along with a home version of the game, which was available on various platforms including the Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Amiga, Commodore 64, MSX and ZX Spectrum.

The arcade version of this game comes in both upright or sit-down models, either of which may feature shutter-type 3-D glasses hanging above the player's head, used by Taito under license by the United States Navy, who held the patent on that technology. The home conversions of Continental Circus lack the full-on 3D and special glasses of the arcade version, but retain the essential gameplay structure.

The in-game vehicle is the 1987 Camel-sponsored Honda/Lotus 99T Formula One car as driven by Ayrton Senna and Satoru Nakajima. Due to licensing reasons, sponsor names such as "Camel or "DeLonghi" are intentionally misspelled to prevent copyright infringement under Japanese law.

The player must successfully qualify in eight different races to win. At the beginning, the player must take 80th place or better to advance. As the player advances, so does the worst possible position to qualify. If the player fails to meet to qualify or if the timer runs out, the game is over. The player does, however, have the option to continue, but if the player fails to qualify in the final race, the game is automatically over, and the player cannot continue.

In 2005, Continental Circus was released for the Xbox, PlayStation 2, and the PC as part of Taito Legends.

Source: Wikipedia, "Continental Circus," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116218.name: Wills's Woodbine Cricket Game

boardgameversion.144081: W. D. & H. O. Wills First Edition

116218.description:
Promotional game by the Wills Woodbine cigarettes manufacturer.

The game is a rectangular metal board, with a lever on the top and two windows, one for when you are out, the other for how many runs you scored with that ball. There is a sliding 'door' that is moved over the wheel that is not relevant at the time.

You start with the runs indicator window being open. Press the lever and the wheel will spin around. The number showing when it stops is how many runs you scored with that delivery. But if the result is How's That, then you are out, and the runs scored wheel is blocked off and you again press the lever to see how you were out.

The player that scores the most runs after all their wickets have fallen, wins.

116219.name: Air Boarder
116219.description:
Game box
The year is 2064. The snowboard and skateboard of the previous century have evolved into the AirBoard that hovers about 50cm above the ground. This AirBoard can be ridden over ground, over water and even along the walls of buildngs or from rooftop to rooftop.
- Seven exciting game modes. Also has 2 player modes
- Perform original tricks with cool characters and hyper boards.
- On- road, air, lip, drum. By combining these tricks you can create unlimited combos.
- 5 courses

116220.name: Cool Croc Twins
116220.description:
Cool Croc Twins is a platform game developed by Arcade Masters and published by Empire Software for the Amiga, Atari ST, Commodore 64, and DOS computers in 1991. The player controls one of two crocodile twins named "Funk" and "Punk" respectively in an attempt to rescue a crocodile girl.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cool Croc Twins," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116221.name: Irritating Stick
116221.description:
Irritating Stick is based on the Japanese game show, which in turn was based on a carnival game, where the player tries to maneuver a Metal rod through a metal maze without touching the sides or else they would get shocked.

Source: Wikipedia, "Irritating Stick", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116222.name: Eikō no Saint Andrews
116222.description:
User Summary
Based on the Saint Andrews Old Course this was the first golf game on the N64. It used motion capture to try and create a realistic golf simulation.

116223.name: Crazy Cars
116223.description:
User Summary:
Crazy Cars is a racing game from 1988, developed by EH Production. In the game you drive from Florida to Malibu. You can drive a Mercedes, a Porsche Carrera, a Laborghini Countach, or a Ferrari Testarossa.

116224.name: Crazy Cars II
116224.description:
User Summary:
Crazy Cars 2 is a driving game where you drive a Ferrari thru four states in mid-west US, trying to hunt down four bad cops.

116225.name: FIFA Soccer 64
116225.description:
FIFA 64
The first FIFA game on the Nintendo 64 console, released in late 1997. It was similar to the 32-bit versions of FIFA 97.

Source: Wikipedia, "FIFA," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116226.name: L'École des fans
116226.description:
Game based on French TV-show.
The object of the game is to be the first to reach the "podium" so that you can sing your favourite song! The players begin at the Ecole des Fans® school and go through each step of the interview, using the microphone to speak. They each rolling the dice and move their character on the stage-shaped board, with activities along the way (singing, duets, dancing, exercising, miming, making faces, kissing, pledging and a surprise).

Contents:

1 amplifier microphone (requires 2 AAA batteries, not included)
5 erasable blackboards and 2 erasers
1 stage-shaped game board
110 cards
1 pad of scoring sheets
6 character pieces with stands
1 die
1 game rulebook

116227.name: International Superstar Soccer 64
116227.description:
International Superstar Soccer 64 (officially abbreviated as ISS 64 and known as Jikkyou World Soccer 3 in Japan) is a football video game developed by Konami Computer Entertainment Osaka in the International Superstar Soccer series by Konami and released for the Nintendo 64 that is essentially a Nintendo 64 version of International Superstar Soccer Pro. The game on the whole is similar to the PlayStation version (including the same player names) but with some teams having a more inaccurate home or away kit. As for its team lineup, it follows more closely the Super NES version of International Superstar Soccer Deluxe, only with South Africa (or, if this version is considered from the conversion, Romania) replacing Morocco.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Superstar_Soccer_...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116228.name: Tanks
116228.description:
"Tanks" is a tactical level wargame in WW2 Eastern Front. This game was designed for wargame beginner.
"Tanks" was published in conjunction with Tenka fubu and The Battle of the Bulge in one box named "Simulation games for beginner #1".

Firefight is resolved by two-steps, determination of hit and Penetration.

Players will control the armored force of either Germany or the Soviet union.
Victory conditions vary by scenarios.

116229.name: Bottom of the 9th (1999)
116229.description:
Bottom of the 9th is a baseball game by Konami for the Sega Saturn, PlayStation and the Nintendo 64. It is a heavily updated version of Konami's 1989 arcade game Bottom of the Ninth. It was originally released for the Sega Saturn.

One of the earliest in Konami's franchise, this version featured 300 actual MLB players at the time, but did not feature the MLB licensed teams. Players can choose to either play against a friend in Exhibition, Season or Playoffs. The gameplay is geared for more of a simulation style of play with the players stats determining on how well they hit, pitch and field. For example, hit a home run with the last ball of the match, or stop a team from scoring in the final inning to complete each scenario. Training and support for 2 player multi-player are also available.

Along with the standard modes for a baseball game, this one also featured the ability to customize their teams and choose any player to create their "Dream Team". It also had a variety of different camera angles to choose from and had meters to show their players progress such as a "Streak Bar" that showed a batters hitting ability and a "Pitching Bar" that showed whether a pitcher was fatigued.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bottom_of_the_9th,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116230.name: Crime and Punishment
116230.description:
Crime and Punishment is a 1980s legal simulation game released for the Commodore 64 and MS-DOS. The player assumed the role of a sentencing judge in a criminal law matter before the courts. Information available to the player included details on the nature of the crime committed, the defendants prior criminal history and pre-sentencing reports. The player could also review known facts relating to the case before sentencing the prisoner to probation, jail, prison or even choose the death penalty. In the case of imprisonment, the player also chose the length of prison term. Scoring was related to how closely the sentence handed out by the player matched that of the game recommendation.

Source: Wikipedia, "Crime and Punishment (video game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116231.name: Wordz
116231.description:
In Wordz, each player must create a word from the letters he has been dealt, then try to guess the words that other players have created.

At the start of each round, a player receives five vowel cards and seven consonants, with both vowels and consonants being color-coded on both sides. Each player secretly creates a word from some number of those letter cards and lays the cards face down in order, returning any excess cards to the box.

On a turn, a player must reveal a letter in his word, and he may choose to guess an opponent's word. To guess, he must hand over a token to that player. (Each player starts the game with three tokens, and if a player runs out of tokens, he cannot guess until someone else gives him one.) If the player is correct, he claims any letters not revealed in that player's word, while the wordmaker claims all revealed letters; if the player gets any letter wrong in his guess, the word remains as is. If a player ever reveals all letters in his word, he claims all of those letter cards.

After all letters cards have been claimed, the round ends and players score one point for each card collected. After a predetermined number of rounds, the player with the most points wins.

is a game in which each must make a word with letters (on cards) and then try to guess the words of other players around table.

116232.name: Valkyrie (Issue 20 - 2000)
116232.description:
From the Contents Page

CONTENTS

Features

•Readers Poll -
•Mirage - It's all done with mirrors. New Sorcery for 7th Sea by Andrew Peregrine
•Ode to the 10ft Pole - Lifting the lid, poking fun at and generally messing around with that 10x10 corridor.
•When a door isn't just a door - Make more of your doors by Mark Caldwell.
•Kobolds versus the Zombie Chickens of Zed - Ghoulish mayhem form 9th Level Games by Chris O'Neill.

Scenarios

•Autumn for Lord Warfield of the Harvests - A nations future is in the PCs hands by Guy Robinson
•They Think its all over - Time for a little payback by David Thomas
•Flight of the Jedi Pt2 - Now they have got there can they figure out what to do next? by Phil Sidebotham
•Bad Seed - A crack squad of convict Dwarved infantry risk their lives for a mysterious cargo by Steve Blease

Regulars

•Editorial
•Night Shift - Role Playing News & releases
•Preview - Chivalry & Sorcery 4th Edition by Steve Turner
•Saints and Sinners - News on pro and anti roleplaying activity from Bill Walton's escapist website
•Dork Tower Classics - Vintage Dorkness for your reading pleasure
•News from the Trenches - A well told tale retold by Bill Walton
•Opinion - Why the Munchkin? Mike Nudd thinks he has the answer to "where did it all go wrong?"
•Dear Val - Letters and emails
•Enter Stage Left - A Selection of NPCs to throw into a campaign or even base entire scenarios around by Bruce Ferrie and Mark Caldwell
•White Light, White Heat - Make more of your doors by Mark Caldwell.
•Soldiers of fortune - Reviews of minitures and miniatures rules by Roger Webb
•Armchair Generals - News and opinion on the world of miniture gaming by Steve Blease
•Alcott Squad - SF Strip from the creative minds behind Yamara by Manul & Adams
•Feature Review - Dungeon and Dragons 3rd edition. Whatever that is by Anthony J Gallela

Reviews

116233.name: Hydrophobia: Prophecy
116233.description:
Hydrophobia is a survival-adventure video game developed and published by Dark Energy Digital for Microsoft Windows, the PlayStation 3 and Xbox Live Arcade. The game was released for Xbox Live Arcade on September 29, 2010 as part of Xbox Live's 'Games Feast' promotion, marking the first of three episodes. The PC version was released on May 9, 2011. The PlayStation 3 version was released on November 1, 2011 in North America and November 2, 2011 in Europe. The game's engine, HydroEngine, provides realistic fluid dynamics technology for flowing water, allowing it to interact with the surroundings. The levels in the game were designed using InfiniteWorlds; a game creation system which uses bespoke procedural technology to significantly reduce file sizes, decreasing the overall file size of the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydrophobia_Prophecy#Hydrophobi...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116234.name: Star Wars Obi-Wan
116234.description:
Star Wars: Obi-Wan is a 2001 video game published by LucasArts, one of the early titles for the Xbox gaming console. This game features Obi-Wan Kenobi as a Padawan and takes place in around 32BBY, in the weeks prior to and during the events of Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star_Wars:_Obi-Wan," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116235.name: Secret Santicore 2011
116235.description:
From the front cover:


A Rather Fine Collection of Some Nifty Gamey Fluff For Those Who Like to Kill Them & Take All Their Stuff


User summary:

Secret Santicore 2011 is a collection of adventures and supplementary content for OSR games such as Labyrinth Lord and others, created in the main by OSR gamers and bloggers.

116236.name: Gingerbread Race
116236.description:
From the package front:
Just throw the dice and race your way to the top!
Makes a great stocking stuffer!
Net Contents: (1) Board, (2) Pegs, (2) Dice

Rules (from the back):
1. Each player picks a Gingerbread Peg.
2. Each player rolls 1 die... the highest rolled number goes first.
3. Throw both dice and add up the number of dots and move the Gingerbread Peg up the race course.
4. The first one to reach the Finish Line, wins.

116237.name: Crystals of Zong
116237.description:
Crystals of Zong is a computer game for the Commodore 64. Crystals of Zong is a simple maze-type action game taking place over a series of levels. Each level consists of nine single-screen rooms arranged in a 3×3 grid. At the centre of each room is a locked treasure area. The treasure areas in the eight edge rooms contain different treasures and the one in the centre room contains a ladder to the next level. The player's task is to navigate the maze-like corridors of the rooms to unlock the treasure areas and get the treasure. After all eight treasures on a level have been taken, the player can descend to the next level via the ladder.

To make the player's job harder, various monsters inhabit the rooms. The monsters start out slow and dim-witted, but become faster and smarter on later levels. Contact with a monster kills the player instantly. In each room, there is a sword, collecting which temporarily gives the player the ability to kill the monsters. After some time, the monsters return.

Source: Wikipedia, "Crystals of Zong," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116238.name: Racing Beat
116238.description:
User Summary

Racing Beat is an early 90s F1 racing game by Taito. Race to achieve first place and move on to race more skilled drivers.

116239.name: The Butchers of Umbrion
116239.description:
From Introduction:

In the full-length campaign from which The Butchers of Umbrion is taken, the larger story and its wide-ranging elements are discussed, but for this free adventure, that information is not vital. It might be useful, however, to note that the premise of the campaign is the evolution of Rullaean society and the vested interests that social institutions have in preserving ignorance, contradictory to their professional aims and ethics. The themes of the campaign revolve around technology, political power, revolution, and enlightenment.

116240.name: The Weird of Skellbrith
116240.description:
From Introduction:

In the full-length campaign from which The Weird of Skellbrith is taken, the larger story and its elements are far ranging and intricate. For this free adventure, that information is not vital. However, it might be useful to note that the premise of the campaign: the transformation of Fost society under the influence of a few powerful individuals and the possible redemption of a disgraced and fallen clan. The themes of the campaign revolve around honor, redemption, greed, servitude and power.

116241.name: Raiden IV
116241.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Raiden IV", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

The Cranassians have returned again after numerous defeats against humanity. The World Alliance Military immediately launches the Raiden mk-II and it's blue counterpart, the "Raiden mk-II Beta" to stop the invasion and save the Earth.

The gameplay of Raiden IV is identical to its prior installments, although its level design is different than Raiden III, but it is exactly the same as Raiden II, as the player starts from in-land, over the farms. In later levels the game progresses through a vast cityscape, into the sky, and finally onward to space. The player faces many enemies, powerful stages, and fearless bosses. The Flash Shot System, first introduced in Raiden III, returns in IV. Multipliers are given for destroying enemies that just appeared on screen; the faster players destroy enemies, the higher the bonuses are.

116242.name: Shadows Over Aralem
116242.description:
From publisher blurb:

Intrigue and mystery in the city! Can you escape the clutches of the thief-lord, find ancient secrets hidden in the Great Temple Library, infiltrate the dwarf-guild headquarters and survive the troll assassins?

This is the second part of the RuneQuest solo-adventure started in A Trip to the Priory and takes your character back to the city to follow up the clues found in the ruined monastery and getting embroiled in a deep and tangled mystery. Wits, intelligence and research are more important than sword-play although foes lurk around every corner.

This solo adventure gives you access to hours of RuneQuest play without the need for a gaming group. GamesMasters will find plots, setting and source material they can use in their own games.

116245.name: Real Puncher
116245.description:
User Summary

Real Puncher is a stand up competitive boxing game. The cabinet has a camera in it which takes a picture of players faces and puts them on the boxers on the screen.

116246.name: Record Breaker
116246.description:
User Summary

Record Breaker is a Olympic sport competition. Players compete in various events including running, jumping, weight lifting and others. A more modern version of Track and Field.

116247.name: Haypi ThunderBall
116247.description:
"Haypi ThunderBall is a casual game specially created for mobile phone users. Interesting and challenging, it’s intellectually exciting and addicting for both beginners and veterans. It’s very easy to star, following its spiral rhythm design, players will enjoy every step to higher scores.

Slide to connect balls of the same color or same number and a bolt will be generated exploding the linked-up balls instantly. The more balls you link up the higher you will score. If the balls you link up at one time amount to a certain quantity, you will get a magic ball which will help you alot if you want to become a Master of Haypi ThunderBall.

There are two modes in Haypi ThunderBall: Free Mode and Quest Mode which offer players for a variety of goal options to challenge. Such suitable goals can be a great guide when a player desires to break one record after another, arriving where he/she dreams of.

Come to Haypi ThunderBall and see how quick you can see!"

Source: The Developer Website.

116248.name: Rezon
116248.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Rezon", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Taking place in the year 2191, the player pilots a recently developed space fighter, the SR-91, through six stages to defend the Earth from a two year long alien invasion. The SR-91 uses the VAWs (Variable Armor and Weapon System) which uses the Optica Weapon Arms. The Arms shield the ship from top and bottom attacks, provides back-up fire and using its Arm System can be positioned to fire in 90° angles behind and around the ship. The player could also have the VAWs spread out providing wider shots. The SR-91 could use one of three different pick-up weapons including the straight firing Laser, the wide-firing Ring Laser or the rebounding Ball Shot; the only other pick-up items were Speed Ups and Speed Downs. Extends were set at the first 70,000 points and was added with every 80,000.

116249.name: Riding Fight
116249.description:
User Summary

Riding Fight is a beat em up where you ride a hoverboard and fight villians in hand to hand combat. Work your way through various levels to fight bosses.

116250.name: War of the Gods
116250.description:
"Zeus raged because of the defiance by King and Queen of Argos. Hades provoked Zeus to punish Argos, then Zeus ordered monster Kraken to destroy Argos. At this moment Perseus came out to save Argos with his companions and they wanted to find out how to defeat Kraken together."

Source: The Developer Website.

116251.name: Ring Fighter
116251.description:
User Summary

Ring Fighter is an early 80's boxing game from Taito. Graphics are simple 3/4 view typical of the era.

116252.name: The Curse of Sherwood
116252.description:
From the Inlay

Robin Hood and his merry men are confronted with their biggest challenge to date!

The evil Cult of Sagalia has taken control of Sherwood Forest instilling fear into the hearts of the forest dwellers. They are relying on you as Friar Tuck, Robin and the rest of the band to rid the forest of this evil force and then get back to normal pursuits like robbing the rich to give to the poor!

In the meantime Robin and his men battle valiantly on, but the odds are definitely stacked against them. Werewolves roam the forest day and night watching and waiting for any likely looking prey (actually they're not particularly fussy!). Hideous animated skeletons appear when they're least expected and should you be unfortunate enough come across one of the Priests of Sagalia, well, your days are numbered!

116253.name: Ring Rage
116253.description:
User Summary

Ring Rage is Professional Wrestling game for up to 4 players. Pick from your choice of colorfully dressed wrestlers to fight opponents. Use typical Pro Wrestling moves to pin your opponents.

116254.name: Family Feud Decades
116254.description:
From Game Case

2000+ surveys from the '70s, '80s, '90s and '00s. Play through authentic Feud sets from all four decades. Personalize your avatar with vintage styles including hippie, disco, punk, grunge, and more. Play single player or go head-to-head in party mode for cash and bragging rights.

From the Instruction Manual

Survey says! Family Feud Decades brings the excitement of the classic game show into your home. Create your contestant, choose your favorite decade, and compete for a chance to win the $, grand prize and unlock new items for your wardrobe. The answers to a survey may be different from one decade to another, so be sure to keep your selected decade in mind when answering surveys!

116255.name: Road Champion
116255.description:
User Summary

Road Champion is a very early Arcade racing game featuring an overhead view and very simple graphics. Try to pass other cars in a race for the finish.

116256.name: Down Among The Dead
116256.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the thrid and final part of the adventure which started with A Trip to the Priory. The trail has led you back to the ruined priory where you must descend to the catacombs and face the unknown horrors that stand between you and victory!

116257.name: uDraw Studio
116257.description:
uDraw Studio is an Art Game for Wii which is bundled with the uDraw GameTablet and is the main game in the uDraw series. The game was Published by THQ, Developed by Pipeworks Software, and released in North America on November 14, 2010, February 24, 2011 in Australia and in Europe on March 4, 2011. It lets players create their own paintings or color in coloring pages and save it to their gallery using the uDraw GameTablet bundled with the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UDraw_Studio,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Requires: uDraw GameTablet, one Wii remote

116258.name: Firerock Pass
116258.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is a beautiful day and you have set out for the first time as your own for a life of adventure. Your aim is to get to the town on the other side of the mountains. Should take about a day. What could possibly go wrong?

This solo adventure is designed to blood rookie characters and give players without a gaming group a chance to roleplay. This is still the most fun you can have on your own.

116259.name: Rock Climber
116259.description:
User Summary

In this early platform game, you try to climb a mountain without falling or being hit by falling objects.

116260.name: Rumba Lumber
116260.description:
User Summary

In Rumba Lumber, you are a lumberjack who cuts down trees. Clear the level to advance.

116261.name: Burning Rubber: Alternate Chase Rules for Savage Worlds
116261.description:
From Introduction:

Savage Worlds presents a great set of abstract chase rules. But there are times when they’re a bit too abstract. While they do model distance, they don’t model position (who’s in the lead, who’s in second, etc).
