For dogfights, spaceship battles, and the like, this works out fine, but there are times when being first matters.

With that in mind, here are some tweaks you can make to make the SW chase rules model a traditional car chase perhaps a bit more closely.

116262.name: Wheel of Fortune (2010)
116262.description:
From the Game Case

Now be a contestant on America's favorite game show in your own home!

Join Pat Sajak and Vanna White on the virtual set of Wheel of Fortune. For the first time ever you can spin the wheel as your favorite Mii(TM) character!

Test your skills with 8000+ fun and exciting puzzles.
Play against virtual opponents or bring the whole family together in 3 person multiplayer.
Use the Wii Remote(TM) to spin the wheel and select your letters, or use Wii Speak(TM) to call out your letters--just like on the show!
Enjoy fun "commercial break" mini-games and show-related trivia.

---

Developed by THQ. The Wii version is compatible with the Wii Speak accessory, and is the first version to feature Pat Sajak alongside Vanna White.
First game to feature gift tags and prize puzzles, and the second to have the Free Play, after an updated version of Wheel for the iPhone, iPod touch, and the iPad.

Source: Wikipedia, "Wheel of Fortune," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116263.name: My Baby Boy
116263.description:
My Baby Boy is a Nintendo DS video game released in North America on November 4, 2008 and in Europe on November 28, 2008. The games teach players the skills of parenting (the player can choose to be a daddy or a mommy) and to the experience of raising a or son in the months that they spend as an infant.
The player can choose a nationality for their child in addition to their eye color. Players must create a given name (up to eight letters) to his or her character before beginning the actual game. However, there is no need to insert either a middle name or a surname because of memory constraints. Two developmental challenges (i.e., teaching the baby how to speak or teaching the baby how to crawl) must be passed before the baby is allowed to grow by one month. Using the microphone to expand the baby's vocabulary and the stylus to put on new clothes for them helps provide the challenges that new parents face with their infants every day. Babies must be given baby formula in a bottle and the game is similar to the Tamagotchi devices of the mid 1990s. There was originally an option to create a "My Baby" game combining two genders in one cartridge but the idea was funneled off into two different cartridges. One of the other mandatory features of the game include flatulence, cooing, and the changing of the diaper when the baby urinates or has a bowel movement.

Source: Wikipedia, "My Baby Boy," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116264.name: Petz Fashion Dogz & Catz
116264.description:
User Summary:
Adopt a cat or dog from a wide selection of possible pets. Train, feed, play with, and dress your pet. When you complete a set amount of activities and earn the applicable rewards, you will receive an invitation for a neighborhood dog or cat show. After you make it to the final round you will receive an invitation to the neighborhood finals. This continues until you participate in all the pet shows and win all the awards.

116265.name: Petz Nursery 2
116265.description:
User Summary:
Building upon the previous title, both stand-alone games, Petz Nursery 2 features new baby animals - even adorable polar bear cubs. Different from the first title, now you can take care of two babies at the same time. You will feed, play with, train, clean and put your baby Petz to bed when they need a nap.

116267.name: Pulp Rules
116267.description:
From Introduction:

Pulp adventures require both a certain mindset from the GM and players and a few tweaks to the base rules.

The majority of these rules exist for one reason - to mimic pulp films. While player characters are virtually immortal and can face most challenges without fear of injury, the fun of pulp is playing up that fact by taking more extreme risks and performing daring stunts.

116268.name: S.C.I. - Special Criminal Investigation
116268.description:
User Summary

S.C.I. - Special Criminal Investigation is a driving, crime fighting game. Drive your special car and shoot criminals cars with various weapons. Try not to crash or get shot to move to other levels.

116269.name: Daring Tales of Adventure Figure Flats
116269.description:
From publisher blurb:

Featuring 25 different figures from Nazi Storm Troopers to dashing actors and evil masterminds. In this set you will find all sorts of different characters to enhance your pulp games.

In this set:

Nazi Storm Trooper Gasmask, Mafia Thug Grey, Mafia Thug Green, Mafia Thug Brown, Weird Evil Mastermind Dark Suit, Femme Fatale Blonde, Femme Fatale Redhead, Nazi Brute, Reporter, Millionaire Madman, Pulp Hero, Pulp Hero, English Dilettante Blonde, English Dilettante Bru-nette, Mad Scientist, Scrappy Kid, Oriental Mastermind, Ninja Assas-sin Blue Grey, Ninja Assassin Brown, Ninja Assassin Red, Native Cultist Gold Body Paint, Native Cultist Gold No Paint, Native Cultist Ivory Body Paint, Native Cultist Ivory No Paint, Native Cultist Red No Paint, Native Cultist Red Body Paint, Native Witchdoctor Body Paint, Native Witchdoctor No Paint, Native Champion Body Paint, Native Champion No Paint, Nazi Officer, Enemy Agent, Bedouin Warrior Blue, Bedouin Warrior Brown, Bedouin Warrior Green, Cloaked Hero, Crazy Mystic, Jungle Lord, Dashing Actor, Archaeologist, Professors Daughter, Nazi She-Wolf, Secretary Green

116270.name: Battle of Giants: Dragons

videogamehonor.33164: 2010 CVA Best Handheld Game of the Year Nominee

116270.description:
Humans hunted dragons and there was constant warring between the two species. Finally, the Lord of all Dragons, Ninnurtu, gathered the noble Ebebu dragons and the foul Salmu dragons and used the combined power to create Tammabuku, their own world in which they could have peace. However, the Salmu dragons (evil dragons) soon stole the gems of the Ebebu (good) dragons, which was the source of all dragon's power. Ninnurtu, was powerless to stop them, since creating the new world left him powerless. The player is the last of the Ebebu dragon, and he/she has to win back all of the gems the Salmu dragons stole.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Combat_of_Giants:_Dragons," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116271.name: S.R.D. Mission
116271.description:
User Summary

S.R.D. Mission is a space based shoot'em up. Attempt to shoot and avoid enemies to advance to new levels.

116272.name: Space Pulp Rules

rpgseries.3981: Daring Tales of the Space Lanes

116272.description:
From Introduction:

Daring Tales of the Space Lanes is pseudo-pulp in nature. It follows much the same feel as Star Wars or Firefly, in that the heroes are a cut above the average citizen, despite what their traits may say, and has similar technology levels to the former. Although pulp-based, the adventures aren’t in the same vein as Flash Gordon, though.

The Daring Tales of the Space Lanes adventures aren’t set in any particular galaxy or timeframe — they’re just space adventures. Likewise, the adventures don’t constitute a setting. There is no overarching plot, no timeline, no gear list, no starship catalog, and no defi nitive list of alien races or factions. Each adventure will add small details, as necessary, to the universe.

As for making your own alien, player character races instead of using the pre-generated heroes we’ve provided, there are two easy options. First, pick a race from an existing Savage setting and change the name. A half-orc could just as easily be a Garthunkian. Second, treat them as humans, but allow the character to take an attribute instead of a free Edge.

A few special rules apply to our Daring Tales of the Space Lanes adventures. They’re collected here for your convenience.

116273.name: Petz Monkeyz House
116273.description:
User Summary

Adopt, care for, play with and train up to three virtual monkeys at a time with this cute game.

From Game Case

Combine breeds to create a unique monkey or adopt an adorable monkey from a variety of breeds to raise, care for, and have fun with.

Play with three monkeyz at the same time and experience all the wacky fun!

Dress up your monkeyz and wirelessly exchange them with your friends.

116274.name: Cuthbert Goes Walkabout
116274.description:
Cuthbert Goes Walkabout is a 1983 computer game for the Dragon 32/64, TRS-80 CoCo, Commodore 64 and Atari 8-bit family home computers. Produced by Microdeal, the game features the hero Cuthbert. The game is based on the Konami arcade game Amidar. The player has to guide Cuthbert around a grid-like level of squares. When the player walks all the way around each square it is filled with colour. If all the squares are filled, and Cuthbert successfully avoids the monsters and finishes before the time runs out, the player progresses to the next level. The levels have a green background, except for every third which is white as a sort of bonus level.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cuthbert Goes Walkabout," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116275.name: Afraid PL
116275.description:
User's summary:

A Vincent Baker's adaptation of Dogs in the Vineyard to the horror genre.

Polish translation edited in a way that justify separate item.

116277.name: Safari Rally
116277.description:
User Summary

Safari Rally is an early racing game from Taito based on one of the toughest real life Races. This game comes inbBlack and white and color versions. Both feature simple graphics.

116278.name: Darius II
116278.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Darius II (arcade game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Darius II, released outside of Japan as Sagaia, is a 1989 arcade video game by Taito. It is the direct sequel to Darius, first released in arcades in 1989. The arcade version kept the same three-screen format as the first game. The power-up system changed slightly: to obtain power-ups, the player had to destroy complete waves of a particular enemy.

116279.name: March to the sea
116279.description:
A solitaire game where the player takes control of an American armoured brigade as it tries to battle its way from the Czech border to the German coast, fighting against an aggressive but unprepared German military machine.

The object is survival of as many American units as possible, whilst under constant German attacks from all directions, effectively a "tower defence" type game.

During play, you will position your American units within the column-of-march to meet the oncoming enemy forces, trying to place the most effective units for each threat type in a position to gain most advantage.

Separate tracks have to be managed as well. One tracks your progress towards the sea, another the number of wounded within your column and a third the opinion of the German people.

A deck of event cards must be played through, each event either helping or hindering your cause, and hand management is critical during play.

You have to strike a balance of careful manoeuvring, card play and threat management in order to reach the destination with as many of your units as possible.

116280.name: Samurai Jack
116280.description:
User Summary

Play Samurai Jack fighting enemies of the evil Aku. Work your way through multiple levels in an attempt to track down and destroy Aku so you can return to your own time.

116281.name: Samurai Nipponichi
116281.description:
User Summary

In Samurai Nipponichi, you play a Samurai fighting multiple enemies to advance through the game. Fight other samurai and avoid animals that try to kill you.

116283.name: Sea Fighter Poseidon
116283.description:
User Summary

Shoot your way through enemies in an attempt to rescue soldiers. Rescue them all to get to more levels.

116284.name: Side By Side
116284.description:
User Summary

Side By Side is a sit down racing game from Taito. The cabinet featured huge screens and realistic graphics.

116285.name: Silent Dragon
116285.description:
User Summary
Silent Dragon is a scrolling beat 'em up from Taito. Use your martial arts skill and various weapons to fight your way through levels and defeat bosses.

116287.name: Slap Shot
116287.description:
User Summary

Slap Shot is a hockey game from Taito. Score more goals than your opponent to win.

116288.name: Cuthbert Goes Digging
116288.description:
Cuthbert Goes Digging is a 1983 computer game for the Dragon 32 home computer. Written by Steve Bak at Microdeal, the game features the hero Cuthbert, who also appears in Cuthbert Goes Walkabout and Cuthbert in the Mines. In the game, the player guides Cuthbert through levels of girders, avoiding 'moronians' fatal to the touch. Cuthbert kills moronians by digging holes and causing them to fall down. On later levels, different coloured moronians are harder to kill and must be knocked through two platforms. Cuthbert also battles a time limit on each level, represented by an amount of oxygen remaining. Cuthbert's ability to dig holes can also be used to quickly drop to a lower platform without the use of a ladder. The game is an example of the trap-em-up genre.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cuthbert Goes Digging," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116289.name: Xain'd Sleena
116289.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Xain'd Sleena", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

The main character, Xain, is a galactic bounty-hunter who must defeat evil forces who oppress five different planets. The player can select the in any order to play the various planets, so, there is no 'official' sequence of play (For the U.S. version, this game was released as 'Solar Warrior'. This version goes through a set sequence instead of having to choose planets).
Each planet is played with right horizontal and vertical scrolling shooting enemies and dodging natural hazards. Xain can crouch, double crouch, jump and double jump. In some of the planets the player will need to kill a sub-boss to resume. Certain enemies carry a powerup which changes the default laser gun into a different weapon. The different weapons which are cycled through powerups include a laser-grenade gun, a 2-way gun, a spreadfire gun and a strong bullet gun with their own respective damage and direction firing capabilities.
At the end of the planet, the player is goes into battle with a boss. Once defeated, the player plants a bomb (to the boss's base) and has ten seconds jump into the into the starship.
The next half of the planet stage is an interlude stage during which the player must battle through waves of enemy ships while heading to the next planet. After three planets there is a battle through an asteroid field and against a giant mothership.
When all five planets are liberated, the player will be play a longer stage on a gigantic metallic fortress, facing bosses previously met along the way. Fighting bosses in this stage is optional. Halfway through the stage the player plants a bomb on the fortress core and has 60 seconds to reach the exit hangar and jump into the starship.

116291.name: Paws & Claws Marine Rescue
116291.description:
User Summary

Rescue a variety of injured marine animals, rehabilitate them, and then release them back to the wild. You will diagnose their illnesses or injuries, treat the issues, and then release them only when they are healthy again.

116292.name: Sonic Blast Man 2
116292.description:
User Summary

Like in Sonic Blast Man, you don boxing gloves to play this game. In this sequel, you punch a punching bag. The harder you punch the more damage you do. You can also have your face on the screen.

116293.name: Megamind: The Blue Defender
116293.description:
In Megamind: Ultimate Showdown the story begins after the movie ends with Megamind being the new hero of Metro City. A sudden crime wave hits the city, orchestrated by an organization called the Doom Syndicate. The Doom Syndicate have broken into Megamind's secret lair and obtained samples of Megamind's and Metro Man's DNA along with Megamind's DNA tracking device. It's up to Megamind to hunt down the Doom Syndicate, stop the crime wave and find the missing pieces of the DNA Tracker to locate and battle against Blue Tighten.

In Megamind: Mega Team Unite, Tighten is a good guy (assuming he has seen the error of his ways since the movie story) and joins Megamind, Minion and Metro Man to battle against the Doom Syndicate. They battle Destruction Worker and track down other Doom Syndicate members to defeat them as well. Their adventure is broadcast "live on the scene" by Roxanne Richie, who follows them and gives them helpful hints.

Megamind the video games are based on the DreamWorks_Animation animated movie of the same name. Several licensed video game tie-ins published by THQ were released on November 2, 2010 to coincide with the film's release. The Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 version is titled Megamind: Ultimate Showdown, while the Wii version is titled Megamind: Mega Team Unite and the PlayStation Portable and Nintendo DS versions are both titled Megamind: The Blue Defender. All versions of the game have been rated E10+ for fantasy violence by the ESRB and published by THQ.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Megamind_(video_game),"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116294.name: Sudoku Fever

videogameversion.144205: North America Game Boy Advance Release

116294.description:
User Summary

Sudoku Classic, Sudoku Eight, Sudoku Mini, Sudoku Junior, and Sudoku Solver are the modes you can choose from. Basically this is just a bunch of Sudoku puzzles, similar to picking up a puzzle book, but the modes do offer some variations. Sudoku Solver helps you solve (or even create your own) Sudoku puzzles.

116295.name: Cuthbert in the Mines
116295.description:
Cuthbert in the Mines is a 1984 computer game for the Dragon 32 home computer. Written by Microdeal, the game features the hero Cuthbert, a character who also appeared in Cuthbert Goes Walkabout and Cuthbert Goes Digging. It was also licensed to run on Tandy's CoCo. The gameplay is a loose clone of Frogger. It requires 16K RAM, cassette or disk, and a joystick. In the game, the player guides Cuthbert from Hell through levels of mines while avoiding railcars and the fireball-throwing devil.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cuthbert in the Mines," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116297.name: My Baby 3 and Friends
116297.description:
My Baby 3 & Friends is a 2010 Nintendo DS game developed by Dancing Dots and published by Majesco Games. As a toddler, the player's son or daughter is exposed to activities like swimming, the swing set at the local playground, and even a playground slide for stimulation and development. Players are also expected to allow their babies to socialize with either another baby or with a puppy. The timeline of the baby's development starts the baby off at 15 months (1 year and three months) and ends it at 30 months (2 years and six months). Thirty new skills can be developed in a non-linear fashion; making the parenting aspects of the game more in tune with the child's actual development.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/My_Baby_3_%26_Friends,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116298.name: My Baby Girl
116298.description:
My Baby Girl is a Nintendo DS video game released in North America on November 4, 2008 and in Europe on November 28, 2008. The games teach players the skills of parenting (the player can choose to be a daddy or a mommy) and to the experience of raising a daughter or son in the months that they spend as an infant.

The player can choose a nationality for their child in addition to their eye color. Players must create a given name (up to eight letters) to his or her character before beginning the actual game. However, there is no need to insert either a middle name or a surname because of memory constraints.
Two developmental challenges (i.e., teaching the baby how to speak or teaching the baby how to crawl) must be passed before the baby is allowed to grow by one month. Using the microphone to expand the baby's vocabulary and the stylus to put on new clothes for them helps provide the challenges that new parents face with their infants every day. Babies must be given baby formula in a bottle and the game is similar to the Tamagotchi devices of the mid 1990s. There was originally an option to create a "My Baby" game combining two genders in one cartridge but the idea was funneled off into two different cartridges.

One of the other mandatory features of the game include flatulence, cooing, and the changing of the diaper when the baby urinates or has a bowel movement.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/My_Baby_3_%26_Friends,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116299.name: Petz Hamsterz Life 2
116299.description:
User Summary

In this game, you can take care of and play with up to 12 hamsters including two unlockable rare breeds and even baby hamsters. You can customize your hamster’s cage as well with over 200 toys and accessories plus 34 special treasure items.

116300.name: Puss in Boots
116300.description:
Puss in Boots is a action game based on the Dreamworks movie of the same name. It was developed by Blitz Games, and released by THQ on October 25, 2011 for Xbox 360, PlayStation 3, Wii and Nintendo DS. It features support for Kinect and PlayStation Move on the respective platforms.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Puss_in_Boots_(video_game),&quo...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116301.description:
Two new, official, Ancient Ones cards, given to attendees of the Arkham Nights event on 22-24 October 2010.

Consists of a new card for Cthulhu, with alternate abilities and art to the one in the base game, and Daoloth, a new Ancient One.
116301.name: Arkham Horror: Arkham Nights 2010 Promotional Ancient One Cards

116302.description:
A new, official, Ancient One card, given to attendees of the Arkham Nights event on 14-16 October 2011.

Consists of a new card for Hastur, with alternate abilities and art to the one in the base game.
116302.name: Arkham Horror: Arkham Nights 2011 Promotional Ancient One Card

116303.name: Cuthbert in the Jungle
116303.description:
User Summary:
Cuthbert in the Jungle is a game that features the hero Cuthbert a character who also appeared in other games from MicroDeal. This is a a Pitfall clone where you have 20 minutes to find you way out of the jungle.

116304.description:
A new, official, Ancient One card, given to attendees of the Arkham Nights event held on 14-16 October 2011.

Consists of Daoloth, a new Ancient One.
116304.name: Elder Sign: Arkham Nights 2011 Promotional Ancient One Card

116305.name: La Noche del Demonio
116305.description:
user summary in English

"La Noche del Deminio" (the night of demon) is an unofficial module for Call of Cthulhu self-published by Alex de la Iglesia and Joaquin Agreda, were part of the "Club de Rol los Pelotas". This module is based on the movie Night of the Demon by Jacques Tourneur, iIlustrado with maps and photographs of the film. There was a limited edition of 50 copies and they were all numbered.
"La Noche del Deminio" is a first adventure is continuing with "El Ámbar Rojo" (the red amber), another module self-published from the same designers.
(do not know the exact year of publication, but is between 1986 and 1989).

In Spanish:

"La Noche del Deminio" es un módulo no oficial de la Llamada de Cthulhu autopublicado por Alex de la Iglesia y Joaquin Agreda cuando formaban parte del "Club de Rol Los Pelotas". Este módulo está basado en la película Night of the Demon de Jacques Tourneur, ilustrado con mapas y fotografías de la propia película. Se hizo una edición limitada de 50 ejemplares y todos estaban numerados.
"La Noche del Deminio" es una primera aventura que continua con "El Ámbar Rojo", otro módulo autoeditado de los mismo diseñadores.
(he puesto que el año de publicación fue el 1988, pero realmente no sabria concretarlo con exactitud, el Club de Rol existió entre el 1986 y el 1989).

116306.name: Cuthbert in Space
116306.description:
User Summary:
Cuthbert in Space is a game features the hero Cuthbert, a character who also appeared in other games by MicroDeal. Cuthbert is in the Moronians Solar System. He will land on every planet, first steal all fuel dumps he can find, and then as much loot as possible before take-off. The names of the planets are: Alghov, Vyxelt, Datois etc.

116307.name: Cybertron Mission
116307.description:
Cybertron Mission is a two-dimensional shooter game, released by Micro Power. The player controls a man who has penetrated the electrified Cybertron Fortress, in order to retrieve the priceless treasures within - namely golden keys, rings and bars. The player character has 8-directional movement, and may shoot in the direction he is facing. The objective of each level was to find all the listed treasure, and then touch the safe, located at a random position on the level. The amount of treasure required increased by one item every level, up to the maximum of six. Cybertron Mission had four maze-like levels, repeating the series every four levels, with palette shifts in order to make them appear different.
There are four enemy types. Spinners (appearing on all levels) move blindly towards the player, but cannot harm him even when touching, unless he walks into them. Clones (appearing from level 2 onwards) move pseudo-randomly, and shoot in the direction they were moving/facing. Cyberdroids (appearing from level 3 onwards) move in straight lines for a period. They change direction when they hit a wall, see the player, or after a certain period of time. They will fire towards the player. The fourth enemy type is Spook, the ghost of a previous entrant to the fortress. He appears if you spend too long on any one screen, moving towards you and ignoring walls. He cannot be destroyed, but may be paralysed if shot. Touching the electrified walls of the maze kills the player. Like many games of the era, Cybertron Mission does not end, each level simply brings a greater number of enemies to fight, which fire more frequently and with greater accuracy.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cybertron Mission," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116309.name: Bitch Slap
116309.description:
Grab your die!
Roll as fast as you can!
Slap your opponent's hands to kill!

Bitch Slap is a revolutionary real-time fighting game that features actual physical contact. Think of the children's game 'Red Hands' taken to a new level with characters, equipment, dirty tricks, dice rolling and awesome art.

In a world where female is the dominant sex, Manga-style gladiators enter the arena for deadly battle to appease the crowd, or clowns fight in ridiculous ways for the crowd's favor and laughter.

During the first phase of the game, each player acquires three characters and equips them with items and techniques either through quick play (that last one minute) or auction (that lasts five minutes).

During the second phase of the game, one character from each side enters the arena and special abilities are resolved. On the count of three, each player starts rolling their die as fast as they can (d8 for gladiators, d10 for clowns). On a roll of 1, your character succeeded to Hit. You then have to swing your hand in order to contact your opponent's hand, if successful you Wound, if unsuccessful you Miss. Most characters die when wounded twice, then another character enters the battle.

When you kill all three of your opponent's gladiators/clowns you are victorious!

Bitch Slap is an official entry to the 3rd annual Greek board game design contest scheduled for Spring 2012

116310.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 21 - Sep 2005)
116310.description:
Cover credited to Brigade Models

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

rpgissuearticle.70751: Additional Rules for British Rails and Empire Builder

116311.description:
Cover: Cover from Hitler's War is used with permission from The Avalon Hill Game Company.

GAME NEWS is devoted exclusively to adult games and game-related products. GAME NEWS reviews current releases of role-games, war games, general adult games, and surveys new gaming miniatures. GAME NEWS also features cartoons, modules and scenarios, supplements, play-aids, "how-to" tips, and other information to make playing games more fun.

-from the contents page

116312.name: Soccer Game
116312.description:
Box has comic book style footballers. It doesn't say it is connected to the ultimate British comic book hero Roy of the Rovers, but it does look awfully close.

The board is a soccer pitch and is enclosed within a plastic cover. The pitch has 10 indentations. To move the ball, each player has 10 buttons to press, each numbered to relate to one of the indentations. When a ball settles into an indentation, the first to press the lever, 'passes' the ball, with the intention of sendint it to another position. The cover on the pitch means that the ball cannot leave the board and roll on to the floor. The goalkeepers are worked by slides so that they can be moved sideways to save shots.

GAME NEWS also features cartoons, modules and scenarios, supplements, play-aids, "how-to" tips, and other information to make playing games more fun.

-from the contents page

116323.name: Ring a Bottle
116323.description:
A plastic bottle in a stand is placed in the centre of the table. Players must use thumb and forefinger only, to flick their rings on to the bottle's neck. The first player to flick all their six rings on to the bottle, wins.

Contents
1 Game Base.
1 Bottle.
24 Rings in Four Colours.
1 Set of Instructions.

116324.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 31 - Mar 2008)
116324.description:
Cover by Marcin Rado Kurczewski

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

116325.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 32 - Jun 2008)
116325.description:
Cover credited to World Works Games

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

116326.name: A Visit to Disneyland
116326.description:
The plastic board has a spinner and holes where the Donald Duck playing pieces fit.

Roll and move except that you spin the spinner rather than roll a die. Move forward the amount spun. Land on +, move on extra spaces. Land on -, go back spaces. The first person to reach No. 100 is the winner.

Contents
1 Game Board.
1 Spinner Piece.
6 Donald Duck Playing Pieces.

116327.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 33 - Sep 2008)

rpgissuearticle.89579: Battle Report - Learning to play CAV
