116329.description:
Cover credited to Darkson Designs

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

116330.name: Duncan Hamilton Invites You to Race at Oulton Park
116330.description:
The board is a rendition of the Oulton Park circuit which is in Cheshire, England.

The player must negotiate the track in the fastest time to win. Magnets under the board move the cars when you turn the steering wheel

Duncan Hamilton (1920 - 1994) was a British racing driver

116331.name: Guess Who? Mix 'n Mash
116331.description: A totally different way to play your favorite guessing game! Over 3,000 funny face combinations! Which funny face will you be? Pick your mouth... now your eyes...then your head... but don't look! Ask your opponent: Am I a sneaky, spooky clown... or a funny, greedy zombie? Let the fun begin and ask yes or no questions to guess which kooky character you created! When you think you know who you are - make a guess!

116332.name: Crossroads
116332.description:
Publisher's blurb:


There’s a man at the Crossroads Cafe who can give people what they want, if they do something specific in return. You are going to visit him.


This is a ready-to-play story game for up to four players and a facilitator.


Playing time: 2 hours
Participants: 4 players and one facilitator
Equipment needed: 2 six-sided dice (a pair of dice per player is ideal. The facilitator never rolls dice)
Pencils if you’d like to make notes, but they’re not essential.

116333.name: Maschinengewehr mit Schiess-Scheibe
116333.description:
Target game, circa 1935, when militarism was very popular in German society. The title means 'Machine Gun with Target'.

The gun is a crank operated Model 08 Heavy Machine Gun on a sled mount. Made of wood with metal barrel. The gun fires wooden bullets at four card targets enclosed within the game box lid. Complete with charger clip [for automatic loading] and 10 wooden bullets.

The targets are worth between 1 and 4 points. Most points earned wins the game.

116334.name: Envoyer (Issue 16 - Feb 1998)

rpgissuearticle.70654: Aberglaube der Rollenspieler - Die Macht der Würfel

116334.description: This issue conatins a short adventure "Das Leben am See". Articles about superstition of roleplayers (The might of the dice) and about eating while playing - Unhealthy roleplay

116335.name: Envoyer (Issue 23 - Sep 1998)

rpgissuearticle.70718: AD&D Die vergessen Reiche - Kampagnen- Set

116335.description: This issue contains a short advneture "Unter Fischen" An article about the paylot of an character. Also an article about the GenCon 1998 and an interview with Margaret Weis and Don Perrin

116336.name: Snap Judgment
116336.description:
"The Photo-Recognizing Game"

Intended to be a party game I suspect.

Each player receives a scoresheet. A page of 12 photographs is chosen and on the word "Go", all players (or teams) write down as many of the people on that page that they recognize.

The winner is the player or team with the most correct answers.

The ever-hopeful publisher recommends that you buy another copy so that you can play with a bigger group of people.

116337.description: Steam Torpedo: First Contact – R&D is a non-collectible booster pack for the tactical submarine battle game Steam Torpedo that includes ten new submarine compartment tiles, thereby allowing players to build new submarines and create new strategies.
116337.name: Steam Torpedo: First Contact – R&D

116338.name: Envoyer (Issue 27 - Jan 1999)
116338.description:
This issue contains a short adventure "Der Turm von Schenn Udwards". Reviews about new AD&D, DSA and Vampire products. Articles about the good old past and about creating a new world.

---
user summary

116339.name: Fox Sports College Hoops 99
116339.description:
The game features 120 college basketball teams, multiplayer support for two players, and many of the college championships including the NCAA men's basketball championship. The game allows the player to play a single game between any two teams in an exhibition mode, or to play a season mode as the manager of a college basketball team.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fox Sports College Hoops '99", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116340.name: Kiratto Kaiketsu 64 tanteidan
116340.description:
User Summary
The player is a member of a detective bureau trying to solve 3 mysteries. It takes the format of board game in that you roll a die and move around a board collecting items to help you solve a case (win a game). However your rival bureaus are also trying to get to the goal before you and can lay traps and get in your way resulting in mini battles.

116341.name: Last Legion UX
116341.description:
User Summary
A Mech based fighting game very similar to Sega's Virtua-On. Using the four elemental Power Stones the mechanoid Legion were created. Each Mecha is armed with a different main, sub and Power Stone weapon. There main weapons fall under one of four categories, Blade, Bazooka, Pistol and Machine Gun. There are both story and vs modes to play.

116342.name: Temple of Vran
116342.description:
User Summary:
Temple of Vran is a game by Richard A. McCormack, published by Incentive software. It´s the second game in The Ket Trilogy. The goal is to search for the temple of the mad sorcerer. The game take place outdoors, not in caves like the first game. A change from the first game is that you in this game can choice between different weapons to use in the battles.

116343.name: Nushi Tsuri 64
116343.description:
There are six characters from which players can choose from before they start the game. Like in most role-playing games, the town can be freely explored in addition to other towns. The stuff that can be purchased is mostly fishing-related. Random encounters can occur while walking; players can choose to throw rocks to chase them away or run across a path in order to reach safety.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nushi_Tsuri_64

116344.name: The Final Mission
116344.description:
User Summary:
The Final Mission is a game by Richard A. McCormack, published by Incentive Software. This is the third and final game of The Ket Trilogy. The adventure begins in a dark cell and the player must escape from the prison complex, after the defeat of the evil Verusbel that you can meet behind the five Gate Guardians. The game are easy from start, then became harder until the end.

116346.name: Boulder Dash II
116346.description:
User Summary

Sequel of Boulder Dash, featuring very similar gameplay (dig to get gems avoiding falling rocks and wandering foes).

116347.name: Lucky Shot
116347.description:
Objective: score most points by flipping the ball/marble into the marked holes
- acting by turn -
very similar to 'Tiddlywinks' but using a catapult (cardboard) and a marple
at least 2 different editions 1935

116348.name: Tangram Fury
116348.description:
Taken from the the game's official web site:

“Tangram Fury” is a competitive and amazingly addictive table-top game based on the ancient Chinese puzzle known as a “tangram.” Players attempt to be the first to recreate images using the seven pieces of a standard tangram puzzle. Fun for everyone! Tangram Fury can be played individually, or in teams, with as few as two players.

Players compete against each other to be the first to build tangram puzzles shown on cards. The first player done, wins the card. The first player to earn five cards, wins the game.

Tangram Fury has two levels of play: “Fan” and “Expert”. The Fan level is easier, because the shapes on the cards have borders that show how each of the seven tangram pieces fit together to form the shape. The Expert level only shows a silhouette of the shape and players must figure out which pieces go where.

The game includes four categories of tangram images: people, animals, fish & birds, and objects & shapes. Each category is represented by colored cards. Rolling a multi-colored die determines the categories.

116349.name: Kurukshetra
116349.description:
In Kurukshetra, players fight the epic battle of Kurukshetra following the story as it was first told in the hindu epic Mahabharata. Two families, the Pandavas and the Kauravas fight for control of the kingdom.

It's a strategy boardgame played in two phases: In the first phase, players struggle to obtain different advice from Krishna that will help them further on. In the next phase, players battle the heroes of the Kaurava family. Special Pandava family members and Krishnas advice are extra efficient when facing the different Kaurava warriors.

The winner of the game is the one who defeats most Kaurava warriors and scores most victory points.

116351.name: Winter Wonderland
116351.description:
User Summary:
Winter Wonderland is the first game in Incentive Software's range under the Medallion Adventure title, games made using the Graphic Adventure Creator. The game was written by Tim Walsha and Simon Lipscombe. The goal in the game is to find the lost civilisation of Shangri-La in Tibet. In begins when your plane crashes in Himalayas.

116352.name: The Legend of the Apache Gold
116352.description:
User Summary:
The Legend of the Apache Gold is the second game in the range of games in the Medallion Adventure series. The games was made by Peter Torrance. The set is the wild west. As the cowboy Luke Warme you will hunt for the Apaches gold.

rpg.2435: Legend of the Five Rings (3rd Edition)

116353.name: Musha Shugyo #4: Shadowlands
116353.description:
From the website:

The scribes of Musha Shugyo have fallen to the taint of the Shadowlands. As they stood under siege from Jigoku they gathered all of the knowledge they could on their enemy in a valiant attempt to stop the inevitable. Though unsuccessful the remains of their research has been gathered together into this – the final volume of Musha Shugyo.

116354.name: Dungeon Crawl
116354.description:
From Introduction:

It was Gretchen who found the book, but Tomlin who decided on its use.

The mercenary band fought for plunder, and on this most recent trip, had come across a book of magical plagues.

Weeks earlier, the group listened as a drunken knight talked of the hidden fortune of his lord, Baron Paschall of Sylvane. Not even Paschall’s knights knew the location of the baron’s gold, but it was rumored to fill a 10x10 room up to a man’s waist.

The rumor meant little to the black-hearted mercenaries. Until they found the book.

116355.name: Encounter Savage
116355.description:
From Introduction:

"Rules are, in the end, the tool we use to herd our less interesting brethren, and need not apply to men of action and cunning." - Hank Riley

Since its debut in 1979, Encounter Critical has become a beloved classic of science fiction fantasy roleplay. It may be the original universal system, allowing you to play any type of story simply by leaving out all of the other stuff you don’t want. Unfortunately, many players today do not appreciate the timeless qualities of the game system and refer to it as "dated" or "retro" or "is this is joke?". To help expose those players to the wonderment that is the world of Vanth I have embarked upon a mission to bring the joy of Encounter Critical to a modern-day universal roleplay system Savage Worlds.

The motto of Savage Worlds is Fast! Furious! Fun! That is very applicable to Encounter Critical. What is presented in what I am calling Encounter Savage! is not intended to be a direct conversion between the two systems. You cannot convert your Klengon Half-Frankenstein PsiWitch directly into Savage Worlds, you will need to recreate that character from scratch. These rules will help you do that. However I have worked hard to apply the principles of Hank Riley and Jim Ireland's True Scientific Realism so that Encounter Savage! characters will be as much like Encounter Critical characters as possible. In some cases more so!

A copy of Encounter Critical and the Savage Worlds Explorer's Edition are required.

116356.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 36 - Jun 2009)
116356.description:
Cover credited to Grindhouse Games

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

116357.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 37 - Sep 2009)
116357.description:
Cover uncredited

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

116358.name: A New Beginning
116358.description:
A New Beginning takes you to a dark and frightening vision of a future, where a global climate catastrophe threatens the existence of humanity. As part of a team sent 500 years back to our time, you are tasked with changing the course of history and preventing climate chaos from ravaging the planet. But the mission does not go according to plan…

Source: The Publisher Website.

116359.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 38 - Dec 2009)
116359.description:
Cover credited to Aberrant, makers of Warlands and Rezolution.

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

116360.name: Diablo Pass
116360.description:
From Introduction:

The posse begins the adventure outside a Hellstromme Industries field office in southern Utah. The scientist in charge, Dr. Winters, has hired the posse to look into the disappearance of a recent expedition into the Utah Badlands. The expedition left a week ago to test a new experimental apparatus. The expedition has disappeared.

116361.name: Cargo: The Quest for Gravity
116361.description:
The Gods haven’t looked too kindly on humanity and Earth, as we know it, has been reduced to a group of island archipelagos, populated by “BUDDIES” – pint-sized creatures, unbound by gravity’s forces and free to float and frolic at their own whim and leisure. But, there is a way to stop them ….FUN is the secret ingredient that will ground the BUDDIES and return gravity to Earth. As one of Earth’s last human survivors, it’s up to you to dish out a healthy dose of amusement to restore order on Earth.

Source: The Publisher Website.

116362.name: Treasures of a Slaver's Kingdom
116362.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the cruel kingdoms north of the Viraxian Empire, a barbarian seeks treasure - and vengeance! Having escaped the clutches of the Slaver King, he has vowed to pillage the wealth of the kingdom ... then bring it to its knees. YOU are this barbarian. Weakened by your ordeal as a slave, wandering an unfamiliar realm filled with danger, you must use cunning, savagery, and something approximating English syntax to regain thy might, rally an army of friends to your cause, do repeated business with a Delicate Doxy, and do deadly violence unto the Slaver King!

Fans of Encounter Critical rejoice! The long-lost classic of text-adventure gaming is restored at last to a glory it never knew! Thrill to the savagery of the Sky Piranha! Marvel at the pathos of a love-struck Frankenstein! Mutate from exposure to unmodulated phasic radiation! Wield a rune-carved peg-leg Dwarf in your hand, and crush a wicked kingdom beneath your sandaled tread.

116363.name: Bratz: Rock Angelz (PC)
116363.description:
The PC game is different from the GameCube/PS2 console game.

It follows the story of the DVD movie, Bratz Rock Angelz, through nine objectives. The odd-numbered objectives (Chapter 1, 3, 5, 7, 9) are reflex-like mini-games, where the player has to do the tasks to collect points. Each mini-game has four rounds. When the player takes or misses the part, he'll/she'll gain lower points, at three misses, he/she has to do the round again losing amount of points. With points, the player can unlock fashions for the Bratz girls, except in the final objective.

The even-numbered objectives (Chapter 2, 4, 6, 8) are puzzle-like adventure games. The player has to play with the certain Bratz character and take things to solve a puzzle (for example give a camera to a colleague). The player can take pictures on those objectives to print them on the "Secrets" menu. Each adventure objective, the player has to design an article, logo, flyer, or poster to complete the part of the objective. The player can even print his/her design. This part can be accessed on the "Secrets" menu.

When the player has beaten the game, he/she unlocks a card game, called Top Trumps, which is similar to War. The player gets a card each turn with number totals on it. The player has to guess which number on the card is higher than the opponent's card. If he's/she's correct, he/she wins the card. He/she goes on playing until all 28 cards are in one players possession.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bratz: Rock Angelz (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116364.name: Hot Times in Hot Springs
116364.description:
From Introduction:

The posse begins their adventure riding in a stage coach from St. Louis, Missouri to Hot Springs, Arkansas. They are all coming for the same reason...the famous Coleman Crystal. The Tombstone Epitaph has been covering the breaking story of an enormous crystal discovered by Ron Coleman near Hot Springs.

According to the Epitaph, this crystal has the potential to exponentially enhance Shamanistic powers that are directed through it. The Epitaph warned that the crystal could not simply be destroyed, it had to be carefully split in order to make it’s power less devastating.

116365.name: Alpha Polaris
116365.description:
In the midst of the snowfields of Greenland lies Alpha Polaris™, an American oil research station. High above, the ion storm of the century is gathering, bringing about a strange intermixing of reality and night terrors. It is up to Rune Knudsen, a Norwegian biologist, to take on a desperate struggle against fear and death, and to face the primordial force lurking beyond the veiled sky.

Source: The Developer Website.

116366.name: Karyssia: Queen of Diamonds
116366.description:
User Summary
Karyssia: Queen of Diamonds is a three-part text adventure with graphics. Made by Darren & Robert Shacklady. Part of the Gold Medallion series. The goal is to kill Karyssia that lives in the Royal Castle on The Isle of Arduarin. The game features speech, magic, cabalism (spoken magic) and combat.

116367.name: Envoyer (Issue 29 - Mar 1999)
116367.description: This issue contains a short adventure "Gefangen in der Dämonenhöhle". A system overview about AD&D an exclusive preview of a cyberpunk comic and some reviews about new DSA, AD&D and vampire products.

116368.name: Rosslyn: The Templar Mystery
116368.description:
Upon the death of your Grandfather Douglas Black a diary is passed onto you through his will. It is a very strange diary, full of tales of the templar knights and the holy land, rosslyn chapel and a great secret kept hidden for hundreds of years.

Can you finish your Grandfathers work? Unlock the secret of rosslyn chapel and find the great treasure the templar knights
fought and died for?

Source: The Developer Website.

116369.name: Black Fountain

videogamecompilation.224376: Double Gold: Black Fountain / Sharpe's Deeds

116369.description:
User Summary:
Black Fountain is a two-part text adventure made by Linda Wright, published by Incentive Software. The game takes place on the planet of Areth, in the Kingdom of Espadis. A Black Fountain is now contaminating the River Ist. You, Shardor, must stop the evil eccentic Abhaldos that have made the fountain.

116370.name: Centre Court Tennis
116370.description:
Back of Box (PAL release)
Challenge unique courts loaded with various tricks and obstacles. Enjoy the excitement of these lighthearted yet challenging courts. Increase the strength and ability of your players by collecting different items. Battle opponents in fierce competition to capture even more items. Acquire even further items in the mini games.
- Challenge the 4 major world tournaents with characters you create.

116371.name: Zombies : The Last Stand
116371.description:
User Summary

Zombies : The Last Stand is a game in the vein of Left 4 Dead by Valve. You have to shoot your way to pass through hordes of ravenous zombies, to do that you have more than 20 fully upgradable weapons.

116372.name: Pokemon Quick Capture!
116372.description:
Race to catch the Pokemon!

From the box: "Ready, Set, Go!" It's an all-out race to catch Pokemon! Every player plays on ever turn in this Pokemon capturing frenzy. But watch out! It takes quick reflexes and fast thinking to snag the Pokemon you need to win! Features 36 all-new Pokemon from the Black and White televesion series!"

The game uses pattern-matching skills to claim cards after capturing pokemon on the board.

Players turn over 3 cards each round. Each card lists 2 pieces of data which can be used to match one of three pieces of data listed on the game board for each Pokemon. You only need to match one thing to be able to capture the Pokemon. After you've played all three cards, you then check to see if you match any of the pattern cards set by the side of the board, ranging from 2 to 5 points. If you can claim a pattern, you keep that card and get the points. Once all 8 pattern cards are claimed, the game is over. It's all explained on one small two-sided rules sheet.

116373.name: Voyager: Ai confini della conoscenza
116373.description:
The game is simple: a sort of "treasure hunt". Based on the exploration and identification of two "mysterious" objects, the game recreates perfectly the basic concept of Voyager: exploring mysterious places to study mysterious things.
The aim of the game is unveil the "mystery". To do that you must identify an object and a point moving along a path of boxes to connect 15 locations on a world map. There are moves by launching a special die on which the face with 1 shows the logo (V) instead of the number.
If the die result is V can perform special actions.
The 15 places and 15 objects are depicted on maps.
During the game, players get Voyager chips that have a value between 1 and 3. Who gets the highest total wins.

116374.name: New Japan Pro Wrestling: Tōhkon Road Brave Spirits

videogameseries.16973: New Japan Pro Wrestling: Tohkon Road Brave Spirits

116374.description:
User Summary
Licensed wrestling game of the New Japan Wrestling League featuring voices from the actual wrestlers. In single player mode there is a learning system so the opponents adapt to your style of play. Any belts you win are put on the line when you fight again to give a real feel of title matches.
IWGP Mode and Exhibition Mode allow four players to wrestle at once.

116375.name: Space Cruiser
116375.description:
User Summary

Space Cruiser is a shooter from Taito with similar playstyle to Galaxian. Shoot descending ships and avoid being shot or run in to.

116376.name: Total Eclipse
116376.description:
User Summary:
Total Eclipse is a first person puzzle game with vector graphics. It takes place during the 1930's outside and inside the pyramids of Giza.

116377.name: Space Cyclone
116377.description:
User Summary

Space Cyclone is an early shoot em up from Taito. You play a laser and try to protect your planet from descending missles and ships.

116378.name: Space Invaders DX
116378.description:
User Summary

Space Invaders DX is a '90's remake of the old classic. There are many options to choose from when playing, from classic style, to animated remakes to smaller challenges. Play can either be coop or hotseat.

116379.name: New Japan Pro Wrestling: Tōhkon Road Brave Spirits 2, The Next Generation

videogameseries.16973: New Japan Pro Wrestling: Tohkon Road Brave Spirits

116379.description:
User Summary
Officially licensed sequal to New Japan Pro Wrestling: Tohkon Road Brave Spirits with updated features including a roster of 26 wrestlers and new entrance scenes.

116380.name: Simply Gomoku
116380.description:
"Gomoku is an abstract strategy board game. Also called Gobang or Five in a Row, it is traditionally played with go pieces (black and white stones) on a go board (19x19 intersections); however, because once placed, pieces are not moved or removed from the board, gomoku may also be played as a paper and pencil game. This game is known in several countries under different names.

Black plays first, and players alternate in placing a stone of their color on an empty intersection. The winner is the first player to get an unbroken row of five stones horizontally, vertically, or diagonally."

Source: Wikipedia, "Gomoku", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116381.name: Hired Gun
116381.description:
User Summary

In Hired Gun you are a crack sharpshooter for hire, if you decide to accept this mission you have to eradicate all threats to the organization.

The game features full tilt control for your sniper and cartoonish graphics.

116382.name: 64 Trump Collection: Alice no Waku Waku Trump World
116382.description:
User Summary
A trump based battle game with an Alice in Wonderland theme. In Story Mode you must battle through the seven stages against various characters from Wonderland. In standard mode you can play 15 classic card games including ドボン (Dobon), ポーカー (Poker),スピード (Speed), セブブリッジ (Seven Bridges), フリーヒル (Free Hill), ババ抜き (Old Maid), ページワン (Page One), フォーチュンシャッフル (Fortune Shuffle), ダウト (Doubt), 大富豪 (Millionaire), 七ならべ (Line Up 7), 神経衰弱 (Nervous brekadown), クロンダイク (Klondike), ブラックジャック (Black Jack) and 生活判断 (Life Decision).

116383.name: Kidiquoi
116383.description:
Each player chooses an animal and play it simultanously.
When one and the same animal is present on several cards, the first player to imitate his voice wins the card. The player with the most points is declared "Grand Winner".

The are also several other variants of this card game.

116384.name: Total Eclipse II: The Sphinx Jinx
116384.description:
User Summary:
Total Eclipse II: The Sphinx Jinx is a first person puzzle game by Incentive software. The aim of the game is to collect 12 parts of the sphinx, and defeat High Priest Re.

116385.name: Kikiriko
116385.description:
Each player takes a set of 28 cards. All players chooses one animal they are course the game placing the card of this animal in front of him. The game begins.
All players turns around the top card of their deck. When two identical cards are on the table the owners of the cards must imitate the voice of the opponent's animal. The winner gives all his cards in front of him to the loser. Whenever a player draws a donkey, he must chancge his ainmal. The game continues until someone gets rid of all his cards. He is the winner.

116386.name: Madden NFL Football
116386.description:
From the back of the box.
Experience all the drama of the NFL in 3D as Madden NFL Football brings your favorite player and team to life like never before.

Set your sites on the Super Bowl with traditional 11-on-11 games or high-scoring fast-paced 5-on-5 action.

Draw up your own plays on offense and defense with the amazing power of the Nintendo 3DS Touch Screen.

116387.name: South Park 10: The Game
116387.description:
South Park 10: The Game is a mobile game based on the animated television series South Park: The Game features ten stages; each stage based upon one episode from each season (one up to ten), each stage is made up of three levels and one bonus level unlocked by collecting a certain amount of Cheesy Poofs.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Park_10:_The_Game," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116388.name: In the Dark
116388.description:
From Introduction:

The PCs are relaxing within their favourite haunt taking a much needed break. Outside, a storm is brewing, and there have been reports of power outages throughout the city. Luckily, wherever the PCs are, has yet to be affected by the power outages.

116389.name: South Park: The Stick of Truth

videogamefranchise.6404: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)

videogamehonor.31537: 2012 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Winner

116389.description:
In the game, players will control a new kid in South Park, in order to make friends with the four main characters of the show, Stan, Kyle, Cartman and Kenny, and to defend the town from various threats.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Park:_The_Game," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116390.name: Oath of Freedom
116390.description:
From Introduction:

The scene begins as the heroes are travelling down a wide country road that cuts through a small valley. It has been raining for several days prior, and in fact has only just let up the morning they left wherever it was they spent the previous night. The road is wet and mud covers their boots (if on foot), or a couple of inches up on their mounts’ hooves.

116391.name: Spencer's Crossing
116391.description:
From Introduction:

It’s getting on towards late afternoon when the posse crosses over a small rise and sees a wooden bridge spanning a lazy, but goodsized river. On the far side sits a rambling, single story building and a small barn. A sign declares this to be “Spencer’s Crossing: Dry Goods and Wet Ones Too!” A man comes around the side of the building carrying a board and a hammer. He sees you, drops the board and hurries out to the trail to intercept you when you cross the bridge.

116392.name: South Park Let's Go Tower Defense Play!
116392.description:
Like in other tower defense games players must destroy waves of enemies using towers strategically placed around a path. In addition players can directly control a character to directly attack the enemies and collect dropped coins in order to buy and place down more towers.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Park_Let%27s_Go_Tower_Def...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116393.name: South Park: Tenorman's Revenge
116393.description:
Players will be able to control the four main characters of the show, Stan, Kyle, Cartman and Kenny, and the goal is to battle minor character Scott Tenorman and his army of gingers, as the kids travel through time.

Source: Wikipedia, "South Park: Tenorman's Revenge," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116394.name: Adventure Idea Factory
116394.description:
From the back of the book:

Fantasy adventures are so easy to make up… slay the dragon, save the princess, stop the advancing goblin horde. But those of us who love science fiction role-playing games have a lot more work to do in coming up with imaginative adventures in the vastness of space.

Until now.

So grab your dice and this booklet… and in a few minutes you’ll have a new and imaginative adventure concept sketched out and just waiting for a group of intrepid players. This book will spur on your imagination, will give you new ideas that you may not have come up with on your own.

This book is compatible with all science fiction role-playing games and contains a large amount of inspiration for game masters.

116395.name: Dragon Quest X: Rise of the Five Tribes
116395.description:
The game is set in a new world, Astoltia, featuring five continents and six playable races. The six races are Human, Ogre, Elf, Dwarf, Puklipo, and Weddie. Players will start as a human character, but after something happens, the character will become one of the other five races.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dragon Quest X," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116396.name: The Battle of Christmas Eve
116396.description:
From Introduction:

The war on terror has opened on a new front — Toyland is at war. The characters are all members of the Toyland Intelligence Committee Terrorism Obstruction Cell (TICTOC), sworn to defend Toyland against aggressors. The adventure centers on a plot to ruin Christmas for one little girl, something TIC-TOC can’t allow to happen.

This one-shot adventure is designed to be played in one or two sessions. You can use the characters provided in the back or encourage your players to come up with their own childhood favorites and start from scratch (give them 6 advancements each, and it’s recommended at least someone in the group has Driving, Knowledge (explosives), Swimming and Climbing). We suggest you
use a floor plan that closely mimics your own house, just make sure you include a living room with a Christmas tree, a kitchen, a bathroom, a bedroom and a set of stairs. The scale in Toyland is 1 game inch = 1 real inch. As a fun alternative to maps you can find a few suitable toys and use your actual house as a playing area. Room sizes vary greatly from house to house however so you may want to double all paces and ranges if your rooms are large to keep things Fast! Furious! And Fun!

116397.name: Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning

videogamefranchise.6404: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)

videogameexpansion.127961: Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning – Teeth of Naros

videogamehonor.31920: 2011 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee

116397.description:
Kingdoms of Amalur will feature "5 distinct regions, 4 playable races, and 3 class trees with 22 abilities per tree." The player starts off as a "blank slate," waking up in a pile of corpses after returning from the dead. The game will utilize a unique "destiny" system, whereby the player can invest in a skill-tree system to unlock various "destinies," which acts as the class system for the game. Combat works based on the timing of button presses, with occasional quicktime events like those in the God of War series.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116398.name: The Hunt
116398.description:
From publisher blurb:

Revised and updated for the Origins award winning Savage Worlds roleplaying system, The Hunt pits your party against a group of frightened yokels who are searching the forest at night for the terror that has plagued their village. Can the heroes prove they are not the culprits? And is there something more dangerous in the woods than peasant superstition?

So, spice up your players? fantasy experience with something a little different. Take a look at the ever-growing range of adventures from Legion Publishing and let your campaign go Critical!

116399.name: You've Got Mail
116399.description:
From Introduction:

Each PC receives a message from a source they trust (if the PCs are already “grouped”, then only one of them receives the message). The message states simply that the source has a job for them, and that they are to meet Mr Purple at a park in the downtown core. A Common Knowledge roll lets them know that this particular area is not the safest of places, and has in fact been the location of several gang fights in recent weeks. The meeting is scheduled for twelve noon sharp, and according to the co-ordinates provided, is in a wide open, publicly accessible area of the park.

116400.name: UnReal World
116400.description:
UnReal World, or UrW, is a unique graphical roguelike RPG taking place in the Far North long, long ago. It brings you a realistic game world rich with historical atmosphere in which northern folklore, knowledge and way of life play an important part. The atmosphere and game features are highly original and compelling. The world of the game is based on the ancient Finland in the late Iron Age.

As a member of one of the nine different cultures you'll enter a very realistic and enchanting game world:

- find excitement in surviving everyday life and the quest for success in the harsh ancient wilderness
- play freely or complete various game tasks in a huge randomly generated world
- skill-based system including dozens of skills from COOKERY to HIDEWORKING
- keep in touch with the indigenous spirit world and the supernatural guardians of nature
- packed with intuitive graphics and pictures, original music and sounds

There are infinite ways to play the game:

as a fisherman, a hermit searching for the peace, a brave adventurer, a rough hunter, a trapper or a tradesman etc. Everything is up to you.

Source: The Game Website.

116401.name: Block Rogue
116401.description:
User Summary

Block Rogue is a puzzle game where the player takes the role of an adventurer, solving a series of randomly configured puzzle dungeons.

116402.description:
Sheep, Dogs and Wolves, invented by Néstor Romeral Andrés and his daugther Elena (at age 4), is a tile-laying game for two players (sheep and wolf) who share a common pool of rectangular pieces depicting a sheep, a dog and a wolf, in that order. The sheep player must save as many sheep as possible, while the wolf must feast on those sheep. Chomp!

Sheep, Dogs and Wolves has two types of game play:


Duel: The players play two complete games, switching roles after the first game. Whoever saves more sheep wins.
Bid: Before the game starts, players take turns make increasing bids as to how many sheep they think they can save. The player who passes first plays the wolf; the other player must save at least as many sheep as he bid to win.


To start play, place one tile on the table. Players, starting with the sheep, alternate placing tiles on the table, with each tile needing to fit in an imaginary square grid and being adjacent to at least one already-placed tile. Once all tiles have been placed, the game ends.

To score, first place a counter on each wolf that has at least two dogs orthogonally adjacent to it; these wolves are "scared" of the dogs and won't eat sheep. Next, place a counter on each sheep adjacent at least to one uncovered wolf; these sheep have been eaten by the wolves. Count each uncovered sheep; these sheep are safe, and the total number of safe sheep is the sheep player's score.
116402.name: Sheep, Dogs and Wolves

116403.name: Area 51 Defense
116403.description:
User Summary

Area 51 Defense is a futuristic tower defense game for the iOS. Area 52 Defense includes: campaign with 51 unique missions, survival mode on 17 maps, 14 types of enemies, 5 types of towers with 12 upgrades per tower & each tower has it's own special ability.

116404.name: Narco Police
116404.description:
User Summary:
Narco Police is a third person shooter. The game was ahead of it's time with a sort of pseudo-3d graphics. The games is inspired by cyberpunk, and the set is a dark science fiction world. The game takes place in the year 2003. You play as a police, boss over three units.

116405.description:
Hidden Empires II is a print-and-play game for 2 to 6 players where each player assumes the role of an ant colony. Players deploy worker ants on an abstracted hex-area map to look for and forage food. Colonies use food to produce more workers to produce more food, etc. Eventually colonies grow large enough to produce reproductive male and female ants. Players score points for each reproductive ant released during a nuptial flight.

A deck of cards provide environmental events and different genetic traits for the various ant species. Conflict between colonies is possible but is not the primary focus of the game. All events, traits, and general game play are based on the natural history of actual ant species.

Hidden Empires II is a major update to Hidden Empires and includes a larger map, less random traits, and clearer rules divided into basic, advanced and optional sections.
116405.name: Hidden Empires II

116406.name: Daredevil Dennis
116406.description:
From Wikipedia: Daredevil Dennis (spelled on screen Dare Devil Denis) is the name of two computer games published by Visions Software. Daredevil Dennis is a platform game of sorts where the player takes the role of Daredevil Dennis, a stuntman. Dennis must use a variety of vehicles (motorbike, jet-ski and ski-doo) to perform a number of stunts. The only controls are accelerate, brake and jump.

Source: Wikipedia, "Daredevil Dennis," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116407.name: Pawn Stars Payout Game
116407.description: Pawn Stars Board Game Pay Out is based on the hit History Channel Show Pawn Stars. As in the television show it is the player's goal to get the best deal for the items coming into the shop. Each turn four items come into the shop and are placed on the playing board. Players roll the three game dice and combine the showing dollar amounts to see who can estimate the actual value of the item. The person coming closest wins the item that round. However, if the player over-estimated the actual item value they take a profit loss and log the item as trash on their score sheet. If the player winning the item that round under-estimated the item they make a profit and the item is scored as a treasure on the score sheet. At the end of the day, profits and losses are totaled up and the player with the largest profit is the winner.

116408.name: Space Laser
116408.description:
User Summary

Space Laser is an early black and white space shooter. Pilot your ship across the bottom of the screen and try to shoot the laser at the top before it shoots you. Avoid and shoot the descending ships or use them for cover.

116409.name: Space Seeker
116409.description:
User Summary

Space Seeker is a color space game. Fly your ship and shoot enemies. Part of the game is a scroller, part is a view from the cockpit to shoot enemies.

116410.name: Space Wipeout
116410.description:
User Summary

Space Wipeout is a clone of space invaders with similar game play but different cabinet graphics and pre-game wording.

116411.name: Speed Race GP-5
116411.description:
User Summary

Speed Race GP-5 is an early driving game from Taito. Race against other cars in an attempt to reach checkpoints and win races.

116412.name: Speed Race Twin
116412.description:
User Summary

A two person variant of Speed Race. Hosts black and white graphics with an overhead view.

116413.name: Steel Worker
116413.description:
User Summary

Steel Worker is an early Taito game. Quickly construct a steel bridge so that your workers can cross and not fall ending the game.

116414.name: Castle Master II: The Crypt

videogamecompilation.220097: Castle Master + Castle Master II: The Crypt

116414.description:
User Summary:
Castle Master II: The Crypt is a first person puzzle game with vector graphics, made with the Freescape engine. The game starts in the crypt under a castle, and the aim is to find the way out.

116415.name: The sunset of Waterloo
116415.description:
You must prepare several dice.
This game is sequel game of Sun of Austerlitz in Game Journal#33.
This game covers the battle of Waterloo in 1815, the last battle of Napoleon.
This game uses the same engine as its sequel game. Players must draw a command chit at random to decide which formation will work next.
The rule is longer than usual GJ's games 12 pages.
The game can be played 4 to 6 hours based on its explanation.

198 counters, 1 game map, rulebook

116416.name: Storming Party
116416.description:
User Summary

In Storming Party, you play a marine in land, sea and air blowing multiple enemies up with machine guns, grenades and other weapons and vehicles that you find along the way.

116417.name: Straight Flush
116417.description:
User Summary

Straight Flush is a ball and paddle game. Bounce the ball up to hit playing card suit symbols.

116418.name: Stratovox
116418.description:
User Summary

Stratovox is an early color and voice game from Taito. Stop aliens that come from one side of the screen from kidnapping astronauts from the other side.

116419.name: Strike Bowling
116419.description:
User Summary

Strike Bowling is a color, overhead view bowling game from Taito.

116420.name: Stunt Typhoon
116420.description:
User Summary

An interesting Japanese racing/driving game where you are a stunt driver and have to drive your car the way the director tells you to.

116421.name: Game News (Issue 7 - Sep 1985)
116421.description:
Cover: Cover is from West End Games Inc.'s Air Cav game. It is printed with West End Games Inc.'s permission.

GAME NEWS is devoted exclusively to adult games and game-related products. GAME NEWS reviews current releases of role-games, war games, general adult games, and surveys new gaming miniatures. GAME NEWS also features cartoons, modules and scenarios, supplements, play-aids, "how-to" tips, and other information to make playing games more fun.

-from the contents page

116422.name: Apples to Apples Dice Game
116422.description:
The trend of popular games being remade as a dice game comes to Apples to Apples. Instead of the cards, the person acting as the judge rolls a green 20 sided die with letters on it, and makes up an adjective that starts with the rolled letter.

Then, red six sided dice with different assortments of letters are rolled, one for each player (except the judge). Those players then grab a die and make up their noun based on that die roll.

The rest of the rules play as normal Apples to Apples. The judge picks his or her favorite of the choices, and the position of judge rotates to the next player. Play until one player has his selected 5 times, denoted by green chips..

116423.name: Super Chase: Criminal Termination
116423.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Super Chase: Criminal Termination", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Super Chase: Criminal Termination is an arcade racing game, released in 1992 by Taito. It is the third release in the Chase H.Q. arcade series, and the sequel to Special Criminal Investigation.
While running on similar hardware as the prior two games, Super Chase differentiated itself by using an updated 68EC020 main CPU, and improved raster graphics.
It also was the first in the Chase H.Q. series to have the protagonist command the car from a first-person view, and have different vehicles available to drive. Nancy, the dispatcher from Chase H.Q. and SCI returns, this time, on a videoscreen inside the car before the start of the stage.

116424.name: Super Cup Finals
116424.description:
User Summary

Super Cup Finals is a 1-4 player soccer game from Taito. Play coop against the machine or head to head.

116425.name: Super Football Champ
116425.description:
User Summary

Super Football Champ is a 1-2 player soccer game from Taito. Offers better graphics and gameplay than their 1994 version.

116426.name: Super Mouse
116426.description:
User Summary

Super Mouse is a platform game where you are a mouse trying to collect objects and food while avoiding enemies. Use five bombs to blow up enemies that get too close.

116427.name: Super Qix
116427.description:
User Summary

Super Qix is a sequel to Qix. Gameplay is nearly identical in that you draw lines to make shapes to close off sections of the surface. In this game, this reveals fantasy images.

116428.name: NCAA March Madness 2002
116428.description:
User Summary

Continuing the EA Sports tradition of having games which cover college basketball, March Madness 2002 marks the debut of the series for PlayStation 2 as an exclusive title. Unlike its signature NBA Live franchise, March Madness sacrifices chrome to fit in the multitude of teams involved in the NCAA's various divisions. Most of the players are unnamed, but the ratings and numbers are supposed to stand in for the capabilities of the players represented.

116429.name: Super Real Mahjong II
116429.description:
User Summary

Super Real Mahjong II is a sequel to Super Real Mahjong with newer graphics and view angles.

116430.name: Super Space Invaders '91
116430.description:
User Summary

Super Space Invaders '91 is the early '90s version of the Popular Space Invaders franchise. Sports color graphics, powerups, team play and levels where you protect cows from getting taken by aliens.

116431.name: Game News (Issue 12 - Feb 1986)
116431.description:
Cover: The cover is from Star Trek: The Adventure Game which is a product of West End Games, Inc. copyright 1985.
Star Trek (restricted, copyright 1985) is a product of Paramount Pictures Corporation. All rights reserved.

GAME NEWS is devoted exclusively to adult games and game-related products. GAME NEWS reviews current releases of role-games, war games, general adult games, and surveys new gaming miniatures. GAME NEWS also features cartoons, modules and scenarios, supplements, play-aids, "how-to" tips, and other information to make playing games more fun.

-from the contents page

116432.name: Super Speed Race GP-V
116432.description:
User Summary

Super Speed Race GP-V is an early racing game from Taito. Cabinets were offered in both standing and enclosed seated versions. Graphics are simple color with an overhead veiw. Race against time to try to get further and get high score.

116433.name: Super Speed Race Jr.
116433.description:
User Summary

Super Speed Race Jr. is a sequel to the 1980 Super Speed Race. It offers greatly improved graphics and game play. Race against computerized opponents and time.

116434.name: Super Speed Race V
116434.description:
User Summary

Super Speed Race V is an early racing game from Taito. Features an overhead view with very simple color graphics. Race against time in order to get a high score.

116435.name: NCAA March Madness 2004
116435.description:
User Summary

NCAA March Madness 2004 is the third installment in the March Madness series to be released on PlayStation 2 and the first installment to reach the Xbox, thus marking the end of the series as an exclusive for Sony consoles. The game itself features team updates for the NCAA 2003-2004 season.

116436.name: Bard's Tale Construction Kit
116436.description:
The Bard's Tale Construction Set is computer software that allows the user to create simple dungeon crawl video games using The Bard's Tale game engine. It was created by Interplay Productions in 1991 and distributed by Electronic Arts. It was released for the Amiga and DOS.

Since it was not required to own The Bard's Tale Construction Set in order to play games which were created with it, one could easily distribute his or her own created games among other people.

Included with the software was a sample scenario for the purpose of playing and learning from, entitled Star Light Festival.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bard%27s_Tale_Construction_Set,...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

116437.name: Game News (Special Issue no 1 - 1985)
116437.description:
This special edition has 16 sample pages from the first three issues of GAME NEWS (March, April, May 1985). We give you more than 40 pages every month of news, reviews, scenarios, modules, variants, cartoons, and more!

-from the front mailing cover.

All pages in this issue were exactly as they appeared in the original issues, including page numbers and dates.

116438.name: T.T Block
116438.description:
User Summary

T.T Block is an early ball and paddle game from Taito. Game play is almost identical to Breakout.

116439.name: T.T Mahjong
116439.description:
User Summary

T.T Mahjong is an early Mahjong game from Taito. Simple graphics representing normal play.

116440.name: Taito Cup Finals
116440.description:
User Summary

Taito Cup Finals is an early '90s soccer game from Taito. Play is by normal soccer rules. Enter more quarters to get more time. Play is either coop or head to head.

116441.name: Time Tunnel
116441.description:
User Summary

In Time Tunnel, you drive your train through different tunnels and times. Try to deliver as many passengers before you run out of fuel.

116442.name: Tin Star (Arcade)
116442.description:
User Summary

In Tin Star, you are a sheriff and go about clearing the town of bandits and other western bad guys from various buildings with your trusty six shooter.

116443.name: Tokio
116443.description:
User Summary

In Tokio, you fly your plane over the city of Tokio and shoot near endless planes, tanks and other enemies in an attempt to clear the city.

116444.name: Top Bowler
116444.description:
User Summary

Top Bowler is an early color bowling game from Taito. Graphics are color and at a 3/4 view.

116445.name: Top Landing
116445.description:
User Summary

Top Landing is a flight simulator from Taito. It was a large enclosed sit down cabinet that required an attendant. Graphics were simple for the time but much of the cabinet moved to give it a realistic feel.

116446.name: Top Speed
116446.description:
User Summary

Top Speed is a driving game from Taito. Graphics are color but simple for the time. Choose from different color cars and race against time. Avoid other cars and obstacles. Reach the checkpoints before time runs out to continue.

116447.name: Tournament Arkanoid
116447.description:
User Summary

Tournament Arkanoid is a follow-up to the popular Arkanoid based on Breakout. Use your paddle to knock the ball up to destroy blocks and enemies that get in the way. Collect various powerups to help or hider play.

116448.name: Tranquilizer Gun
116448.description:
User Summary

Tranquilizer Gun is a maze game where you run around shooting animals and returning them to your truck for sale on the open market (points.)

116449.name: Scrabble Book Lovers
116449.description:
In this classic word game, players use their seven drawn letter-tiles to form words on the gameboard. Each word laid out earns points based on the commonality of the letters used, with certain board spaces giving bonuses. But a word can only be played if it uses at least one already-played tile or adds to an already-played word. This leads to slightly tactical play, as potential words are rejected because they would give an opponent too much access to the better bonus spaces.

The perfect edition of Scrabble for the Book Lover! Bonus points are awarded with the use of any author name, book title, or literary character.

116450.name: Tube-It
116450.description:
User Summary

Tube-It is a drop and block game like Tetris. You drop blocks with tubes and try to complete the tubes from one side of your screen to the other. When that is done, they drop on your opponent.

116451.name: Twin Cobra 2
116451.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Twin Cobra II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Twin Cobra II is a 1995 arcade game published by Taito Corporation for the video arcade market. It is the sequel to Twin Cobra.

116452.name: Twin Qix
116452.description:
User Summary

Twin Qix is an updated two player version of the original Qix. Players each have their own play areas to cordon off space. The graphics are much better in color and with many more enemies.

116453.name: U.A.G. (Un-Attached Grenadier)
116453.description:
User Summary

In U.A.G., you ride your mororcycle while gunning down enemies through multiple levels. Try not to get shot and advance to bosses and new levels.

116454.name: Ultra Quiz
116454.description:
User Summary

Ultra Quiz is a trivia game from Taito that was produced from 1983 to 1987.

116455.name: Under Fire (Arcade)
116455.description:
User Summary

Under Fire is a coop light gun game from Taito. Play police officers taking down enemies and trying not to get shot. The guns vibrate when fired.

116456.name: Undoukai
116456.description:
User Summary

Undoukai is a women's track and field game. Play through multiple events and try to beat the other opponents and records.

116457.name: Victorious Nine
116457.description:
User Summary

Victorious Nine is a head to head baseball game from Taito. Try to score the most runs in the time given. Add quarters for more innings.

116458.name: Violence Fight
116458.description:
User Summary

Violence Fight is a head to head fighting game. Win 2 of 3 matches with one of four characters to advance. Scenery is of various cityscapes.

116459.name: Violence Fight II
116459.description:
User Summary

Violence Fight II is the sequel to it's 1989 predecesor. Fight head to head through new backgrounds with new characters and special moves. Win 2 of 3 matches to advance.

116460.name: Mixed Nationalities
116460.description:
Party guests are given a card with the names of countries on them, but they are all messed around, anagrams and the like.

The guest or team who get the most right answers, wins.

116461.name: Wall Block
116461.description:
User Summary

Wall Block is an early ball and paddle game like Breakout. Graphics are very simplistic. Use the ball to break the blocks.

116462.name: Warrior Blade: Rastan Saga Episode III
116462.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Warrior Blade: Rastan Saga Episode III", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Warrior Blade: Rastan Saga Episode III is an arcade game released by Taito Corporation in 1991. It is a weapons brawler similar to Golden Axe, and its main feature is the use of dual screens to depict the action. There are two other selectable characters besides Rastan this time around, a hireling named Dewey and a thief named Sophia.

116463.name: Missing Words
116463.description:
The guests are read a short story with blanks at certain points. The game is for the guests to fit in the correct words during the evening. The most right answers, wins.

The box also contains two more modest party games. Public Notices asks all participating guests to fill in the gaps on well known notices. And Change a Letter tests their knowledge of animals. Each player is given a list of words and they have to change just one letter to make it the name of an animal.

116464.name: Water Ski
116464.description:
User Summary

Water Ski is an early Taito sports game. Features color graphics and an overhead view. Drive your skier through the water while avoiding obstacles in order to reach the end of the level.

116465.name: WGP
116465.description:
User Summary

WGP is a Taito racing game. Ride your motorcycle through various tracks. Race against time and opponents.

116466.name: WGP 2
116466.description:
User Summary

WGP 2 is the sequel to the populare WGP Arcade game. Features updated graphics, new tracks, new motorcycles and extended play. Race against time and opponents to win races and advance.

116467.name: Top 2000 Het Spel
116467.description:
Named after the famous music chart that is broadcast nonstop in the last week of each year, this game will test players' musical knowledge ranging from the sixties all the way to the zeros.

The game features two modes. You can play one after the other or just choose one. Firstly, the easier popquiz. Throw the dice, answer the question and reach the end. Secondly, the difficult knowledge quiz. Questions get harder and only the true music lover will reach the end.

116468.name: La Scatola degli Enigmi
116468.description:
Players or teams compete in puzzle-solving (sometimes timed, sometimes not) in order to score points in different categories.
The first team (or player) to score a point in 4 of the 6 categories wins the game.

Every turn, the current player/team draws a card and hands it to the Dealer, a non-competitive figure that reads it aloud and then manages the competition between the people trying to solve the riddle.

There are 6 categories: Linguistics, Mathematics, Logic, Rebus, Manipulation and Observation

116469.name: Flitsch
116469.description:
objective: be the first shuffling all your pucks into opponent's territory
main game:
- acting by turn -
each player is shuffling his 6 pucks (black or white) into opponent's territory with a tensed shirr;
try to push back already placed opponent's pucks, too.
1st round ends after all pucks are moved;
bad luck: if you hit opponent's shirr and your puck is pushed back into your own territory;
2nd round: remove successful positioned pucks and start playing the game with the residual pucks
3rd round: dito...
related to:
jakkolo, shuffle-board games...
remarks: mainly positioned for army people - see cover

116470.description:
There are 50 cards divided into two families, 25 cards with Philibert the quirky cat and 25 cards with Philibert's wardrobe and clothes.

The 25 cards with wardrobes are placed face-up on the table. The 25 cards with Philibert is placed face down as a deck and is drawn. The first child that identifies the missing garment in the right color from the Philibert's card gets this card. The winner is the player with the most cards at the end of the game.

There are more variants available.
116470.name: Philibert

116471.name: Tzing & Tzang
116471.description:
Tzing is a circus horse. Tzang is his tamer, but he always forgets something in his equipment. We must help him find what he has forgotten.

All cards are spread face-up on the table. Equipment cards are shuffled, top card is drawn and all players are looking horse from the card what equipment is missing. The player who finds the right one wins the card. When all equipment cards have been checked, the game is over. The winner is the one with the most cards.

116473.name: Countries
116473.description:
Promotional game.

In a turn, you draw the top card and give the top clue to the next player. If he knows the correct answer, he claims the card. If he gives the wrong answer or passes, the next clue is given to the player on his left, who will claim the card if they get the answer right. And so on, around the group, until the card is won.

Most cards, wins.

The publisher, a coffee supplier, claims that this is one of 60 games they have published!

116474.name: Ein Licht geht auf
116474.description:
Objective: collect as many points as possible knowing most of the questions
The game has various sets of quiz cards ranging from maths, geography, arts, music to inventions (8).
Upon completing the circuit by touching the two probes to the correct question and answer a light turns on;
additional sets (21) were available;
there are 2 different editions:
small (cardboard) and large (wood)

Comparable with games like Electric Contact Quiz and or Knapp Electric Questioner

116475.name: Zodiac

videogamecompilation.169222: Double Gold: Zodiac / The Search for The Secret of Life

116475.description:
User Summary:
Zodiac is a text adventure with graphics, written using the GAC, and published by Incentive Software. The evil wizard Ramus wants to destroy you. The old wise man of you tribe can tell that the Scripture of Barenola says that Ramus weakness lies in the stars. The mission is to find the twelve signs of the Zodiac, so you can fight the wizard.

116476.name: White House Egg Rolling Game
116476.description:
The board is slanted and it has five holes, each scoring either 10, 25, 50, 75 or 100 points. It is placed at one end of a dining table or on the floor, and players must roll balls at it, hoping to get the ball to stay in one of the holes. The player with the most points, wins.

Bizarre title but that might have been its attraction.

116477.name: The Search for The Secret of Life

videogamecompilation.169222: Double Gold: Zodiac / The Search for The Secret of Life

116477.description:
User Summary:
The Search for The Secret of Life is a text adventure with graphics, written with GAC, and published by Incentive Software. The games is in three parts: The House, The Eighth Sea and The Secret. The goal is to find the secret.

116478.name: Ronnie Waldman's Puzzle Corner
116478.description:
Standard trivia party game. Guests each get a card with six questions on it and then have to work out the answers until the host asks for them to be swapped around. Now you get new questions to answer, and so on. Guest with the most correct answers, wins.

Ronnie Waldman (1914 - 1978) hosted 'Monday Night at Eight', a long-running BBC radio show. One section of the show was 'Puzzle Corner', hence the name of this game.

116479.name: Pa and Ma
116479.description:
Party game. Guests are given a card with 24 'questions' on it. The question takes the form of two clues to two diffent subjects, but the correct answers will rhyme.

Example
Recreation Ground - Answer is Park
Sign - Answer is Mark

The guest with the highest amount of correct answers, wins.

One in the Dainty Series of games.

116480.name: Champion Road Race
116480.description:
A standard roll and move game, published as a promotion by Champion Spark Plugs in the mid-thirties.

The track winds around and features special squares where you have to obey the instructions. You can also take shortcuts and longcuts, if you know what I mean.

First to finish, wins.

116481.name: Alphabet Game
116481.description:
Game published by Chevrolet in their promotional publication called Chevrolet Motoring Fun Game Book.

In this game you are provided with a scene of the family enjoying a picnic. The game is to see how many things you can find that begin with a different letter of the alphabet. I think it was intended to be played in the car on a long journey. So, after a pre-agreed time limit, the first player must pass the picture over to the next player, probably in the seat next to him or her, and that player must see if they can find more than the first player, and so on, until everyone in the car (hopefully not including the driver) has had a turn. The board suggests that if you can get 18 right that would be rated as a 'Fair', 20 right 'Good' and 22 'Very good'.

116482.name: Tall Tales
116482.description:
The storyteller has 30 seconds in which to tell a "shaggy dog story" including three key words listed on a card taken at the start of that player's turn.

The trick is that the storyteller is trying to conceal which three words of the story are on the card.

After the story has been told, the other players may confer and jointly have three guesses as to which words were on the card.

116484.name: Euro Miljonairs
116484.description:
The object of the game is to earn as many euros as possible.

The game takes three rounds. Each player receives a set of fifteen cards with pictures of eight coin and seven banknote values. There are twelve European countries marked with flags. During the rounds players try to gain flags by strategically playing money cards and having the highest deposit for each country. Flags can change hands each round.

At the end of the three rounds, players score according to the flags they have collected. Countries whose flags share a common border allow a player to multiply the value of euro in these countries by 2, 3, or 4. Two countries multiply values by two, three countries by three, etc.

The winner is the player with the most money.

116485.name: Through the Cathode Ray Tube
116485.description:
From Introduction:

Ah, being a college student. Everyone tells you it’s an easy life, with plenty of time to par-tay. Just take the classes, keep your head low, and you’re walk it. Of course, no one says what happens when you get a professor that has it in for you.

That is what ‘Through the Cathode Tube...’ is about. The characters are all final semester college students who the vindictive and evil Dr. Baum has decided to flunk for no good reason. With finals just around the corner, all the students are sweating bullets or sinking into depression as they come to realize there is no way they can pass his class, and without a pass, they can forget graduation.

116486.description: A self-published tactical combat module for Advanced Squad Leader, consisting of a rule leaflet, map section, pre-cut counters, and scenario cards, expanding the game to the Vietnam War. New units and rules include helicopters, war dogs, claymore mines, and other equipment and situations unique to the conflict in SE Asia.
116486.name: Glory & Grief I

116487.name: Back track
116487.description:
User Summary:
Back track is a game by Incentive Software by C.M. Andrew. In the game you walking in a maze with rooms. You see rooms from above, can go into different rooms and find keys. The goal is to find the exit before your "willpower" is out.

116488.name: Twaddle
116488.description:
A basic dictionary game. Players create definitions to words and try to determine which is the real answer.

Choosing the correct definition gets a player 2 points, having a player's definition chosen gets 1 point, and the card reader gets 3 points if nobody chooses the real definition.

Points are tallied and the winner is the one with the most points at the end of the game.

116489.name: Suberle, the Healer's Guild
116489.description:
From publisher blurb:

At last, full details of the Healer's Guild and Suberle, the Goddess of the Healing Waters!

Suberle, the Healer's Guild provides expanded details for the Healer's Guild and the Cult of Suberle given an initial airing in The Lost Isles - Exile. Here are full details of the cult, its relationship with the Guild, new professions and skills, new spells, scenario ideas and a bevy of Healer NPCs to slot into any campaign.

Included in this packed sourcebook:

Details of the Cult of Suberle and the Healer's Guild, and their ongoing relationship
Ranks and responsiblities within the Guild and Cult
Cantrips, Rune and Divine Magic for Healers from our other supplements pulled together into one volume plus NEW spells just for healers
Rules and spells for creating Magic Potions
Craft(Medicine) rules for creating Healing draughts, potions, lotions, antidotes and poultices
Rules for the Healsinger, a Healer who uses song to boost her healing skills
Skill Techniques - new options for existing skills, illustrated here for 'Sing' and by the new Counterspell Technique for Runecasting and Petty-Magick
11 Guild Professions in a single place, including 7 new or tailored professions for the Healer's Guild
Statistics for over 20 Healer Non-Player Characters and their escorts, including apprentices, novices, a wandering healer, Rune levels (Masters), Journeymen, Korlin bodyguards including a Korlin paladin, a Warden, and more...
Encounter ideas, with complications, to spark your own scenarios!

116490.name: Timewise
116490.description:
User Summary:
Timewise is a text adventure with graphics, written by Andrew Pointon, using CAG, and published by HoopSnake Design, after it was refused by Incentive Software. An Middle Eastern terrorist organisation has in the year 2090 creates a atomic bomb. Your goal is to use a time machine and go back in time, to prevent Einstein from discover the theory of relativity.

116491.name: XGRA Extreme G Racing Association
116491.description:
From back of case, US edition
Defy the laws of gravity.

In the future racing is faster- MUCH FASTER. And it's totally merciless, which means ANYTHING GOES. Run by the Extreme Gravity Racing Association, this motorized bloodsport throws teams of futuristic bikes an daredevil riders against one another- through dangerous tracks crossing vast and treacherous landscapes, pushing all to their limits... And beyond!

Select from Rock or dance- 2 different soundtracks to suit your style. Including tracks from BT and more.

116492.name: Aren Tor
116492.description:
From Introduction:

The world changes, and once great towers of vast civilizations become the outposts of younger ones. Such is the legacy of Aren Tor, a watchpost atop a great pinnacle of rock a thousand years ago, all but forgotten to the world in these times, its stair lost amidst trees and drifts of snow. Yet during an adventure, one may stumble upon it, and be led to its heights, where greater adventure awaits . . .

116493.name: Blood Feuds
116493.description:
From Introduction:

For years the borderlands have been a place of strife and slavery. It is a barren wasteland, where the scant trees grow only from the blood spilled in countless battles. The lone symbol of order is the outpost of Caldwell Keep, where a small garrison of Men shelter, hone their fighting skills, heal their wounds, and ever yearn for an end to their duty so that they may go home to their families . . .

116494.name: Chillingham Castle
116494.description:
From Introduction:

There are many ruined castles throughout the lands, forgotten and abandoned, but few indeed are left to shadows when they are still intact and unbroken by siege, but such is the terrifying truth of this one, a castle vacated because it is haunted . . .

116495.name: The Misty Mountain
116495.description:
From Introduction:

Far away, at the edge of civilization, where the world ends and nightmares begin, rise mountains of impassable evil, walls between this world and the next, wherein may be darkness from Ages gone by or an Age yet to be. The greatest such mountains may hold the secrets for any journey, its treasure, its villain, or even one’s undoing. That is if one is brave or foolish enough to seek such a place . . .

116496.name: The Village of Woe
116496.description:
From Introduction:

Not every time the party passes through a town or village are they to find comfort at the inn. For in some towns, there is no comfort and no rest, for the wicked or the virtuous . . .

116497.name: Valhellen Castle
116497.description:
From Introduction:

As the intrepid adventurer rides from town to town, his road watched by shadows walking the ramparts of distant ruins, he often wonders what secrets yet lie hidden in those old castles and towers. The crumbling walls and ancient flagstones each have a tale to tell, and sometimes the silent trumpets of their mysteries invite the brave, the clever and the foolhardy to give their ancient walls and forgotten garrison one more challenge. Who will answer the call to adventure?

116498.name: Fantasia Downloads Book One
116498.description:
User summary:

A collection of the free downloads Aren Tor, Blood Feuds, Chillingham Castle, The Misty Mountain, The Village of Woe and Valhellen Castle.

116499.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 3 No 1 - January 2050)
116499.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, THE DAEMON MECHANIC, DUELING DISCOVERIES, THE FIRING RANGE, 50 YEARS AGO TODAY, GURPS DARKFUTURETECH, HEAVY METAL, NANS TICKER, VIRTUAL AUTODUEL REVIEW, & WADA NEWS.

116500.name: Haunted House (1987)
116500.description:
User Summary:
Haunted House is a text adventure with graphics, by Jason Twigg, made with GAC, and released by Incentive Software. You play as a tramp that seeks a place to sleep in a decrepit, empty house. Locked in the haunted house his mission is to find a way out. It's a small game, with only around 30 locations and about 15 objects to use.
